name: Angle
description:
List of all possible functions to manipulate angles.

Created by <page>Global.Angle</page>.

| Type                | Name                                 | Description                      |
| ------------------- | ------------------------------------ | -------------------------------- |
| <page>number</page> | `p` or `pitch` or `x` or `1` | The pitch component of the angle |
| <page>number</page> | `y` or `yaw` or `y` or `2` | The yaw component of the angle |
| <page>number</page> | `r` or `roll`  or `z` or `3` | The roll  component of the angle |

Metamethod | Second Operand | Description
---------- | -------------- | -----------
`__add` | <page>Angle</page> | Returns new <page>Angle</page> with the result of addition.
`__div` | <page>number</page> | Returns new <page>Angle</page> with the result of division.
`__eq` | <page>any</page> | Compares 2 operands, if they both are <page>Angle</page>, compares each individual component. Doesn't normalize the angles (360 is not equal to 0).
`__index` | <page>number</page> or <page>string</page> | Gets the component of the <page>angle</page>. Returns a number.
`__mul` | <page>number</page> | Returns new <page>Angle</page> with the result of multiplication.
`__newindex` | <page>number</page> or <page>string</page> | Sets the component of the <page>angle</page>. Accepts <page>number</page> and <page>string</page>.
`__sub` | <page>Angle</page> | Returns new <page>Angle</page> with the result of subtraction.
`__tostring` | | Returns `p y r`.
`__unm` | | Returns new Vector with the result of negation.

functions.name: Add
functions.description:
Adds the values of the argument angle to the orignal angle.

This functions the same as angle1 + angle2 without creating a new angle object, skipping object construction and garbage collection.

arguments.name: angle
arguments.description: The angle to add.

functions.name: Div
functions.description: Divides all values of the original angle by a scalar. This functions the same as angle1 / num without creating a new angle object, skipping object construction and garbage collection.

arguments.name: scalar
arguments.description: The number to divide by.

functions.name: Forward
functions.description: Returns a normal vector facing in the direction that the angle points.

returnValues.description: The forward direction of the angle

functions.name: IsZero
functions.description: Returns whether the pitch, yaw and roll are 0 or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the pitch, yaw and roll are 0 or not.

functions.name: Mul
functions.description: Multiplies a scalar to all the values of the orignal angle. This functions the same as num * angle without creating a new angle object, skipping object construction and garbage collection.

arguments.name: scalar
arguments.description: The number to multiply.

functions.name: Normalize
functions.description: Normalizes the angles by applying a module with 360 to pitch, yaw and roll.

functions.name: Right
functions.description: Returns a normal vector facing in the direction that points right relative to the angle's direction.

returnValues.description: The right direction of the angle

functions.name: RotateAroundAxis
functions.description: Rotates the angle around the specified axis by the specified degrees.

arguments.name: axis
arguments.description: The axis to rotate around.

arguments.name: rotation
arguments.description: The degrees to rotate around the specified axis.

functions.name: Set
functions.description: Copies pitch, yaw and roll from the second angle to the first.

arguments.name: originalAngle
arguments.description: The angle to copy the values from.

functions.name: SetUnpacked
functions.description: Sets the p, y, and r of the angle.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: The pitch component of the Angle

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The yaw component of the Angle

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The roll component of the Angle

functions.name: SnapTo
functions.description:
Snaps the angle to nearest interval of degrees.

<note>This will modify the original angle too!</note>

arguments.name: axis
arguments.description: The component/axis to snap. Can be either "p"/"pitch", "y"/"yaw" or "r"/"roll".

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The target angle snap interval

returnValues.description: The snapped angle.

functions.name: Sub
functions.description: Subtracts the values of the argument angle to the orignal angle. This functions the same as angle1 - angle2 without creating a new angle object, skipping object construction and garbage collection.

arguments.name: angle
arguments.description: The angle to subtract.

functions.name: ToTable
functions.description: Returns the angle as a table with three elements.

returnValues.description: The table with elements 1 = p, 2 = y, 3 = r.

functions.name: Unpack
functions.description: Returns the pitch, yaw, and roll components of the angle.

returnValues.description: p, pitch, x, or Angle[1].
y, yaw, or Angle[2].
r, roll, r, or Angle[3].

functions.name: Up
functions.description: Returns a normal vector facing in the direction that points up relative to the angle's direction.

returnValues.description: The up direction of the angle.

functions.name: Zero
functions.description:
Sets pitch, yaw and roll to 0.
This function is faster than doing it manually.

name: bf_read
description: This is the object passed to <page>usermessage.Hook</page> when a message is received. It contains each value stored in the message in sequential order. You should read values from it in the order you wrote them.

functions.name: ReadAngle
functions.description: Reads an returns an angle object from the bitstream.

returnValues.description: The read angle

functions.name: ReadBool
functions.description: Reads 1 bit an returns a bool representing the bit.

returnValues.description: bit

functions.name: ReadChar
functions.description: Reads a signed char and returns a number from -127 to 127 representing the ascii value of that char.

returnValues.description: asciiVal

functions.name: ReadEntity
functions.description: Reads a short representing an entity index and returns the matching entity handle.

returnValues.description: ent

functions.name: ReadFloat
functions.description: Reads a 4 byte float from the bitstream and returns it.

returnValues.description: float

functions.name: ReadLong
functions.description: Reads a 4 byte long from the bitstream and returns it.

returnValues.description: int

functions.name: ReadShort
functions.description: Reads a 2 byte short from the bitstream and returns it.

returnValues.description: short

functions.name: ReadString
functions.description: Reads a null terminated string from the bitstream.

returnValues.description: str

functions.name: ReadVector
functions.description: Reads a special encoded vector from the bitstream and returns it, this function is not suitable to send normals.

returnValues.description: vec

functions.name: ReadVectorNormal
functions.description: Reads a special encoded vector normal from the bitstream and returns it, this function is not suitable to send vectors that represent a position.

returnValues.description: normal

functions.name: Reset
functions.description: Rewinds the bitstream so it can be read again.

name: CEffectData
description: List of all possible functions available for effect data. This is the object returned by the <page text="EffectData">Global.EffectData</page> function and is required for <page>util.Effect</page> function.

functions.name: GetAngles
functions.description: Returns the angles of the effect.

returnValues.description: The angles of the effect

functions.name: GetAttachment
functions.description: Returns the attachment ID for the effect.

returnValues.description: The attachment ID of the effect.

functions.name: GetColor
functions.description: Returns byte which represents the color of the effect.

returnValues.description: The color of the effect

functions.name: GetDamageType
functions.description: Returns the damage type of the effect

returnValues.description: Damage type of the effect, see <page>Enums/DMG</page>

functions.name: GetEntIndex
functions.description: Returns the entity index of the entity set for the effect.

returnValues.description: The entity index of the entity set for the effect.

functions.name: GetEntity
functions.description: Returns the entity assigned to the effect.

returnValues.description: The entity assigned to the effect

functions.name: GetFlags
functions.description: Returns the flags of the effect.

returnValues.description: The flags of the effect.

functions.name: GetHitBox
functions.description: Returns the hit box ID of the effect.

returnValues.description: The hit box ID of the effect.

functions.name: GetMagnitude
functions.description: Returns the magnitude of the effect.

returnValues.description: The magnitude of the effect.

functions.name: GetMaterialIndex
functions.description: Returns the material ID of the effect.

returnValues.description: The material ID of the effect.

functions.name: GetNormal
functions.description: Returns the normalized direction vector of the effect.

returnValues.description: The normalized direction vector of the effect.

functions.name: GetOrigin
functions.description: Returns the origin position of the effect.

returnValues.description: The origin position of the effect.

functions.name: GetRadius
functions.description: Returns the radius of the effect.

returnValues.description: The radius of the effect.

functions.name: GetScale
functions.description: Returns the scale of the effect.

returnValues.description: The scale of the effect

functions.name: GetStart
functions.description: Returns the start position of the effect.

returnValues.description: The start position of the effect

functions.name: GetSurfaceProp
functions.description: Returns the surface property index of the effect.

returnValues.description: The surface property index of the effect

functions.name: SetAngles
functions.description: Sets the angles of the effect.

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The new angles to be set.

functions.name: SetAttachment
functions.description:
Sets the attachment id of the effect to be created with this effect data.

<note>This is internally stored as an integer, but only the first 5 bits will be networked.</note>

arguments.name: attachment
arguments.description: New attachment ID of the effect.

functions.name: SetColor
functions.description: Sets the color of the effect.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: Color represented by a byte.

functions.name: SetDamageType
functions.description: Sets the damage type of the effect to be created with this effect data.

arguments.name: damageType
arguments.description: Damage type, see <page>Enums/DMG</page>.

functions.name: SetEntIndex
functions.description: Sets the entity of the effect via its index.

arguments.name: entIndex
arguments.description: The entity index to be set.

functions.name: SetEntity
functions.description: Sets the entity of the effect to be created with this effect data.

arguments.name: entity
arguments.description: Entity of the effect, mostly used for parenting.

functions.name: SetFlags
functions.description:
Sets the flags of the effect.

<note>This is internally stored as an integer, but only the first 8 bits will be networked.</note>

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: The flags of the effect. Each effect has their own flags.

functions.name: SetHitBox
functions.description:
Sets the hit box index of the effect.

<note>This is internally stored as an integer, but only the first 11 bits will be networked.</note>

arguments.name: hitBoxIndex
arguments.description: The hit box index of the effect.

functions.name: SetMagnitude
functions.description: Sets the magnitude of the effect.

arguments.name: magnitude
arguments.description: The magnitude of the effect.

functions.name: SetMaterialIndex
functions.description:
Sets the material index of the effect.

<note>This is internally stored as an integer, but only the first 11 bits will be networked.</note>

arguments.name: materialIndex
arguments.description: The material index of the effect.

functions.name: SetNormal
functions.description: Sets the normalized direction vector of the effect to be created with this effect data.

arguments.name: normal
arguments.description: The normalized direction vector of the effect.

functions.name: SetOrigin
functions.description: Sets the origin of the effect to be created with this effect data.

arguments.name: origin
arguments.description: Origin of the effect.

functions.name: SetRadius
functions.description:
Sets the radius of the effect to be created with this effect data.

<note>This is clamped internally from 0 to 1023.</note>

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: Radius of the effect.

functions.name: SetScale
functions.description: Sets the scale of the effect to be created with this effect data.

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: Scale of the effect.

functions.name: SetStart
functions.description: Sets the start of the effect to be created with this effect data.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: Start of the effect.

functions.name: SetSurfaceProp
functions.description: Sets the surface property index of the effect.

arguments.name: surfaceProperties
arguments.description: The surface property index of the effect.

name: CLuaEmitter
description: List of all possible functions available for LuaEmitters. This is the object returned by the <page>Global.ParticleEmitter</page> function.

functions.name: Add
functions.description: Creates a new <page>CLuaParticle</page> with the given material and position.

arguments.name: material
arguments.description: The particles material. Can also be an <page>IMaterial</page>.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The position to spawn the particle on.

returnValues.description: The created particle, if any.

functions.name: Draw
functions.description: Manually renders all particles the emitter has created.

functions.name: Finish
functions.description: Removes the emitter and all its particles.

functions.name: GetNumActiveParticles
functions.description: Returns the amount of active particles of this emitter.

returnValues.description: The amount of active particles of this emitter

functions.name: GetPos
functions.description: Returns the position of this emitter. This is set when creating the emitter with <page>Global.ParticleEmitter</page>.

returnValues.description: Position of this particle emitter.

functions.name: Is3D
functions.description: Returns whether this emitter is 3D or not. This is set when creating the emitter with <page>Global.ParticleEmitter</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether this emitter is 3D or not.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns whether this <page>CLuaEmitter</page> is valid or not.

returnValues.description: Whether this <page>CLuaEmitter</page> is valid or not.

functions.name: SetBBox
functions.description:
Sets the bounding box for this emitter.

Usually the bounding box is automatically determined by the particles, but this function overrides it.

arguments.name: mins
arguments.description: The minimum position of the box

arguments.name: maxs
arguments.description: The maximum position of the box

functions.name: SetNearClip
functions.description: This function sets the the distance between the render camera and the emitter at which the particles should start fading and at which distance fade ends ( alpha becomes 0 ).

arguments.name: distanceMin
arguments.description: Min distance where the alpha becomes 0.

arguments.name: distanceMax
arguments.description: Max distance where the alpha starts fading.

functions.name: SetNoDraw
functions.description: Prevents all particles of the emitter from automatically drawing.

arguments.name: noDraw
arguments.description: Whether we should draw the particles ( false ) or not ( true )

functions.name: SetParticleCullRadius
functions.description: The function name has not much in common with its actual function, it applies a radius to every particles that affects the building of the bounding box, as it, usually is constructed by the particle that has the lowest x, y and z and the highest x, y and z, this function just adds/subtracts the radius and inflates the bounding box.

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: Particle radius.

functions.name: SetPos
functions.description: Sets the position of the particle emitter.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: New position.

name: CLuaLocomotion
description: This class is essentially what controls a <page>NextBot</page> NPC. You can access it in a <page>NextBot</page> NPC by using **self.loco** variable.

functions.name: Approach
functions.description: Sets the location we want to get to

arguments.name: goal
arguments.description: The vector we want to get to

arguments.name: goalweight
arguments.description: If unsure then set this to 1

functions.name: ClearStuck
functions.description: Removes the stuck status from the bot

functions.name: FaceTowards
functions.description: Sets the direction we want to face

arguments.name: goal
arguments.description: The vector we want to face

functions.name: GetAcceleration
functions.description: Returns the acceleration speed

returnValues.description: Current acceleration speed

functions.name: GetCurrentAcceleration
functions.description: Returns the current acceleration as a vector

returnValues.description: Current acceleration

functions.name: GetDeathDropHeight
functions.description: Gets the height the bot is scared to fall from

returnValues.description: Current death drop height

functions.name: GetDeceleration
functions.description: Gets the deceleration speed

returnValues.description: Current deceleration speed

functions.name: GetGravity
functions.description: Returns the locomotion's gravity.

returnValues.description: The gravity.

functions.name: GetGroundMotionVector
functions.description: Return unit vector in XY plane describing our direction of motion - even if we are currently not moving

returnValues.description: A vector representing the X and Y movement

functions.name: GetJumpHeight
functions.description: Gets the height of the bot's jump

returnValues.description: Current jump height

functions.name: GetMaxJumpHeight
functions.description: Returns maximum jump height of this <page>CLuaLocomotion</page>.

returnValues.description: The maximum jump height.

functions.name: GetMaxYawRate
functions.description: Returns the max rate at which the NextBot can visually rotate.

returnValues.description: Maximum yaw rate

functions.name: GetNextBot
functions.description: Returns the <page>NextBot</page> this locomotion is associated with.

returnValues.description: The nextbot

functions.name: GetStepHeight
functions.description: Gets the max height the bot can step up

returnValues.description: Current step height

functions.name: GetVelocity
functions.description: Returns the current movement velocity as a vector

returnValues.description: Current velocity

functions.name: IsAreaTraversable
functions.description: Returns whether this <page>CLuaLocomotion</page> can reach and/or traverse/move in given <page>CNavArea</page>.

arguments.name: area
arguments.description: The area to test

returnValues.description: Whether this <page>CLuaLocomotion</page> can traverse given <page>CNavArea</page>.

functions.name: IsAttemptingToMove
functions.description: Returns true if we're trying to move.

returnValues.description: Whether we're trying to move or not.

functions.name: IsClimbingOrJumping
functions.description: Returns true of the locomotion engine is jumping or climbing

returnValues.description: Whether we're climbing or jumping or not

functions.name: IsOnGround
functions.description: Returns whether the nextbot this locomotion is attached to is on ground or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the nextbot is on ground or not.

functions.name: IsStuck
functions.description: Returns true if we're stuck

returnValues.description: Whether we're stuck or not

functions.name: IsUsingLadder
functions.description: Returns whether or not the target in question is on a ladder or not.

returnValues.description: If the target is on a ladder or not.

functions.name: Jump
functions.description: Makes the bot jump

functions.name: SetAcceleration
functions.description: Sets the acceleration speed

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: Speed acceleration (default is 400)

functions.name: SetDeathDropHeight
functions.description: Sets the height the bot is scared to fall from.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: Height (default is 200)

functions.name: SetDeceleration
functions.description: Sets the deceleration speed.

arguments.name: deceleration
arguments.description: New deceleration speed (default is 400)

functions.name: SetDesiredSpeed
functions.description: Sets movement speed.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: The new desired speed

functions.name: SetGravity
functions.description:
Sets the locomotion's gravity.

<note>With values 0 or below, or even lower positive values, the nextbot will start to drift sideways, use <page>CLuaLocomotion:SetVelocity</page> to counteract this.</note>

arguments.name: gravity
arguments.description: New gravity to set. Default is 1000.

functions.name: SetJumpHeight
functions.description: Sets the height of the bot's jump

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: Height (default is 58)

functions.name: SetMaxYawRate
functions.description: Sets the max rate at which the NextBot can visually rotate. This will not affect moving or pathing.

arguments.name: yawRate
arguments.description: Desired new maximum yaw rate

functions.name: SetStepHeight
functions.description: Sets the max height the bot can step up

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: Height (default is 18)

functions.name: SetVelocity
functions.description: Sets the current movement velocity

name: CLuaParticle
description: List of all possible functions available for Lua particles. This is the object returned by the <page>CLuaEmitter:Add</page> function.

functions.name: GetAirResistance
functions.description: Returns the air resistance of the particle.

returnValues.description: The air resistance of the particle

functions.name: GetAngles
functions.description: Returns the current orientation of the particle.

returnValues.description: The angles of the particle

functions.name: GetAngleVelocity
functions.description: Returns the angular velocity of the particle

returnValues.description: The angular velocity of the particle

functions.name: GetBounce
functions.description: Returns the 'bounciness' of the particle.

returnValues.description:
The 'bounciness' of the particle

2 means it will gain 100% of its previous velocity,


1 means it will not lose velocity,


0.5 means it will lose half of its velocity with each bounce.

functions.name: GetColor
functions.description: Returns the color of the particle.

returnValues.description: Red part of the color
Green part of the color
Blue part of the color

functions.name: GetDieTime
functions.description: Returns the amount of time in seconds after which the particle will be destroyed.

returnValues.description: The amount of time in seconds after which the particle will be destroyed

functions.name: GetEndAlpha
functions.description: Returns the alpha value that the particle will reach on its death.

returnValues.description: The alpha value the particle will fade to

functions.name: GetEndLength
functions.description: Returns the length that the particle will reach on its death.

returnValues.description: The length the particle will reach

functions.name: GetEndSize
functions.description: Returns the size that the particle will reach on its death.

returnValues.description: The size the particle will reach

functions.name: GetGravity
functions.description: Returns the gravity of the particle.

returnValues.description: The gravity of the particle.

functions.name: GetLifeTime
functions.description:
Returns the 'life time' of the particle, how long the particle existed since its creation.

This value will always be between 0 and <page>CLuaParticle:GetDieTime</page>.


It changes automatically as time goes.

It can be manipulated using <page>CLuaParticle:SetLifeTime</page>.


If the life time of the particle will be more than <page>CLuaParticle:GetDieTime</page>, it will be removed.

returnValues.description: How long the particle existed, in seconds.

functions.name: GetMaterial
functions.description: Returns the current material of the particle.

returnValues.name: mat
returnValues.description: The material.

functions.name: GetPos
functions.description: Returns the absolute position of the particle.

returnValues.description: The absolute position of the particle.

functions.name: GetRoll
functions.description: Returns the current rotation of the particle in radians, this should only be used for 2D particles.

returnValues.description: The current rotation of the particle in radians

functions.name: GetRollDelta
functions.description: Returns the current rotation speed of the particle in radians, this should only be used for 2D particles.

returnValues.description: The current rotation speed of the particle in radians

functions.name: GetStartAlpha
functions.description: Returns the alpha value which the particle has when it's created.

returnValues.description: The alpha value which the particle has when it's created.

functions.name: GetStartLength
functions.description: Returns the length which the particle has when it's created.

returnValues.description: The length which the particle has when it's created.

functions.name: GetStartSize
functions.description: Returns the size which the particle has when it's created.

returnValues.description: The size which the particle has when it's created.

functions.name: GetVelocity
functions.description: Returns the current velocity of the particle.

returnValues.description: The current velocity of the particle.

functions.name: SetAirResistance
functions.description: Sets the air resistance of the the particle.

arguments.name: airResistance
arguments.description: New air resistance.

functions.name: SetAngles
functions.description: Sets the angles of the particle.

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: New angle.

functions.name: SetAngleVelocity
functions.description: Sets the angular velocity of the the particle.

arguments.name: angVel
arguments.description: New angular velocity.

functions.name: SetBounce
functions.description: Sets the 'bounciness' of the the particle.

arguments.name: bounce
arguments.description:
New 'bounciness' of the particle

2 means it will gain 100% of its previous velocity,


1 means it will not lose velocity,


0.5 means it will lose half of its velocity with each bounce.

functions.name: SetCollide
functions.description: Sets the whether the particle should collide with the world or not.

arguments.name: shouldCollide
arguments.description: Whether the particle should collide with the world or not

functions.name: SetCollideCallback
functions.description: Sets the function that gets called whenever the particle collides with the world.

arguments.name: collideFunc
arguments.description:
Collide callback, the arguments are:




<page>CLuaParticle</page> particle - The particle itself

<page>Vector</page> hitPos - Position of the collision

<page>Vector</page> hitNormal - Direction of the collision, perpendicular to the hit surface

functions.name: SetColor

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red component.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green component.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue component.

functions.name: SetDieTime
functions.description: Sets the time where the particle will be removed.

arguments.name: dieTime
arguments.description: The new die time.

functions.name: SetEndAlpha
functions.description: Sets the alpha value of the particle that it will reach when it dies.

arguments.name: endAlpha
arguments.description: The new alpha value of the particle that it will reach when it dies.

functions.name: SetEndLength
functions.description: Sets the length of the particle that it will reach when it dies.

arguments.name: endLength
arguments.description: The new length of the particle that it will reach when it dies.

functions.name: SetEndSize
functions.description: Sets the size of the particle that it will reach when it dies.

arguments.name: endSize
arguments.description: The new size of the particle that it will reach when it dies.

functions.name: SetGravity
functions.description: Sets the directional gravity aka. acceleration of the particle.

arguments.name: gravity
arguments.description: The directional gravity.

functions.description:
Sets the 'life time' of the particle, how long the particle existed since its creation.

This value should always be between 0 and <page>CLuaParticle:GetDieTime</page>.


It changes automatically as time goes.


If the life time of the particle will be more than <page>CLuaParticle:GetDieTime</page>, it will be removed.

arguments.name: lifeTime
arguments.description: The new life time of the particle.

functions.name: SetLighting
functions.description: Sets whether the particle should be lighted.

arguments.name: useLighting

functions.description: Sets the material of the particle.

arguments.name: mat
arguments.description: The new material to set. Can also be a string.

functions.name: SetNextThink
functions.description: Sets when the particles think function should be called next, this uses the synchronized server time returned by <page>Global.CurTime</page>.

arguments.name: nextThink
arguments.description: Next think time.

functions.name: SetPos
functions.description: Sets the absolute position of the particle.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The new particle position.

functions.name: SetRoll
functions.description: Sets the roll of the particle in radians. This should only be used for 2D particles.

arguments.name: roll
arguments.description: The new rotation of the particle in radians.

functions.name: SetRollDelta
functions.description: Sets the rotation speed of the particle in radians. This should only be used for 2D particles.

arguments.name: rollDelta
arguments.description: The new rotation speed of the particle in radians.

functions.name: SetStartAlpha
functions.description: Sets the initial alpha value of the particle.

arguments.name: startAlpha
arguments.description: Initial alpha.

functions.name: SetStartLength
functions.description: Sets the initial length value of the particle.

arguments.name: startLength
arguments.description: Initial length.

functions.name: SetStartSize
functions.description: Sets the initial size value of the particle.

arguments.name: startSize
arguments.description: Initial size.

functions.name: SetThinkFunction
functions.description: Sets the think function of the particle.

arguments.name: thinkFunc
arguments.description:
Think function. It has only one argument:


<page>CLuaParticle</page> particle - The particle the think hook is set on

functions.description: Sets the velocity of the particle.

arguments.name: vel
arguments.description: The new velocity of the particle.

functions.name: SetVelocityScale
functions.description: Scales the velocity based on the particle speed.

arguments.name: doScale
arguments.description: Use velocity scaling.

name: CMoveData
description:
A class used to store the inputs from <page>CUserCmd</page> and other information related to the current movement simulation, such as velocity, position and so on.

This can only be accessed during <page>GM:SetupMove</page> , <page>GM:Move</page> , <page>GM:PlayerTick</page> and <page>GM:FinishMove</page>.

functions.name: AddKey
functions.description: Adds keys to the move data, as if player pressed them.

arguments.name: keys
arguments.description: Keys to add, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

functions.name: GetAbsMoveAngles
functions.description: Gets the aim angle. Seems to be same as <page>CMoveData:GetAngles</page>.

returnValues.description: Aiming angle

functions.name: GetAngles
functions.description: Gets the aim angle. On client is the same as <page>Entity:GetAngles</page>.

returnValues.description: Aiming angle

functions.name: GetButtons
functions.description: Gets which buttons are down

returnValues.description: An integer representing which buttons are down, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

functions.name: GetConstraintRadius
functions.description: Returns the radius that constrains the players movement.

returnValues.description: The constraint radius

functions.name: GetForwardSpeed
functions.description: Returns the players forward speed.

returnValues.description: speed

functions.name: GetImpulseCommand
functions.description: Gets the number passed to "impulse" console command

returnValues.description: The impulse

functions.name: GetMaxClientSpeed
functions.description: Returns the maximum client speed of the player

returnValues.description: The maximum client speed

functions.name: GetMaxSpeed
functions.description: Returns the maximum speed of the player.

returnValues.description: The maximum speed

functions.name: GetMoveAngles
functions.description: Returns the angle the player is moving at. For more info, see <page>CMoveData:SetMoveAngles</page>.

returnValues.description: The move direction

functions.name: GetOldAngles
functions.description: Gets the aim angle. Only works clientside, server returns same as <page>CMoveData:GetAngles</page>.

returnValues.description: The aim angle

functions.name: GetOldButtons
functions.description: Get which buttons were down last frame

returnValues.description: An integer representing which buttons were down, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

functions.name: GetOrigin
functions.description: Gets the player's position.

returnValues.description: The player's position.

functions.name: GetSideSpeed
functions.description: Returns the strafe speed of the player.

returnValues.description: speed

functions.name: GetUpSpeed
functions.description: Returns the vertical speed of the player. ( Z axis of <page>CMoveData:GetVelocity</page> )

returnValues.description: Vertical speed

functions.name: GetVelocity
functions.description:
Gets the players velocity.

<bug issue="3413">This will return Vector(0,0,0) sometimes when walking on props.</bug>

returnValues.description: The players velocity

functions.name: KeyDown
functions.description: Returns whether the key is down or not

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key to test, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

returnValues.description: Is the key down or not

functions.name: KeyPressed
functions.description: Returns whether the key was pressed. If you want to check if the key is held down, try <page>CMoveData:KeyDown</page>

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key to test, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

returnValues.description: Was the key pressed or not.

functions.name: KeyReleased
functions.description: Returns whether the key was released

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: A key to test, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

returnValues.description: Was the key released or not.

functions.name: KeyWasDown
functions.description:
Returns whether the key was down or not.




Unlike <page>CMoveData:KeyDown</page>, it will return false if <page>CMoveData:KeyPressed</page> is true and it will return true if <page>CMoveData:KeyReleased</page> is true.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key to test, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

returnValues.description: Was the key down or not

functions.name: SetAbsMoveAngles
functions.description: Sets absolute move angles.( ? ) Doesn't seem to do anything.

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: New absolute move angles

functions.name: SetAngles
functions.description:
Sets angles.

<bug issue="2382">This function does nothing.</bug>

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The angles.

functions.name: SetButtons
functions.description: Sets the pressed buttons on the move data

arguments.name: buttons
arguments.description: A number representing which buttons are down, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

functions.name: SetConstraintRadius
functions.description:
Sets the radius that constrains the players movement.


It is unknown what this function does as changing its values doesn't affect player movement.

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: The new constraint radius

functions.name: SetForwardSpeed
functions.description: Sets players forward speed.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: New forward speed

functions.name: SetImpulseCommand
functions.description: Sets the impulse command. This isn't actually utilised in the engine anywhere.

arguments.name: impulse
arguments.description: The impulse to set

functions.name: SetMaxClientSpeed
functions.description:
Sets the maximum player speed. Player won't be able to run or sprint faster then this value.


This also automatically sets <page>CMoveData:SetMaxSpeed</page> when used in the <page>GM:SetupMove</page> hook. You must set it manually in the <page>GM:Move</page> hook.


This must be called on both client and server to avoid prediction errors.


This will **not** reduce speed in air.
<note>Setting this to 0 will not make the player stationary. It won't do anything.</note>

arguments.name: maxSpeed
arguments.description: The new maximum speed

functions.name: SetMaxSpeed
functions.description:
Sets the maximum speed of the player. This must match with <page>CMoveData:SetMaxClientSpeed</page> both, on server and client.


Doesn't seem to be doing anything on it's own, use <page>CMoveData:SetMaxClientSpeed</page> instead.

arguments.name: maxSpeed
arguments.description: The new maximum speed

functions.name: SetMoveAngles
functions.description:
Sets the serverside move angles, making the movement keys act as if player was facing that direction.

<bug issue="1181">This does nothing clientside.</bug>

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: The aim direction.

functions.name: SetOldAngles
functions.description: Sets old aim angles. ( ? ) Doesn't seem to be doing anything.

arguments.name: aimAng
arguments.description: The old angles

functions.name: SetOldButtons
functions.description: Sets the 'old' pressed buttons on the move data. These buttons are used to work out which buttons have been released, which have just been pressed and which are being held down.

arguments.name: buttons
arguments.description: A number representing which buttons were down, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

functions.name: SetOrigin
functions.description: Sets the players position.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position

functions.name: SetSideSpeed
functions.description: Sets players strafe speed.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: Strafe speed

functions.name: SetUpSpeed
functions.description: Sets vertical speed of the player. ( Z axis of <page>CMoveData:SetVelocity</page> )

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: Vertical speed to set

functions.name: SetVelocity
functions.description: Sets the player's velocity

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: The velocity to set

name: CNavArea
description: An object returned by <page>navmesh</page> functions.

functions.name: AddHidingSpot
functions.description:
Adds a hiding spot onto this nav area.

There's a limit of 255 hiding spots per area.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position on the nav area

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description:
Flags describing what kind of hiding spot this is.
* 0 = None (Not recommended)
* 1 = In Cover/basically a hiding spot, in a corner with good hard cover nearby
* 2 = good sniper spot, had at least one decent sniping corridor
* 4 = perfect sniper spot, can see either very far, or a large area, or both
* 8 = exposed, spot in the open, usually on a ledge or cliff

Values over 255 will be clamped.

functions.name: AddToClosedList
functions.description:
Adds this <page>CNavArea</page> to the closed list, a list of areas that have been checked by A* pathfinding algorithm.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).


More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

functions.name: AddToOpenList
functions.description:
Adds this <page>CNavArea</page> to the Open List.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).


More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

functions.name: ClearSearchLists
functions.description:
Clears the open and closed lists for a new search.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).


More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

functions.name: ComputeAdjacentConnectionHeightChange
functions.description: Returns the height difference between the edges of two connected navareas.

returnValues.description: The height change

functions.name: ComputeDirection
functions.description: Returns the <page>Enums/NavDir</page> direction that the given vector faces on this <page>CNavArea</page>.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to compute direction towards.

returnValues.description: The direction the vector is in relation to this <page>CNavArea</page>. See <page>Enums/NavDir</page>.

functions.name: ComputeGroundHeightChange
functions.description: Returns the height difference on the Z axis of the two <page>CNavArea</page>s. This is calculated from the center most point on both <page>CNavArea</page>s.

arguments.name: navArea
arguments.description: The nav area to test against.

returnValues.description: The ground height change.

functions.name: ConnectTo
functions.description:
Connects this <page>CNavArea</page> to another <page>CNavArea</page> or <page>CNavLadder</page> with a one way connection. ( From this area to the target )

See <page>CNavLadder:ConnectTo</page> for making the connection from ladder to area.

arguments.name: area
arguments.description: The <page>CNavArea</page> or <page>CNavLadder</page> this area leads to.

functions.name: Contains
functions.description: Returns true if this <page>CNavArea</page> contains the given vector.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to test.

returnValues.description: True if the vector was inside and false otherwise.

functions.name: Disconnect
functions.description: Disconnects this nav area from given area or ladder. (Only disconnects one way)

arguments.name: area
arguments.description: The <page>CNavArea</page> or <page>CNavLadder</page> this to disconnect from.

functions.name: Draw
functions.description: Draws this navarea on debug overlay.

functions.name: DrawSpots
functions.description: Draws the hiding spots on debug overlay. This includes sniper/exposed spots too!

functions.name: GetAdjacentAreas
functions.description:
Returns a table of all the <page>CNavArea</page>s that have a  ( one and two way ) connection **from** this <page>CNavArea</page>.

If an area has a one-way incoming connection to this <page>CNavArea</page>, then it will **not** be returned from this function, use <page>CNavArea:GetIncomingConnections</page> to get all one-way incoming connections.

See <page>CNavArea:GetAdjacentAreasAtSide</page> for a function that only returns areas from one side/direction.

returnValues.description:
A table of all <page>CNavArea</page> that have a ( one and two way ) connection **from** this <page>CNavArea</page>.

Returns an empty table if this area has no outgoing connections to any other areas.

functions.name: GetAdjacentAreasAtSide
functions.description:
Returns a table of all the <page>CNavArea</page>s that have a ( one and two way ) connection **from** this <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction.

If an area has a one-way incoming connection to this <page>CNavArea</page>, then it will **not** be returned from this function, use <page>CNavArea:GetIncomingConnections</page> to get all incoming connections.

See <page>CNavArea:GetAdjacentAreas</page> for a function that returns all areas from all sides/directions.

arguments.name: navDir
arguments.description: The direction, in which to look for <page>CNavArea</page>s, see <page>Enums/NavDir</page>.

returnValues.description:
A table of all <page>CNavArea</page> that have a ( one and two way ) connection **from** this <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction.

Returns an empty table if this area has no outgoing connections to any other areas in given direction.

functions.name: GetAdjacentCount
functions.description:
Returns the amount of <page>CNavArea</page>s that have a connection ( one and two way ) **from** this <page>CNavArea</page>.

See <page>CNavArea:GetAdjacentCountAtSide</page> for a function that only returns area count from one side/direction.

returnValues.description: The amount of <page>CNavArea</page>s that have a connection ( one and two way ) **from** this <page>CNavArea</page>.

functions.name: GetAdjacentCountAtSide
functions.description:
Returns the amount of <page>CNavArea</page>s that have a connection ( one or two way ) **from** this <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction.

See <page>CNavArea:GetAdjacentCount</page> for a function that returns <page>CNavArea</page> count from/in all sides/directions.

arguments.name: navDir
arguments.description: The direction, in which to look for <page>CNavArea</page>s, see <page>Enums/NavDir</page>.

returnValues.description: The amount of <page>CNavArea</page>s that have a connection ( one or two way ) **from** this <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction.

functions.name: GetAttributes
functions.description: Returns the attribute mask for the given <page>CNavArea</page>.

returnValues.description:
Attribute mask for this <page>CNavArea</page>, see <page>Enums/NAV_MESH</page> for the specific flags.


<note>A navmesh that was generated with nav_quicksave set to 1 will have all <page>CNavArea</page>s attribute masks set to 0</note>

functions.name: GetCenter
functions.description: Returns the center most vector point for the given <page>CNavArea</page>.

returnValues.description: The center vector.

functions.name: GetClosestPointOnArea
functions.description: Returns the closest point of this Nav Area from the given position.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The given position, can be outside of the Nav Area bounds.

returnValues.description: The closest position on this Nav Area.

functions.name: GetCorner
functions.description: Returns the vector position of the corner for the given <page>CNavArea</page>.

arguments.name: cornerid
arguments.description: The target corner to get the position of, takes <page>Enums/NavCorner</page>.

returnValues.description: The corner position.

functions.name: GetCostSoFar
functions.description:
Returns the cost from starting area this area when pathfinding. Set by <page>CNavArea:SetCostSoFar</page>.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).


More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

returnValues.description: The cost so far.

functions.name: GetExposedSpots
functions.description:
Returns a table of very bad hiding spots in this area.

See also <page>CNavArea:GetHidingSpots</page>.

returnValues.description: A table of <page>Vector</page>s

functions.name: GetExtentInfo
functions.description: Returns size info about the nav area.

returnValues.description:
Returns a table containing the following keys:
* <page>Vector</page> hi|
* <page>Vector</page> lo|
* <page>number</page> SizeX|
* <page>number</page> SizeY|
* <page>number</page> SizeZ|

functions.name: GetHidingSpots
functions.description:
Returns a table of good hiding spots in this area.

See also <page>CNavArea:GetExposedSpots</page>.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description:
The type of spots to include.

* 0 = None (Not recommended)
* 1 = In Cover/basically a hiding spot, in a corner with good hard cover nearby
* 2 = good sniper spot, had at least one decent sniping corridor
* 4 = perfect sniper spot, can see either very far, or a large area, or both
* 8 = exposed, spot in the open, usually on a ledge or cliff, same as GetExposedSpots
* Values over 255 and below 0 will be clamped.

returnValues.description: A table of <page>Vector</page>s

functions.name: GetID
functions.description: Returns this <page>CNavArea</page>s unique ID.

returnValues.description: The unique ID.

functions.name: GetIncomingConnections
functions.description:
Returns a table of all the <page>CNavArea</page>s that have a one-way connection **to** this <page>CNavArea</page>.

If a <page>CNavArea</page> has a two-way connection **to or from** this <page>CNavArea</page> then it will not be returned from this function, use <page>CNavArea:GetAdjacentAreas</page> to get outgoing ( one and two way ) connections.

See <page>CNavArea:GetIncomingConnectionsAtSide</page> for a function that returns one-way incoming connections from  only one side/direction.

returnValues.description:
A table of all <page>CNavArea</page>s with one-way connection **to** this <page>CNavArea</page>.

Returns an empty table if there are no one-way incoming connections **to** this <page>CNavArea</page>.

functions.name: GetIncomingConnectionsAtSide
functions.description:
Returns a table of all the <page>CNavArea</page>s that have a one-way connection **to** this <page>CNavArea</page> from given direction.

If a <page>CNavArea</page> has a two-way connection **to or from** this <page>CNavArea</page> then it will not be returned from this function, use <page>CNavArea:GetAdjacentAreas</page> to get outgoing ( one and two way ) connections.

See <page>CNavArea:GetIncomingConnections</page> for a function that returns one-way incoming connections from  all sides/directions.

arguments.name: navDir
arguments.description: The direction, from which to look for <page>CNavArea</page>s, see <page>Enums/NavDir</page>.

returnValues.description:
A table of all <page>CNavArea</page>s with one-way connection **to** this <page>CNavArea</page> from given direction.

Returns an empty table if there are no one-way incoming connections **to** this <page>CNavArea</page> from given direction.

functions.name: GetLadders
functions.description:
Returns all <page>CNavLadder</page>s that have a ( one or two way ) connection **from** this <page>CNavArea</page>.

See <page>CNavArea:GetLaddersAtSide</page> for a function that only returns <page>CNavLadder</page>s in given direction.

returnValues.description: The <page>CNavLadder</page>s that have a ( one or two way ) connection **from** this <page>CNavArea</page>.

functions.name: GetLaddersAtSide
functions.description:
Returns all <page>CNavLadder</page>s that have a ( one or two way ) connection **from** ( one and two way ) this <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction.

See <page>CNavArea:GetLadders</page> for a function that returns <page>CNavLadder</page> from/in all sides/directions.

arguments.name: navDir
arguments.description:
The direction, in which to look for <page>CNavLadder</page>s.

0 = Up ( LadderDirectionType::LADDER_UP )
1 = Down ( LadderDirectionType::LADDER_DOWN )

returnValues.description: The <page>CNavLadder</page>s that have a ( one or two way ) connection **from** this <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction.

functions.name: GetParent
functions.description: Returns the parent <page>CNavArea</page>

returnValues.description: The parent <page>CNavArea</page>

functions.name: GetParentHow
functions.description: Returns how this <page>CNavArea</page> is connected to its parent.

returnValues.description: See <page>Enums/NavTraverseType</page>

functions.name: GetPlace
functions.description: Returns the Place of the nav area.

returnValues.description: The place of the nav area, or no value if it doesn't have a place set.

functions.name: GetRandomAdjacentAreaAtSide
functions.description: Returns a random <page>CNavArea</page> that has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **from** this <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction.

arguments.name: navDir
arguments.description: The direction, in which to look for <page>CNavArea</page>s, see <page>Enums/NavDir</page>.

returnValues.description: The random <page>CNavArea</page> that has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **from** this <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction, if any.

functions.name: GetRandomPoint
functions.description: Returns a random point on the nav area.

returnValues.description: The random point on the nav area.

functions.name: GetSizeX
functions.description: Returns the width this Nav Area.

functions.name: GetSizeY
functions.description: Returns the height of this Nav Area.

functions.name: GetTotalCost
functions.description:
Returns the total cost when passing from starting area to the goal area through this node. Set by <page>CNavArea:SetTotalCost</page>.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).


More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

returnValues.description: The total cost

functions.name: GetZ
functions.description: Returns the elevation of this Nav Area at the given position.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to get the elevation from, the z value from this position is ignored and only the X and Y values are used to this task.

returnValues.description: The elevation.

functions.name: HasAttributes
functions.description: Returns true if the given <page>CNavArea</page> has this attribute flag set.

arguments.name: attribs
arguments.description: Attribute mask to check for, see <page>Enums/NAV_MESH</page>

returnValues.description: True if the <page>CNavArea</page> matches the given mask. False otherwise.

functions.name: IsBlocked
functions.description: Returns whether the nav area is blocked or not, i.e. whether it can be walked through or not.

arguments.name: teamID
arguments.description:
The team ID to test, -2 = any team.

Only 2 actual teams are available, 0 and 1.

arguments.name: ignoreNavBlockers
arguments.description: Whether to ignore [func_nav_blocker](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Func_nav_blocker) entities.

returnValues.description: Whether the area is blocked or not

functions.name: IsClosed
functions.description:
Returns whether this node is in the Closed List.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).


More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

returnValues.description: Whether this node is in the Closed List.

functions.name: IsConnected
functions.description:
Returns whether this <page>CNavArea</page> has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **to** given <page>CNavArea</page>.

See <page>CNavArea:IsConnectedAtSide</page> for a function that only checks for outgoing connections in one direction.

arguments.name: navArea
arguments.description: The <page>CNavArea</page> to test against.

returnValues.description: Whether this <page>CNavArea</page> has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **to** given <page>CNavArea</page>.

functions.name: IsConnectedAtSide
functions.description:
Returns whether this <page>CNavArea</page> has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **to** given <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction.

See <page>CNavArea:IsConnected</page> for a function that checks all sides.

arguments.name: navArea
arguments.description: The <page>CNavArea</page> to test against.

arguments.name: navDirType
arguments.description: The direction, in which to look for the connection. See <page>Enums/NavDir</page>

returnValues.description: Whether this <page>CNavArea</page> has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **to** given <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction.

functions.name: IsCoplanar
functions.description: Returns whether this Nav Area is in the same plane as the given one.

arguments.name: navArea
arguments.description: The Nav Area to test.

returnValues.description: Whether we're coplanar or not.

functions.name: IsFlat
functions.description: Returns whether this Nav Area is flat within the tolerance of the **nav_coplanar_slope_limit_displacement** and **nav_coplanar_slope_limit** convars.

returnValues.description: Whether this CNavArea is mostly flat.

functions.name: IsOpen
functions.description:
Returns whether this area is in the Open List.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).


More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

returnValues.description: Whether this area is in the Open List.

functions.name: IsOpenListEmpty
functions.description:
Returns whether the Open List is empty or not.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).


More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

returnValues.description: Whether the Open List is empty or not.

functions.name: IsOverlapping
functions.description: Returns if this position overlaps the Nav Area within the given tolerance.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The overlapping position to test.

arguments.name: tolerance
arguments.description: The tolerance of the overlapping, set to 0 for no tolerance.

returnValues.description: Whether the given position overlaps the Nav Area or not.

functions.name: IsOverlappingArea
functions.description: Returns true if this <page>CNavArea</page> is overlapping the given <page>CNavArea</page>.

arguments.name: navArea
arguments.description: The <page>CNavArea</page> to test against.

returnValues.description: True if the given <page>CNavArea</page> overlaps this <page>CNavArea</page> at any point.

functions.name: IsRoughlySquare
functions.description: Returns if we're shaped like a square.

returnValues.description: If we're a square or not.

functions.name: IsUnderwater
functions.description: Whether this Nav Area is placed underwater.

returnValues.description: Whether we're underwater or not.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns whether this <page>CNavArea</page> is valid or not.

returnValues.description: Whether this <page>CNavArea</page> is valid or not.

functions.name: IsVisible
functions.description: Returns whether we can be seen from the given position.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to check.

returnValues.description: Whether we can be seen or not.
If we can be seen, this is returned with either the center or one of the corners of the Nav Area.

functions.name: PlaceOnGround
functions.description: Drops a corner or all corners of a <page>CNavArea</page> to the ground below it.

arguments.name: corner
arguments.description: The corner(s) to drop, uses <page>Enums/NavCorner</page>

functions.name: PopOpenList
functions.description:
Removes a CNavArea from the Open List with the lowest cost to traverse to from the starting node, and returns it.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).


More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

returnValues.description: The CNavArea from the Open List with the lowest cost to traverse to from the starting node.

functions.name: Remove
functions.description: Removes the given nav area.

functions.name: RemoveFromClosedList
functions.description:
Removes this node from the Closed List.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).


More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

functions.name: SetAttributes
functions.description: Sets the attributes for given CNavArea.

arguments.name: attribs
arguments.description: The attribute bitflag. See <page>Enums/NAV_MESH</page>

functions.name: SetCorner
functions.description: Sets the position of a corner of a nav area.

arguments.name: corner
arguments.description: The corner to set, uses <page>Enums/NavCorner</page>

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The new position to set.

functions.name: SetCostSoFar
functions.description:
Sets the cost from starting area this area when pathfinding.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).


More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

arguments.name: cost
arguments.description: The cost so far

functions.name: SetParent
functions.description: Sets the new parent of this <page>CNavArea</page>.

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: The new parent to set

functions.name: SetPlace
functions.description:
Sets the Place of the nav area.

There is a limit of 256 Places per nav file.

arguments.name: place
arguments.description: Set to "" to remove place from the nav area.

returnValues.description: Returns true of operation succeeded, false otherwise.

functions.name: SetTotalCost
functions.description:
Sets the total cost when passing from starting area to the goal area through this node.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).


More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

arguments.name: cost
arguments.description:
The total cost of the path to set.

Must be above or equal 0.

functions.name: UpdateOnOpenList
functions.description:
Moves this open list to appropriate position based on its <page>CNavArea:GetTotalCost</page> compared to the total cost of other areas in the open list.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).


More information can be found on the <page>Simple Pathfinding</page> page.

name: CNavLadder
description: An object that represents a ladder for Nextbots.

functions.name: ConnectTo
functions.description:
Connects this ladder to a <page>CNavArea</page> with a one way connection. ( From this ladder to the target area ).

See <page>CNavArea:ConnectTo</page> for making the connection from area to ladder.

arguments.name: area
arguments.description: The area this ladder leads to.

functions.name: Disconnect
functions.description: Disconnects this ladder from given area in a single direction.

arguments.name: area
arguments.description: The <page>CNavArea</page> this to disconnect from.

functions.name: GetBottom
functions.description: Returns the bottom most position of the ladder.

returnValues.description: The bottom most position of the ladder.

functions.name: GetBottomArea
functions.description: Returns the bottom area of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

functions.name: GetID
functions.description: Returns this <page>CNavLadder</page>s unique ID.

returnValues.description: The unique ID.

functions.name: GetLength
functions.description: Returns the length of the ladder.

returnValues.description: The length of the ladder.

functions.name: GetNormal
functions.description: Returns the direction of this <page>CNavLadder</page>. ( The direction in which players back will be facing if they are looking directly at the ladder )

returnValues.description: The direction of this <page>CNavLadder</page>.

functions.name: GetPosAtHeight
functions.description: Returns the world position based on given height relative to the ladder.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The Z position in world space coordinates.

returnValues.description: The closest point on the ladder to that height.

functions.name: GetTop
functions.description: Returns the topmost position of the ladder.

returnValues.description: The topmost position of the ladder.

functions.name: GetTopBehindArea
functions.description: Returns the top behind <page>CNavArea</page> of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

returnValues.description: The top behind <page>CNavArea</page> of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

functions.name: GetTopForwardArea
functions.description: Returns the top forward <page>CNavArea</page> of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

returnValues.description: The top forward <page>CNavArea</page> of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

functions.name: GetTopLeftArea
functions.description: Returns the top left <page>CNavArea</page> of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

returnValues.description: The top left <page>CNavArea</page> of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

functions.name: GetTopRightArea
functions.description: Returns the top right <page>CNavArea</page> of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

returnValues.description: The top right <page>CNavArea</page> of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

functions.name: GetWidth
functions.description: Returns the width of the ladder in Hammer Units.

returnValues.description: The width of the ladder in Hammer Units.

functions.name: IsConnectedAtSide
functions.description: Returns whether this <page>CNavLadder</page> has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **to** given <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction.

arguments.name: navArea
arguments.description: The <page>CNavArea</page> to test against.

arguments.name: navDirType
arguments.description: The direction, in which to look for the connection. See <page>Enums/NavDir</page>

returnValues.description: Whether this <page>CNavLadder</page> has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **to** given <page>CNavArea</page> in given direction.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns whether this <page>CNavLadder</page> is valid or not.

returnValues.description: Whether this <page>CNavLadder</page> is valid or not.

functions.name: Remove
functions.description: Removes the given nav ladder.

functions.name: SetBottomArea
functions.description: Sets the bottom area of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

functions.name: SetTopBehindArea
functions.description: Sets the top behind area of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

functions.name: SetTopForwardArea
functions.description: Sets the top forward area of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

functions.name: SetTopLeftArea
functions.description: Sets the top left area of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

functions.name: SetTopRightArea
functions.description: Sets the top right area of the <page>CNavLadder</page>.

name: CNewParticleEffect
description: This object represents a .pcf ( Orange Box ) particle system. Created by <page>Entity:CreateParticleEffect</page> and <page>Global.CreateParticleSystem</page>.

functions.name: AddControlPoint
functions.description:
Adds a control point to the particle system.

<note>This function will not work if the <page>CNewParticleEffect:GetOwner</page> entity is not valid</note>

arguments.name: cpID
arguments.description: The control point ID, 0 to 63.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to attach the control point to.

arguments.name: partAttachment
arguments.description: See <page>Enums/PATTACH</page>.

arguments.name: entAttachment
arguments.description: The attachment ID on the entity to attach the particle system to

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The offset from the <page>Entity:GetPos</page> of the entity we are attaching this CP to.

functions.name: GetEffectName
functions.description: Returns the name of the particle effect this system is set to emit.

returnValues.description: The name of the particle effect.

functions.name: GetHighestControlPoint
functions.description: Returns the highest control point number for given particle system.

returnValues.description: The highest control point number for given particle system, 0 to 63.

functions.name: GetOwner
functions.description: Returns the owner of the particle system, the entity the particle system is attached to.

returnValues.description: The owner of the particle system.

functions.name: IsFinished
functions.description: Returns whether the particle system has finished emitting particles or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the particle system has finished emitting particles or not.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns whether the particle system is valid or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the particle system is valid or not.

functions.name: IsViewModelEffect
functions.description: Returns whether the particle system is intended to be used on a view model?

functions.name: Render
functions.description:
Forces the particle system to render using current rendering context.

Can be used to render the particle system in vgui panels, etc.

Used in conjunction with <page>CNewParticleEffect:SetShouldDraw</page>.

functions.name: Restart
functions.description: Forces the particle system to restart emitting particles.

functions.name: SetControlPoint
functions.description: Sets a value for given control point.

arguments.name: cpID
arguments.description: The control point ID, 0 to 63.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to set for given control point.

functions.name: SetControlPointEntity
functions.description: Essentially makes child control point follow the parent entity.

arguments.name: child
arguments.description: The child control point ID, 0 to 63.

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: The parent entity to follow.

functions.name: SetControlPointForwardVector
functions.description: Sets the forward direction for given control point.

arguments.name: cpID
arguments.description: The control point ID, 0 to 63.

arguments.name: forward
arguments.description: The forward direction for given control point

functions.name: SetControlPointOrientation
functions.description: Sets the orientation for given control point.

arguments.name: cpID
arguments.description: The control point ID, 0 to 63.

arguments.name: forward
arguments.description: The forward direction for given control point

arguments.name: right
arguments.description: The right direction for given control point

arguments.name: up
arguments.description: The up direction for given control point

functions.name: SetControlPointParent
functions.description: Essentially makes child control point follow the parent control point.

arguments.name: child
arguments.description: The child control point ID, 0 to 63.

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: The parent control point ID, 0 to 63.

functions.name: SetControlPointRightVector
functions.description: Sets the right direction for given control point.

arguments.name: cpID
arguments.description: The control point ID, 0 to 63.

arguments.name: right
arguments.description: The right direction for given control point.

functions.name: SetControlPointUpVector
functions.description: Sets the upward direction for given control point.

arguments.name: cpID
arguments.description: The control point ID, 0 to 63.

arguments.name: upward
arguments.description: The upward direction for given control point

functions.name: SetShouldDraw
functions.description:
Forces the particle system to stop automatically rendering.

Used in conjunction with <page>CNewParticleEffect:Render</page>.

arguments.name: should
arguments.description: Whether to automatically draw the particle effect or not.

functions.name: SetSortOrigin
functions.description: Sets the sort origin for given particle system. This is used as a helper to determine which particles are in front of which.

arguments.name: origin
arguments.description: The new sort origin.

functions.name: StartEmission
functions.description: Starts the particle emission.

functions.name: StopEmission
functions.description: Stops the particle emission.

functions.name: StopEmissionAndDestroyImmediately
functions.description:
Stops particle emission and destroys all particles instantly. Also detaches the particle effect from the entity it was attached to.

<note>This function will work identically to <page>CNewParticleEffect:StopEmission</page>( false, true ) if  <page>CNewParticleEffect:GetOwner</page> entity is not valid.</note>

Consider using <page>CNewParticleEffect:StopEmission</page>( false, true ) instead, which has same effect, but doesn't require owner entity, and does't detach the particle system from its entity.

name: Color
description:
List of all possible functions to manipulate colors.

Colors are implemented in Lua thus <page>Global.type</page>(color) == "table" and <page>Global.TypeID</page>(color) == <page text="TYPE_TABLE">Enums/TYPE#table</page>.

For type checking use <page>Global.IsColor</page>.

Created by <page>Global.Color</page>, <page>Global.HSVToColor</page>, and <page>Global.HSLToColor</page>.

| Type                | Name  | Description                       |
| ------------------- | ----- | --------------------------------- |
| <page>number</page> | **r** | The red component of the color.   |
| <page>number</page> | **g** | The green component of the color. |
| <page>number</page> | **b** | The blue component of the color.  |
| <page>number</page> | **a** | The alpha component of the color. |

functions.name: SetUnpacked
functions.description: Sets the red, green, blue, and alpha of the color.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red component

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green component

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue component

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha component

functions.name: ToHSL
functions.description: Converts a <page>Color</page> into HSL color space. This calls <page>Global.ColorToHSL</page> internally.

returnValues.description: The hue in degrees [0, 360).
The saturation in the range [0, 1].
The lightness in the range [0, 1].

functions.name: ToHSV
functions.description: Converts a <page>Color</page> into HSV color space. This calls <page>Global.ColorToHSV</page> internally.

returnValues.description: The hue in degrees [0, 360).
The saturation in range [0, 1].
The value in range [0, 1].

functions.name: ToTable
functions.description: Returns the color as a table with four elements.

returnValues.description: The table with elements 1 = r, 2 = g, 3 = b, 4 = a.

functions.name: ToVector
functions.description:
Translates the Color into a Vector, losing the alpha channel. This will also range the values from 0 - 255 to 0 - 1 r / 255 -> x
g / 255 -> y
b / 255 -> z This is the opposite of Vector:ToColor

returnValues.description: The created <page>Vector</page>

functions.name: Unpack
functions.description: Returns the red, green, blue, and alpha of the color.

returnValues.description: Red
Green
Blue
Alpha

name: ConVar
description: An object returned by <page>Global.CreateConVar</page>, <page>Global.CreateClientConVar</page> (which uses <page>Global.CreateConVar</page> internally), and <page>Global.GetConVar</page>. It represents a console variable. See <page text="this">ConVars</page> page for more information.

functions.name: GetBool
functions.description: Tries to convert the current string value of a <page>ConVar</page> to a boolean.

returnValues.description: The boolean value of the console variable. If the variable is numeric and not 0, the result will be true. Otherwise the result will be false.

functions.name: GetDefault
functions.description: Returns the default value of the <page>ConVar</page>

returnValues.description: The default value of the console variable.

functions.name: GetFlags
functions.description: Returns the <page>Enums/FCVAR</page> flags of the ConVar

returnValues.name: flag
returnValues.description: The bitflag. See <page>Enums/FCVAR</page>

functions.name: GetFloat
functions.description: Attempts to convert the <page>ConVar</page> value to a float

returnValues.description:
The float value of the console variable.


If the value cannot be converted to a float, it will return 0.

functions.name: GetHelpText
functions.description: Returns the help text assigned to that convar.

returnValues.description: The help text

functions.name: GetInt
functions.description: Attempts to convert the <page>ConVar</page> value to a integer.

returnValues.description:
The integer value of the console variable.


If it fails to convert to an integer, it will return 0.


All float/decimal values will be rounded down. ( With <page>math.floor</page> )

functions.name: GetMax
functions.description: Returns the maximum value of the <page>ConVar</page>

returnValues.description: The maximum value of the <page>ConVar</page>

functions.name: GetMin
functions.description: Returns the minimum value of the <page>ConVar</page>

returnValues.description: The minimum value of the <page>ConVar</page>

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: Returns the name of the <page>ConVar</page>.

returnValues.description: The name of the console variable.

functions.name: GetString
functions.description: Returns the current <page>ConVar</page> value as a string.

returnValues.description: The current console variable value as a string.

functions.name: IsFlagSet
functions.description: Returns whether the specified flag is set on the <page>ConVar</page>

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: The <page>Enums/FCVAR</page> flag to test

returnValues.description: Whether the flag is set or not

functions.name: Revert
functions.description: Reverts <page>ConVar</page> to its default value

functions.name: SetBool
functions.description: Sets a ConVar's value to 1 or 0 based on the input boolean. This can only be ran on ConVars created from within Lua.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to set the ConVar to.

functions.name: SetFloat
functions.description: Sets a ConVar's value to to the input number. This can only be ran on ConVars created from within Lua.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to set the ConVar to.

functions.name: SetInt
functions.description: Sets a ConVar's value to the input number after converting it to an integer. This can only be ran on ConVars created from within Lua.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to set the ConVar to.

functions.name: SetString
functions.description: Sets a ConVar's value to the input string. This can only be ran on ConVars created from within Lua.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to set the ConVar to.

name: CRecipientFilter
description: List of all possible functions to manipulate Recipient Filters. Can be created with <page>Global.RecipientFilter</page>.

functions.name: AddAllPlayers
functions.description: Adds all players to the recipient filter.

functions.name: AddPAS
functions.description: Adds all players that are in the same PAS as this position.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: PAS position that players may be able to hear.

functions.name: AddPlayer
functions.description: Adds a player to the recipient filter

arguments.name: Player
arguments.description: Player to add to the recipient filter.

functions.name: AddPVS
functions.description: Adds all players that are in the same PVS as this position.

arguments.name: Position
arguments.description: PVS position.

functions.name: AddRecipientsByTeam
functions.description: Adds all players that are on the given team to the filter.

arguments.name: teamid
arguments.description: Team index to add players from.

functions.name: GetCount
functions.description: Returns the number of valid players in the recipient filter.

returnValues.description: Number of valid players in the recipient filter.

functions.name: GetPlayers
functions.description: Returns a table of all valid players currently in the recipient filter.

returnValues.description: A table of all valid players currently in the recipient filter.

functions.name: RemoveAllPlayers
functions.description: Removes all players from the recipient filter.

functions.name: RemovePAS
functions.description: Removes all players from the filter that are in Potentially Audible Set for given position.

arguments.name: position
