arguments.description: The position to test

functions.name: RemovePlayer
functions.description: Removes the player from the recipient filter.

arguments.name: Player
arguments.description: The player that should be in the recipient filter if you call this function.

functions.name: RemovePVS
functions.description: Removes all players that can see this PVS from the recipient filter.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: Position that players may be able to see.

functions.name: RemoveRecipientsByTeam
functions.description: Removes all players that are on the given team from the filter.

arguments.name: teamid
arguments.description: Team index to remove players from.

functions.name: RemoveRecipientsNotOnTeam
functions.description: Removes all players that are not on the given team from the filter.

arguments.name: teamid
arguments.description: Team index.

name: CSEnt
description:
CSEnt is a client-side only entity which can be created with <page>Global.ClientsideModel</page>, <page>Global.ClientsideRagdoll</page> and <page>Global.ClientsideScene</page>.

Its base class is <page>Entity</page> so it inherits all of the client and shared functions used by <page>Entity</page>.

functions.name: Remove
functions.description: Removes the clientside entity

name: CSoundPatch
description:
CSoundPatch class.

Created with <page>Global.CreateSound</page>

functions.name: ChangePitch
functions.description:
Adjust the pitch, alias the speed at which the sound is being played.

This invokes the <page>GM:EntityEmitSound</page>.

arguments.name: pitch
arguments.description: The pitch can range from 0-255.

arguments.name: deltaTime
arguments.description: The time to fade from previous to the new pitch.

functions.name: ChangeVolume
functions.description:
Adjusts the volume of the sound played.
Appears to only work while the sound is being played.

arguments.name: volume
arguments.description: The volume ranges from 0 to 1.

arguments.name: deltaTime
arguments.description: Time to fade the volume from previous to new value from.

functions.name: FadeOut
functions.description: Fades out the volume of the sound from the current volume to 0 in the given amount of seconds.

arguments.name: seconds
arguments.description: Fade time.

functions.name: GetDSP
functions.description: Returns the DSP ( Digital Signal Processor ) effect for the sound.

returnValues.description:
The DSP effects of the sound
List of DSP's are Pick from the [here](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dsp_presets).

functions.name: GetPitch
functions.description: Returns the current pitch.

returnValues.description: The current pitch, can range from 0-255.

functions.name: GetSoundLevel
functions.description: Returns the current sound level.

returnValues.description: The current sound level, see <page>Enums/SNDLVL</page>.

functions.name: GetVolume
functions.description: Returns the current volume.

returnValues.description: The current volume, ranging from 0 to 1.

functions.name: IsPlaying
functions.description: Returns whenever the sound is being played.

returnValues.description: Is playing or not

functions.name: Play
functions.description: Starts to play the sound. This will reset the sound's volume and pitch to their default values. See <page>CSoundPatch:PlayEx</page>

functions.name: PlayEx
functions.description: Same as <page>CSoundPatch:Play</page> but with 2 extra arguments allowing to set volume and pitch directly.

arguments.name: volume
arguments.description: The volume ranges from 0 to 1.

arguments.name: pitch
arguments.description: The pitch can range from 0-255.

functions.name: SetDSP
functions.description:
Sets the DSP (Digital Signal Processor) effect for the sound. Similar to <page>Player:SetDSP</page> but for individual sounds.

<bug issue="4086">This will only apply if the sound is not playing.</bug>

arguments.name: dsp
arguments.description:
The DSP effect to set.
Pick from the [list of DSP's](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dsp_presets)

functions.name: SetSoundLevel
functions.description: Sets the sound level in decibel.

arguments.name: level
arguments.description: The sound level in decibel. See <page>Enums/SNDLVL</page>

functions.name: Stop
functions.description:
Stops the sound from being played.

<bug issue="3260">This will not work if the entity attached to this sound patch (specified by <page>Global.CreateSound</page>) is invalid.</bug>

name: CTakeDamageInfo
description:
A class used to store and modify all the data concerning a damage event.
An empty CTakeDamageInfo object can be created with <page>Global.DamageInfo</page>

List of hooks that this object is passed to:
* <page>ENTITY:OnTakeDamage</page>
* <page>GM:DoPlayerDeath</page>
* <page>GM:EntityTakeDamage</page>
* <page>GM:OnDamagedByExplosion</page>
* <page>GM:ScaleNPCDamage</page>
* <page>GM:ScalePlayerDamage</page>
* <page>NEXTBOT:OnInjured</page>
* <page>NEXTBOT:OnKilled</page>
* <page>NEXTBOT:OnOtherKilled</page>

List of functions that use this object:
* <page>util.BlastDamageInfo</page>
* <page>Entity:TakeDamageInfo</page>
* <page>Entity:TakePhysicsDamage</page>
* <page>Entity:DispatchTraceAttack</page>

functions.name: AddDamage
functions.description: Increases the damage by damageIncrease.

arguments.name: damageIncrease
arguments.description: The damage to add.

functions.name: GetAmmoType
functions.description: Returns the ammo type used by the weapon that inflicted the damage.

returnValues.description: Ammo type ID

functions.name: GetAttacker
functions.description: Returns the attacker ( character who originated the attack ), for example a player or an NPC that shot the weapon.

returnValues.description: The attacker

functions.name: GetBaseDamage
functions.description: Returns the initial unmodified by skill level ( <page>game.GetSkillLevel</page> ) damage.

returnValues.description: baseDamage

functions.name: GetDamage
functions.description: Returns the total damage.

returnValues.description: damage

functions.name: GetDamageBonus
functions.description: Gets the current bonus damage.

returnValues.description: Bonus damage

functions.name: GetDamageCustom
functions.description: Gets the custom damage type. This is used by Day of Defeat: Source and Team Fortress 2 for extended damage info, but isn't used in Garry's Mod by default.

returnValues.description: The custom damage type

functions.name: GetDamageForce
functions.description:
Returns a vector representing the damage force.

Can be set with <page>CTakeDamageInfo:SetDamageForce</page>.

returnValues.description: The damage force

functions.name: GetDamagePosition
functions.description:
Returns the position where the damage was or is going to be applied to.

Can be set using <page>CTakeDamageInfo:SetDamagePosition</page>.

returnValues.description: The damage position

functions.name: GetDamageType
functions.description:
Returns a bitflag which indicates the damage type(s) of the damage.

Consider using <page>CTakeDamageInfo:IsDamageType</page> instead. Value returned by this function can contain multiple damage types.

returnValues.description: Damage type(s), a combination of <page>Enums/DMG</page>

functions.name: GetInflictor
functions.description:
Returns the inflictor of the damage. This is not necessarily a weapon.

For hitscan weapons this is the weapon.


For projectile weapons this is the projectile.





For a more reliable method of getting the weapon that damaged an entity, use <page text="GetAttacker">CTakeDamageInfo:GetAttacker</page> with <page text="GetActiveWeapon">Player:GetActiveWeapon</page>.

returnValues.description: The inflictor

functions.name: GetMaxDamage
functions.description: Returns the maximum damage.

returnValues.description: maxDmg

functions.name: GetReportedPosition
functions.description: Returns the initial, unmodified position where the damage occured.

returnValues.description: position

functions.name: IsBulletDamage
functions.description: Returns true if the damage was caused by a bullet.

returnValues.description: isBulletDmg

functions.name: IsDamageType
functions.description: Returns whenever the damageinfo contains the damage type specified.

arguments.name: dmgType
arguments.description: Damage type to test. See <page>Enums/DMG</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether this damage contains specified damage type or not

functions.name: IsExplosionDamage
functions.description: Returns whenever the damageinfo contains explosion damage.

returnValues.description: isExplDamage

functions.name: IsFallDamage
functions.description: Returns whenever the damageinfo contains fall damage.

returnValues.description: isFallDmg

functions.name: ScaleDamage
functions.description: Scales the damage by the given value.

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: Value to scale the damage with.

functions.name: SetAmmoType
functions.description: Changes the ammo type used by the weapon that inflicted the damage.

arguments.name: ammoType
arguments.description: Ammo type ID

functions.name: SetAttacker
functions.description: Sets the attacker ( character who originated the attack ) of the damage, for example a player or an NPC.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to be set as the attacker.

functions.name: SetDamage
functions.description: Sets the amount of damage.

arguments.name: damage
arguments.description: The value to set the absolute damage to.

functions.name: SetDamageBonus
functions.description: Sets the bonus damage. Bonus damage isn't automatically applied, so this will have no outer effect by default.

arguments.name: damage
arguments.description: The extra damage to be added.

functions.name: SetDamageCustom
functions.description: Sets the custom damage type. This is used by Day of Defeat: Source and Team Fortress 2 for extended damage info, but isn't used in Garry's Mod by default.

arguments.name: DamageType
arguments.description: Any integer - can be based on your own custom enums.

functions.name: SetDamageForce
functions.description: Sets the directional force of the damage.

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: The vector to set the force to.

functions.name: SetDamagePosition
functions.description: Sets the position of where the damage gets applied to.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position where the damage will be applied.

functions.name: SetDamageType
functions.description: Sets the damage type.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: The damage type, see <page>Enums/DMG</page>.

functions.name: SetInflictor
functions.description:
Sets the inflictor of the damage for example a weapon.

For hitscan/bullet weapons this should the weapon.


For projectile ( rockets, etc ) weapons this should be the projectile.

arguments.name: inflictor
arguments.description: The new inflictor.

functions.name: SetMaxDamage
functions.description: Sets the maximum damage the object can cause.

arguments.name: maxDamage
arguments.description: Maximum damage value.

functions.name: SetReportedPosition
functions.description: Sets the origin of the damage.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The location of where the damage is originating

functions.name: SubtractDamage
functions.description: Subtracts the specified amount from the damage.

arguments.name: damage
arguments.description: Value to subtract.

name: CUserCmd
description:
A class used to store the player inputs, such as mouse movement, view angles, <page>Enums/IN</page> buttons pressed and analog movement, the data from this class is then transfered to a <page>CMoveData</page> during actual movement simulation.

Can be modified during <page>GM:CreateMove</page>, <page>GM:StartCommand</page> and used in read only with <page>GM:SetupMove</page> and <page>Player:GetCurrentCommand</page>.

functions.name: ClearButtons
functions.description:
Removes all keys from the command.

<note>If you are looking to affect player movement, you may need to use <page>CUserCmd:ClearMovement</page> instead of clearing the buttons.</note>

functions.name: ClearMovement
functions.description:
Clears the movement from the command.

See also <page>CUserCmd:SetForwardMove</page>, <page>CUserCmd:SetSideMove</page> and  <page>CUserCmd:SetUpMove</page>.

functions.name: CommandNumber
functions.description:
Returns an increasing number representing the index of the user cmd.

<warning>The value returned is occasionally 0 inside <page>GM:CreateMove</page> and <page>GM:StartCommand</page>. It is advised to check for a non-zero value if you wish to get the correct number.</warning>

returnValues.description: The command number

functions.name: GetButtons
functions.description: Returns a bitflag indicating which buttons are pressed.

returnValues.description: Pressed buttons, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

functions.name: GetForwardMove
functions.description: The speed the client wishes to move forward with, negative if the clients wants to move backwards.

returnValues.description: The desired speed

functions.name: GetImpulse
functions.description: Gets the current impulse from the client, usually 0.

returnValues.description: The impulse

functions.name: GetMouseWheel
functions.description: Returns the scroll delta as whole number.

returnValues.description: Scroll delta

functions.name: GetMouseX
functions.description: Returns the delta of the angular horizontal mouse movement of the player.

returnValues.description: xDelta

functions.name: GetMouseY
functions.description: Returns the delta of the angular vertical mouse movement of the player.

returnValues.description: yDelta

functions.name: GetSideMove
functions.description: The speed the client wishes to move sideways with, positive if it wants to move right, negative if it wants to move left.

returnValues.description: requestSpeed

functions.name: GetUpMove
functions.description: The speed the client wishes to move up with, negative if the clients wants to move down.

returnValues.description: requestSpeed

functions.name: GetViewAngles
functions.description: Gets the direction the player is looking in.

returnValues.description: requestDir

functions.name: IsForced
functions.description:
When players are not sending usercommands to the server (often due to lag), their last usercommand will be executed multiple times as a backup. This function returns true if that is happening.

This will never return true clientside.

returnValues.description: isForced

functions.name: KeyDown
functions.description: Returns true if the specified button(s) is pressed.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Bitflag representing which button to check, see <page>Enums/IN</page>.

returnValues.description: Is key down or not

functions.name: RemoveKey
functions.description: Removed a key bit from the current key bitflag.

arguments.name: button
arguments.description: Bitflag to be removed from the key bitflag, see <page>Enums/IN</page>.

functions.name: SelectWeapon
functions.description:
Forces the associated player to select a weapon. This is used internally in the default HL2 weapon selection HUD.

This may not work immediately if the current command is in prediction. Use <page>input.SelectWeapon</page> to switch the weapon from the client when the next available command can do so.

<note>This is the ideal function to use to create a custom weapon selection HUD, as it allows prediction to run properly for <page>WEAPON:Deploy</page> and <page>GM:PlayerSwitchWeapon</page></note>

arguments.name: weapon
arguments.description: The weapon entity to select.

functions.name: SetButtons
functions.description:
Sets the buttons as a bitflag. See also <page>CUserCmd:GetButtons</page>.

<note>If you are looking to affect player movement, you may need to use <page>CUserCmd:SetForwardMove</page> instead of setting the keys.</note>

arguments.name: buttons
arguments.description: Bitflag representing which buttons are "down", see <page>Enums/IN</page>.

functions.name: SetForwardMove
functions.description:
Sets speed the client wishes to move forward with, negative if the clients wants to move backwards.

See also <page>CUserCmd:ClearMovement</page>, <page>CUserCmd:SetSideMove</page> and <page>CUserCmd:SetUpMove</page>.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: The new speed to request. The client will not be able to move faster than their set walk/sprint speed.

functions.name: SetImpulse
functions.description:
Sets the impulse command to be sent to the server.

For example, 101 is an impulse that will give the player all Half-Life 2 weapons with sv_cheats set to 1. Impulse 100 will toggle their flashlight.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: The impulse to send.

functions.name: SetMouseWheel
functions.description: Sets the scroll delta.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: The scroll delta.

functions.name: SetMouseX
functions.description:
Sets the delta of the angular horizontal mouse movement of the player.

See also <page>CUserCmd:SetMouseY</page>.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: Angular horizontal move delta.

functions.name: SetMouseY
functions.description:
Sets the delta of the angular vertical mouse movement of the player.

See also <page>CUserCmd:SetMouseX</page>.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: Angular vertical move delta.

functions.name: SetSideMove
functions.description:
Sets speed the client wishes to move sidewards with, positive to move right, negative to move left.

See also <page>CUserCmd:SetForwardMove</page> and  <page>CUserCmd:SetUpMove</page>.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: The new speed to request.

functions.name: SetUpMove
functions.description:
Sets speed the client wishes to move upwards with, negative to move down.

See also <page>CUserCmd:SetSideMove</page> and  <page>CUserCmd:SetForwardMove</page>.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: The new speed to request.

functions.name: SetViewAngles
functions.description:
Sets the direction the client wants to move in.

<note>The pitch (vertical) angle should be clamped to +/- 89 to prevent the player's view from glitching.</note>

arguments.name: viewAngle
arguments.description: New view angles.

functions.name: TickCount
functions.description:
Returns tick count since joining the server.

<note>This will always return 0 for bots.</note>

<note>Returns 0 clientside during prediction calls. If you are trying to use CUserCmd:Set*() on the client in a movement or command hook, keep doing so till TickCount returns a non-zero number to maintain prediction.</note>

returnValues.description: The amount of ticks passed since joining the server.

name: Entity
description: This is a list of all available methods for entites, which includes <page text="Players">Player</page>, <page text="Weapons">Weapon</page>, <page text="NPCs">NPC</page> and <page text="Vehicles">Vehicle</page>.

functions.name: Activate
functions.description:
Activates the entity. This needs to be used on some entities (like constraints) after being spawned.

<note>For some entity types when this function is used after <page>Entity:SetModelScale</page>, the physics object will be recreated with the new scale. [Source-sdk-2013](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/server/baseanimating.cpp#L321-L327)</note>
<bug issue="3372">This crashes the game with scaled vehicles.</bug>

functions.name: AddCallback
functions.description:
Add a callback function to a specific event. This is used instead of hooks to avoid calling empty functions unnecessarily.

This also allows you to use certain hooks in engine entities (non-scripted entities).

<warning>This method does not check if the function has already been added to this object before, so if you add the same callback twice, it will be run twice! Make sure to add your callback only once.</warning>

arguments.name: hook
arguments.description: The hook name to hook onto. See <page>Entity Callbacks</page>

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The function to call

returnValues.description:
The callback ID that was just added, which can later be used in <page>Entity:RemoveCallback</page>.

Returns nothing if the passed callback function was invalid or when asking for a non-existent hook.

functions.name: AddEffects
functions.description:
Applies an engine effect to an entity.

See also <page>Entity:IsEffectActive</page> and  <page>Entity:RemoveEffects</page>.

arguments.name: effect
arguments.description: The effect to apply, see <page>Enums/EF</page>.

functions.name: AddEFlags
functions.description: Adds engine flags.

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: Engine flag to add, see <page>Enums/EFL</page>

functions.name: AddFlags
functions.description: Adds flags to the entity.

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: Flag to add, see <page>Enums/FL</page>

functions.name: AddGesture
functions.description:
Adds a gesture animation to the entity and plays it.


See <page>Entity:AddGestureSequence</page> and <page>Entity:AddLayeredSequence</page> for functions that takes sequences instead of <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entites!</note>

arguments.name: activity
arguments.description: The activity to play as the gesture. See <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

returnValues.description: Layer ID of the started gesture, used to manipulate the played gesture by other functions.

functions.name: AddGestureSequence
functions.description:
Adds a gesture animation to the entity and plays it.


See <page>Entity:AddGesture</page> for a function that takes <page>Enums/ACT</page>.


See also <page>Entity:AddLayeredSequence</page>.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entites!</note>

arguments.name: sequence
arguments.description: The sequence ID to play as the gesture. See <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page>.

returnValues.description: Layer ID of the started gesture, used to manipulate the played gesture by other functions.

functions.name: AddLayeredSequence
functions.description:
Adds a gesture animation to the entity and plays it.


See <page>Entity:AddGestureSequence</page> for a function that doesn't take priority.


See <page>Entity:AddGesture</page> for a function that takes <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entites!</note>

arguments.name: sequence
arguments.description: The sequence ID to play as the gesture. See <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page>.

returnValues.description: Layer ID of created layer

functions.name: AddSolidFlags
functions.description: Adds solid flag(s) to the entity.

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: The flag(s) to apply, see <page>Enums/FSOLID</page>.

functions.name: AddToMotionController
functions.description:
Adds a <page>PhysObj</page>ect to the entity's motion controller so that <page>ENTITY:PhysicsSimulate</page> will be called for given <page>PhysObj</page>ect as well.

You must first create a motion controller with <page>Entity:StartMotionController</page>.

You can remove added <page>PhysObj</page>ects by using <page>Entity:RemoveFromMotionController</page>.

<note>Only works on a scripted <page>Entity</page> of anim type</note>

arguments.name: physObj
arguments.description: The <page>PhysObj</page> to add to the motion controller.

functions.name: AlignAngles
functions.description:
Returns an angle based on the ones inputted that you can use to align an object.

<note>This function doesn't change the angle of the entity on its own (see example).</note>

arguments.name: from
arguments.description: The angle you want to align from

arguments.name: to
arguments.description: The angle you want to align to

returnValues.description: The resulting aligned angle

functions.name: BecomeRagdollOnClient
functions.description:
Spawns a clientside ragdoll for the entity, positioning it in place of the original entity, and makes the entity invisible. It doesn't preserve flex values (face posing) as CSRagdolls don't support flex.

It does not work on players. Use <page>Player:CreateRagdoll</page> instead.

The original entity is not removed, and neither are any ragdolls previously generated with this function.

To make the entity re-appear, run <page>Entity:SetNoDraw</page>( false )

returnValues.description: The created ragdoll.

functions.name: BeingLookedAtByLocalPlayer
functions.description: Returns true if the entity is being looked at by the local player and is within 256 units of distance.

returnValues.description: Is the entity being looked at by the local player and within 256 units.

functions.name: Blocked
functions.description: <internal></internal> Dispatches blocked events to this entity's blocked handler. This function is only useful when interacting with entities like func_movelinear.

arguments.name: entity
arguments.description: The entity that is blocking us

functions.name: BodyTarget
functions.description:
Returns a centered vector of this entity, NPCs use this internally to aim at their targets.

<note>This only works on players and NPCs.</note>

arguments.name: origin
arguments.description: The vector of where the the attack comes from.

arguments.name: noisy
arguments.description: Decides if it should return the centered vector with a random offset to it.

returnValues.description: The centered vector.

functions.name: BoneHasFlag
functions.description: Returns whether the entity's bone has the flag or not.

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description: Bone ID to test flag of.

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: The flag to test, see <page>Enums/BONE</page>

returnValues.description: Whether the bone has that flag or not

functions.name: BoneLength
functions.description: This function takes the boneID and returns the length of it in an unrounded decimal

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description: The ID of the bone you want the length of. You may want to get the length of the next bone ( boneID + 1 ) for decent results

returnValues.description: The length of the bone

functions.name: BoundingRadius
functions.description: Returns the distance between the center of the bounding box and the furthest bounding box corner.

returnValues.description: The radius of the bounding box.

functions.name: CallOnRemove
functions.description:
Causes a specified function to be run if the entity is removed by any means. This can later be undone by <page>Entity:RemoveCallOnRemove</page> if you need it to not run.

<bug pull="1275">Using players with this function will provide a gimped entity to the callback.</bug>

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the function within CallOnRemove

arguments.name: removeFunc
arguments.description: Function to be called on remove

arguments.name: argn...
arguments.description: Optional arguments to pass to removeFunc. Do note that the first argument passed to the function will always be the entity being removed, and the arguments passed on here start after that.

functions.name: ClearPoseParameters
functions.description: Resets all pose parameters such as aim_yaw, aim_pitch and rotation.

functions.name: CollisionRulesChanged
functions.description:
Declares that the collision rules of the entity have changed, and subsequent calls for <page>GM:ShouldCollide</page> with this entity may return a different value than they did previously.

<warning>This function must **not** be called inside of <page>GM:ShouldCollide</page>. Instead, it must be called in advance when the condition is known to change.</warning>

<warning>Failure to use this function correctly will result in a crash of the physics engine.</warning>

functions.name: CreatedByMap
functions.description: Returns whether the entity was created by map or not.

returnValues.description: Is created by map?

functions.name: CreateParticleEffect
functions.description:
Creates a clientside particle system attached to the entity. See also <page>Global.CreateParticleSystem</page>

<note>The particle effect must be precached with <page>Global.PrecacheParticleSystem</page> and the file its from must be added via <page>game.AddParticles</page> before it can be used!</note>

arguments.name: particle
arguments.description: The particle name to create

arguments.name: attachment
arguments.description: Attachment ID to attach the particle to

arguments.name: options
arguments.description:
A table of tables ( IDs 1 to 64 ) having the following structure:
* <page>number</page> attachtype - The particle attach type. See <page text="PATTACH">Enums/PATTACH</page>. **Default:** PATTACH_ABSORIGIN
* <page>Entity</page> entity - The parent entity? **Default:** NULL
* <page>Vector</page> position - The offset position for given control point. **Default:**  nil

This only affects the control points of the particle effects and will do nothing if the effect doesn't use control points.

returnValues.description: The created particle system.

functions.name: CreateShadow
functions.description: Draws the shadow of an entity.

functions.name: DeleteOnRemove
functions.description: Whenever the entity is removed, entityToRemove will be removed also.

arguments.name: entityToRemove
arguments.description: The entity to be removed

functions.name: DestroyShadow
functions.description:
Removes the shadow for the entity.

The shadow will be recreated as soon as the entity wakes.

Doesn't affect shadows from flashlight/lamps/env_projectedtexture.

functions.name: DisableMatrix
functions.description: Disables an active matrix.

arguments.name: matrixType
arguments.description:
The name of the matrix type to disable.




The only known matrix type is "RenderMultiply".

functions.name: DispatchTraceAttack
functions.description:
Performs a trace attack.

<warning>Calling this function on the victim entity in <page>ENTITY:OnTakeDamage</page> can cause infinite loops.</warning>

arguments.name: damageInfo
arguments.description: The damage to apply.

arguments.name: traceRes
arguments.description: Trace result to use to deal damage. See <page>Structures/TraceResult</page>

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: Direction of the attack.

functions.name: DontDeleteOnRemove
functions.description: This removes the argument entity from an ent's list of entities to 'delete on remove'

arguments.name: entityToUnremove
arguments.description: The entity to be removed from the list of entities to delete

functions.name: DrawModel
functions.description:
Draws the entity or model.

If called inside <page>ENTITY:Draw</page> or <page>ENTITY:DrawTranslucent</page>, it only draws the entity's model itself.


If called outside of those hooks, it will call both of said hooks depending on <page>Entity:GetRenderGroup</page>, drawing the entire entity again.

<note>When drawing an entity more than once per frame in different positions, you should call <page>Entity:SetupBones</page> before each draw; Otherwise, the entity will retain its first drawn position.</note>

<rendercontext hook="false" type="3D"></rendercontext>

<bug issue="1558">Calling this on entities with <page text="EF_BONEMERGE">Enums/EF</page> and <page text="EF_NODRAW">Enums/EF</page> applied causes a crash.</bug>

<bug issue="2688">Using this with a map model (<page>game.GetWorld</page>():<page text="GetModel">Entity:GetModel</page>()) crashes the game.</bug>

functions.name: DrawShadow
functions.description: Sets whether an entity's shadow should be drawn.

arguments.name: shouldDraw
arguments.description: True to enable, false to disable shadow drawing.

functions.name: DropToFloor
functions.description:
Move an entity down until it collides with something.
<warning>The entity needs to already have something below it within 256 units.</warning>

functions.name: DTVar
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Sets up a self.dt.NAME alias for a Data Table variable.

<warning>You should use <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> instead</warning>

arguments.name: Type
arguments.description: The type of the DTVar being set up. It can be one of the following: 'Int', 'Float', 'Vector', 'Angle', 'Bool', 'Entity' or 'String'

arguments.name: ID
arguments.description: The ID of the DTVar. Can be between 0 and 3 for strings, 0 and 31 for everything else.

arguments.name: Name
arguments.description: Name by which you will refer to DTVar. It must be a valid variable name. (No spaces!)

functions.name: EmitSound
functions.description:
Plays a sound on an entity. If run clientside, the sound will only be heard locally.

If used on a player or NPC character with the mouth rigged, the character will "lip-sync". This does not work with all sound files.

It is recommended to use sound scripts ( see <page>sound.Add</page> ) over direct file paths. This will allow you to use <page>Entity:StopSound</page> to stop the played sound scripts.

<note>When using this function with weapons, use the <page>Weapon</page> itself as the entity, not its owner!</note>

<warning>Do not use this for looping sounds with a filepath: see <page>Entity:StopSound</page> for more details.</warning>

<bug issue="2651">This does not respond to <page>Global.SuppressHostEvents</page>.</bug>

arguments.name: soundName
arguments.description:
The name of the sound to be played.
<warning>The string will cannot have whitespace at the start or end. You can remove this with <page>string.Trim</page>.</warning>

arguments.name: soundLevel
arguments.description:
A modifier for the distance this sound will reach, acceptable range is 0 to 511. 100 means no adjustment to the level. See <page>Enums/SNDLVL</page>

Will not work if a [sound script](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Soundscripts) is used.

arguments.name: pitchPercent
arguments.description: The pitch applied to the sound. The acceptable range is from 0 to 255. 100 means the pitch is not changed.

arguments.name: volume
arguments.description: The volume, from 0 to 1.

arguments.name: channel
arguments.description:
The sound channel, see <page>Enums/CHAN</page>.

Will not work if a [sound script](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Soundscripts) is used.

functions.name: EnableConstraints
functions.description: Toggles the constraints of this ragdoll entity on and off.

arguments.name: toggleConstraints
arguments.description:
Set to true to enable the constraints and false to disable them.

Disabling constraints will delete the constraint entities.

functions.name: EnableCustomCollisions
functions.description:
Flags an entity as using custom lua defined collisions. Fixes entities having spongy player collisions or not hitting traces, such as after <page>Entity:PhysicsFromMesh</page>

Internally identical to `Entity:AddSolidFlags( bit.bor( FSOLID_CUSTOMRAYTEST, FSOLID_CUSTOMBOXTEST ) )`

Do not confuse this function with <page>Entity:SetCustomCollisionCheck</page>, they are not the same.

arguments.name: useCustom
arguments.description: True to flag this entity

functions.name: EnableMatrix
functions.description:
Can be used to apply a custom <page>VMatrix</page> to the entity, mostly used for scaling the model by a <page>Vector</page>.

To disable it, use <page>Entity:DisableMatrix</page>.

If your old scales are wrong due to a recent update, use <page>Entity:SetLegacyTransform</page> as a quick fix.

<note>The matrix can also be modified to apply a custom rotation and offset via the <page>VMatrix:SetAngles</page> and <page>VMatrix:SetTranslation</page> functions.</note>
<bug issue="3502">This does not scale procedural bones.</bug>
<bug issue="3502">This disables inverse kinematics of an entity.</bug>

arguments.name: matrixType
arguments.description:
The name of the matrix type.
The only implemented matrix type is "RenderMultiply".

arguments.name: matrix
arguments.description: The matrix to apply before drawing the entity.

functions.name: EntIndex
functions.description:
Gets the unique entity index of an entity.

<note>Entity indices are marked as unused after deletion, and can be reused by newly-created entities</note>

returnValues.description:
The index of the entity.

-1 for clientside-only or serverside-only entities.

functions.name: Extinguish
functions.description:
Extinguishes the entity if it is on fire.

Has no effect if called inside <page>GM:EntityTakeDamage</page> (and the attacker is the flame that's hurting the entity)

See also <page>Entity:Ignite</page>.

functions.name: EyeAngles
functions.description:
Returns the direction a player/npc/ragdoll is looking as a world-oriented angle.

<bug issue="1150">This can return an incorrect value in pods.</bug>

<bug issue="2620">This can return an incorrect value in jeeps when used with <page>Player:EnterVehicle</page>.</bug>

returnValues.description: eyeAng

functions.name: EyePos
functions.description: Returns the position of an Player/NPC's view.

returnValues.description: View position of the entity.

functions.name: FindBodygroupByName
functions.description: Searches for bodygroup with given name.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The bodygroup name to search for.

returnValues.description: Bodygroup ID, -1 if not found

functions.name: FindTransitionSequence
functions.description:
Returns a transition from the given start and end sequence.

This function was only used by HL1 entities and NPCs, before the advent of sequence blending and gestures.

arguments.name: currentSequence
arguments.description: The currently playing sequence

arguments.name: goalSequence
arguments.description: The goal sequence.

returnValues.description: The transition sequence, -1 if not available.

functions.name: Fire
functions.description:
Fires an entity's input. You can find inputs for most entities on the [Valve Developer Wiki](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Output)

See also <page>Entity:Input</page> and <page>GM:AcceptInput</page>.

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: The name of the input to fire

arguments.name: param
arguments.description: The value to give to the input, can also be a <page>number</page> or a <page>boolean</page>.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: Delay in seconds before firing

functions.name: FireBullets
functions.description:
Fires a bullet.

When used in a  hook such as <page>WEAPON:Think</page> or <page>WEAPON:PrimaryAttack</page>, it will use <page>Player:LagCompensation</page> internally.

<note>Lag compensation will not work if this function is called in a timer, regardless if the timer was made in a  hook.</note>

arguments.name: bulletInfo
arguments.description: The bullet data to be used. See the <page>Structures/Bullet</page>.

arguments.name: suppressHostEvents
arguments.description: Has the effect of encasing the FireBullets call in <page>Global.SuppressHostEvents</page>, only works in multiplayer.

functions.name: FollowBone
functions.description:
Makes an entity follow another entity's bone.

Internally this function calls <page>Entity:SetParent</page>( parent, boneid ) and <page>Entity:AddEffects</page>( EF_FOLLOWBONE ).
<note>If the entity vibrates, you probably need to run <page>Entity:SetPredictable</page>( false ) clientside.</note>
<warning>This function will not work if the target bone's parent bone is invalid or if the bone is not used by VERTEX LOD0</warning>

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: The entity to follow the bone of. If unset, removes the FollowBone effect.

arguments.name: boneid
arguments.description: The bone to follow

functions.name: ForcePlayerDrop
functions.description: Forces the Entity to be dropped, when it is being held by a player's gravitygun or physgun.

functions.name: FrameAdvance
functions.description:
Advances the cycle of an animated entity.

Animations that loop will automatically reset the cycle so you don't have to - ones that do not will stop animating once you reach the end of their sequence.

arguments.name: interval
arguments.description: How many seconds to advance the cycle. Set to 0 to let the engine calculate this for you based on <page>Global.CurTime</page>.

functions.name: GetAbsVelocity
functions.description:
Returns the entity's velocity.

<note>Actually binds to CBaseEntity::GetLocalVelocity() which retrieves the velocity of the entity due to its movement in the world from forces such as gravity. Does not include velocity from entity-on-entity collision.</note>

returnValues.description: The velocity of the entity.

functions.name: GetAngles
functions.description:
Gets the angles of given entity.

<bug issue="2764">This returns incorrect results for the local player clientside.</bug>

<bug issue="3106">This will return the local player's <page>Global.EyeAngles</page> in <page text="rendering hooks">Category:3D_Rendering_Hooks</page>.</bug>

<bug issue="3107">This will return <page>Global.Angle</page>(0,0,0) in <page text="rendering hooks">Category:3D_Rendering_Hooks</page> while paused in single-player.</bug>

returnValues.description: The angles of the entity.

functions.name: GetAnimInfo
functions.description:
Returns a table containing the number of frames, flags, name, and FPS of an entity's animation ID.

<note>Animation ID is not the same as sequence ID.</note>

arguments.name: animIndex
arguments.description: The animation ID to look up

returnValues.description: Information about the animation, or nil if the index is out of bounds

functions.name: GetAnimTime
functions.description: Returns the last time the entity had an animation update. Returns 0 if the entity doesn't animate.

returnValues.description: The last time the entity had an animation update.

functions.name: GetAttachment
functions.description:
Gets the orientation and position of the attachment by its ID, returns nothing if the attachment does not exist.

<note>The update rate of this function is limited by the setting of ENT.AutomaticFrameAdvance for <page>Scripted Entities</page>!</note>

<bug issue="1255">This will return improper values for viewmodels if used in <page>GM:CalcView</page>.</bug>

arguments.name: attachmentId
arguments.description: The internal ID of the attachment.

returnValues.description: The angle and position of the attachment. See the <page>Structures/AngPos</page>. Most notably, the table contains the keys "Ang" and "Pos".

functions.name: GetAttachments
functions.description:
Returns a table containing all attachments of the given entitys model.

Returns an empty table or **nil** in case it's model has no attachments.

<bug issue="3167">This can have inconsistent results in single-player.</bug>

returnValues.description: Attachment data. See <page>Structures/AttachmentData</page>.

functions.name: GetBaseVelocity
functions.description: Returns the entity's base velocity which is their velocity due to forces applied by other entities. This includes entity-on-entity collision or riding a treadmill.

returnValues.description: The base velocity of the entity.

functions.name: GetBloodColor
functions.description: Returns the blood color of this entity. This can be set with <page>Entity:SetBloodColor</page>.

returnValues.description: Color from <page>Enums/BLOOD_COLOR</page>

functions.name: GetBodygroup
functions.description: Gets the exact value for specific bodygroup of given entity.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The id of bodygroup to get value of. Starts from 0.

returnValues.description: Current bodygroup. Starts from 0.

functions.name: GetBodygroupCount
functions.description:
Returns the count of possible values for this bodygroup.

This is **not** the maximum value, since the bodygroups start with 0, not 1.

arguments.name: bodygroup
arguments.description: The ID of bodygroup to retrieve count of.

returnValues.description: Count of values of passed bodygroup.

functions.name: GetBodygroupName
functions.description: Gets the name of specific bodygroup for given entity.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The id of bodygroup to get the name of.

returnValues.description: The name of the bodygroup

functions.name: GetBodyGroups
functions.description: Returns a list of all bodygroups of the entity.

returnValues.description: Bodygroups as a table of <page>Structures/BodyGroupData</page>s if the entity can have bodygroups.

functions.name: GetBoneContents
functions.description: Returns the contents of the specified bone.

arguments.name: bone
arguments.description: The bone id. See <page>Entity:LookupBone</page>.

returnValues.description: The contents as a <page>Enums/CONTENTS</page> or 0 on failure.

functions.name: GetBoneController
functions.description:
Returns the value of the bone controller with the specified ID.

<note>This is the precursor of pose parameters, and only works for Half Life 1: Source models supporting it.</note>

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description: ID of the bone controller. Goes from 0 to 3.

returnValues.description: The value set on the bone controller.

functions.name: GetBoneCount
functions.description:
Returns the amount of bones in the entity.

<note>Will return -1 for <page>Global.ClientsideModel</page> or undrawn entities until <page>Entity:SetupBones</page> is called on the entity.</note>

returnValues.description: The amount of bones in given entity; -1 on failure.

functions.name: GetBoneMatrix
functions.description:
Returns the transformation matrix of a given bone on the entity's model. The matrix contains the transformation used to position the bone in the world. It is not relative to the parent bone.

This is equivalent to constructing a <page>VMatrix</page> using <page>Entity:GetBonePosition</page>.

<bug issue="884">This can return the server's matrix during server lag.</bug>

<bug issue="3285">This can return garbage serverside or a 0,0,0 fourth column (represents position) for v49 models.</bug>

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description:
The bone to retrieve matrix of.
* Bones clientside and serverside will differ

returnValues.description:
The matrix

* Some entities don't update animation every frame such as prop_physics and won't have accurate bone matrix.

functions.name: GetBoneName
functions.description: Returns name of given bone id.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: ID of bone to lookup name of

returnValues.description:
The name of given bone

* nil in case we failed or entity doesn't have a model
* "__INVALIDBONE__" in case the name cannot be read or the index is out of range.

functions.name: GetBoneParent
functions.description:
Returns parent bone of given bone.

<note>Will return -1 for <page>Global.ClientsideModel</page> until <page>Entity:SetupBones</page> is called on the entity.</note>

arguments.name: bone
arguments.description: The bode ID of the bone to get parent of

returnValues.description: Parent bone ID or -1 if we failed for some reason.

functions.name: GetBonePosition
functions.description:
Returns the position and angle of the given attachment, relative to the world.

<warning>This function can return entity's `GetPos()` instead if the entity doesn't have it's bone cache set up.

To ensure the bone position is correct use this:
```lua
local pos = ent:GetBonePosition(0)
if pos == ent:GetPos() then
pos = ent:GetBoneMatrix(0):GetTranslation()
end
```
</warning>
<bug issue="884">This can return the server's position during server lag.</bug>

<bug issue="3285">This can return garbage serverside or <page>Global.Vector</page>(0,0,0) for v49 models.</bug>

<bug issue="3739">This can return garbage if a trace passed through the target bone during bone matrix access.</bug>

arguments.name: boneIndex
arguments.description: The bone index of the bone to get the position of. See <page>Entity:LookupBone</page>.

returnValues.description: The bone's position relative to the world. It can return nothing if the requested bone is out of bounds, or the entity has no model.
The bone's angle relative to the world.

functions.name: GetBoneSurfaceProp
functions.description: Returns the surface property of the specified bone.

arguments.name: bone
arguments.description: The bone id. See <page>Entity:LookupBone</page>.

returnValues.description: The surface property of the bone to be used with <page>util.GetSurfaceIndex</page> or an empty string on failure.

functions.name: GetBrushPlane
functions.description:
Returns info about given plane of non-nodraw brush model surfaces of the entity's model. Works on worldspawn as well.

<warning>This only works on entities with brush models.</warning>

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The index of the plane to get info of. Starts from 0.

returnValues.description:
The origin of the plane.

This will be either the first vertex's position (if available) or the plane's normal multiplied by the plane's distance.
The normal of the plane.

The "distance" of the plane.

The distance is the dot product of the plane's normal and the point it was initialized with.

functions.name: GetBrushPlaneCount
functions.description: Returns the amount of planes of non-nodraw brush model surfaces of the entity's model.

returnValues.description: The amount of brush model planes of the entity's model. This will be 0 for any non-brush model.

functions.name: GetBrushSurfaces
functions.description: Returns a table of brushes surfaces for brush model entities.

returnValues.description: Table of <page>SurfaceInfo</page>s if the entity has a brush model, or <page>no value</page> otherwise.

functions.name: GetCallbacks
functions.description:
Returns the specified hook callbacks for this entity added with <page>Entity:AddCallback</page>

The callbacks can then be removed with <page>Entity:RemoveCallback</page>.

arguments.name: hook
arguments.description: The hook to retrieve the callbacks from, see <page>Entity Callbacks</page> for the possible hooks.

returnValues.description: A table containing the callbackid and function of all the callbacks for the specified hook

functions.name: GetChildBones
functions.description: Returns ids of child bones of given bone.

arguments.name: boneid
arguments.description: Bone id to lookup children of

returnValues.description: A table of bone ids

functions.name: GetChildren
functions.description:
Gets the children of the entity - that is, every entity whose move parent is this entity.

<note>This function returns <page>Entity:SetMoveParent</page> children, **NOT** <page>Entity:SetParent</page>!

<page>Entity:SetParent</page> however also calls <page>Entity:SetMoveParent</page>.



This means that some entities in the returned list might have a NULL <page>Entity:GetParent</page>.

This also means that using this function on players will return their weapons on the client but not the server.</note>

returnValues.description: A list of movement children entities

functions.name: GetClass
functions.description: Returns the classname of a entity. This is often the name of the Lua file or folder containing the files for the entity

returnValues.description: The entity's classname

functions.name: GetCollisionBounds
functions.description:
Returns an entity's collision bounding box. In most cases, this will return the same bounding box as <page>Entity:GetModelBounds</page> unless the entity does not have a physics mesh or it has a <page>PhysObj</page> different from the default.

<bug issue="223">This can be out-of-sync between the client and server for weapons.</bug>

returnValues.description: The minimum vector of the collision bounds
The maximum vector of the collision bounds

functions.name: GetCollisionGroup
functions.description: Returns the entity's collision group

returnValues.description: The collision group. See <page>Enums/COLLISION_GROUP</page>

functions.name: GetColor
functions.description:
Returns the color the entity is set to.

<bug issue="2407">The returned color will not have the color metatable.</bug>

returnValues.description: The color of the entity as a <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: GetConstrainedEntities
functions.description: Returns the two entities involved in a constraint ent, or nil if the entity is not a constraint.

returnValues.description: ent1
ent2

functions.name: GetConstrainedPhysObjects
functions.description: Returns the two entities physobjects involved in a constraint ent, or no value if the entity is not a constraint.

returnValues.description: phys1
phys2

functions.name: GetCreationID
functions.description: Returns entity's creation ID. Unlike <page>Entity:EntIndex</page> or  <page>Entity:MapCreationID</page>, it will always increase and old values won't be reused.

returnValues.description: The creation ID

functions.name: GetCreationTime
functions.description: Returns the time the entity was created on, relative to <page>Global.CurTime</page>.

returnValues.description: The time the entity was created on.

functions.name: GetCreator
functions.description: Gets the creator of the SENT.

returnValues.description: The creator, NULL for no creator.

functions.name: GetCustomCollisionCheck
functions.description: Returns whether this entity uses custom collision check set by <page>Entity:SetCustomCollisionCheck</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether this entity uses custom collision check or not

functions.name: GetCycle
functions.description: Returns the frame of the currently played sequence. This will be a number between 0 and 1 as a representation of sequence progress.

returnValues.description: The frame of the currently played sequence

functions.name: GetDTAngle
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Get an angle stored in the datatable of the entity.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description:
Goes from 0 to 63.
Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

returnValues.description: Requested angle.

functions.name: GetDTBool
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Get a boolean stored in the datatable of the entity.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description:
Goes from 0 to 63.
Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

returnValues.description: Requested boolean.

functions.name: GetDTEntity
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Returns an entity stored in the datatable of the entity.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description:
Goes from 0 to 63.
Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

returnValues.description: Requested entity.

functions.name: GetDTFloat
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Get a float stored in the datatable of the entity.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description:
Goes from 0 to 31.
Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

returnValues.description: Requested float.

functions.name: GetDTInt
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Get an integer stored in the datatable of the entity.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description:
Goes from 0 to 63.
Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

returnValues.description: 32-bit signed integer

functions.name: GetDTString
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Get a string stored in the datatable of the entity.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description:
Goes from 0 to 3.
Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

returnValues.description: Requested string.

functions.name: GetDTVector
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Get a vector stored in the datatable of the entity.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description:
Goes from 0 to 63.
Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

returnValues.description: Requested vector.

functions.name: GetEffects
functions.description: Returns a bit flag of all engine effect flags of the entity.

returnValues.description: Engine effect flags, see <page>Enums/EF</page>

functions.name: GetEFlags
functions.description: Returns a bit flag of all engine flags of the entity.

returnValues.description: Engine flags, see <page>Enums/EFL</page>

functions.name: GetElasticity
functions.description: Returns the elasticity of this entity, used by some flying entities such as the Helicopter NPC to determine how much it should bounce around when colliding.

returnValues.description: elasticity

functions.name: GetFlags
functions.description: Returns all flags of given entity.

returnValues.description: Flags of given entity as a bitflag, see <page>Enums/FL</page>

functions.name: GetFlexBounds
functions.description: Returns acceptable value range for the flex.

arguments.name: flex
arguments.description: The ID of the flex to look up bounds of

returnValues.description: The minimum value for this flex
The maximum value for this flex

functions.name: GetFlexIDByName
functions.description: Returns the ID of the flex based on given name.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the flex to get the ID of. Case sensitive.

returnValues.description:
The ID of flex
* nil if no flex with given name was found

functions.name: GetFlexName
functions.description: Returns flex name.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The flex id to look up name of

returnValues.description: The flex name

functions.name: GetFlexNum
functions.description: Returns the number of flexes this entity has.

returnValues.description: The number of flexes.

functions.name: GetFlexScale
functions.description: Returns the flex scale of the entity.

returnValues.description: The flex scale

functions.name: GetFlexWeight
functions.description: Returns current weight ( value ) of the flex.

arguments.name: flex
arguments.description: The ID of the flex to get weight of

returnValues.description: The current weight of the flex

functions.name: GetForward
functions.description: Returns the forward vector of the entity, as a normalized direction vector

returnValues.description: forwardDir

functions.name: GetFriction
functions.description: Returns how much friction an entity has. Entities default to 1 (100%) and can be higher or even negative.

returnValues.description: friction

functions.name: GetGravity
functions.description: Gets the gravity multiplier of the entity.

returnValues.description: gravityMultiplier

functions.name: GetGroundEntity
functions.description: Returns the object the entity is standing on.

returnValues.description: The ground entity.

functions.name: GetGroundSpeedVelocity
functions.description: Returns the entity's ground speed velocity, which is based on the entity's walk/run speed and/or the ground speed of their sequence ( <page>Entity:GetSequenceGroundSpeed</page> ). Will return an empty <page>Vector</page> if the entity isn't moving on the ground.

returnValues.description: The ground speed velocity.

functions.name: GetHitBoxBone
functions.description: Gets the bone the hit box is attached to.

arguments.name: hitbox
arguments.description: The number of the hit box.

arguments.name: hboxset
arguments.description:
The number of the hit box set. This should be 0 in most cases.

Numbering for these sets start from 0. The total amount of sets can be found with <page>Entity:GetHitBoxSetCount</page>.

returnValues.description: The number of the bone. Will be nil if the hit box index was out of range.

functions.name: GetHitBoxBounds
functions.description: Gets the bounds (min and max corners) of a hit box.

arguments.name: hitbox
arguments.description: The number of the hit box.

arguments.name: group
arguments.description: The group of the hit box. This should be 0 in most cases.

returnValues.description: Hit box mins. Will be nil if the hit box index was out of range.
Hit box maxs. Will be nil if the hit box index was out of range.

functions.name: GetHitBoxCount
functions.description: Gets how many hit boxes are in a given hit box group

arguments.name: group
arguments.description: The number of the hit box group

returnValues.description: The number of hit boxes.

functions.name: GetHitBoxGroupCount
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should use <page>Entity:GetHitboxSetCount</page> instead.</deprecated>

Returns the number of hit box sets that an entity has. Functionally identical to <page>Entity:GetHitboxSetCount</page>

returnValues.description: number of hit box sets

functions.name: GetHitBoxHitGroup
functions.description: Gets the hit group of a given hitbox in a given hitbox set.

arguments.name: hitbox
arguments.description: The number of the hit box.

arguments.name: hitboxset
arguments.description:
The number of the hit box set. This should be 0 in most cases.

Numbering for these sets start from 0. The total group count can be found with <page>Entity:GetHitBoxSetCount</page>.

returnValues.name: group
returnValues.description: The hitbox group of given hitbox. See <page>Enums/HITGROUP</page>

functions.name: GetHitboxSet
functions.description: Returns entity's current hit box set

returnValues.description: The current hit box set id, or no value if the entity doesn't have hit boxes
The current hit box set name, or no value if the entity doesn't have hit boxes

functions.name: GetHitboxSetCount
functions.description: Returns the amount of hitbox sets in the entity.

returnValues.description: The amount of hitbox sets in the entity.

functions.name: GetInternalVariable
functions.description:
An interface for accessing internal key values on entities.

See <page>Entity:GetSaveTable</page> for a more detailed explanation. See <page>Entity:SetSaveValue</page> for the opposite of this function.

arguments.name: VariableName
arguments.description: Name of variable corresponding to an entity save value.

returnValues.description: The internal variable value

functions.name: GetKeyValues
functions.description:
Returns a table containing all key values the entity has.

Single key values can usually be retrieved with <page>Entity:GetInternalVariable</page>.

<note>This only includes engine defined key values. "targetname" is not an actual key value in-engine, use <page>Entity:GetName</page> for that instead. For custom key values, use <page>GM:EntityKeyValue</page> or <page>ENTITY:KeyValue</page> to capture and store them.</note>
<note>Not all key values can be retrieved. Some of them are write-only.</note>

returnValues.description: A table of key values.

functions.name: GetLayerCycle
functions.description:
Returns the animation cycle/frame for given layer.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entites!</note>

arguments.name: layerID
arguments.description: The Layer ID

returnValues.description: The animation cycle/frame for given layer.

functions.name: GetLayerDuration
functions.description:
Returns the duration of given layer.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entites!</note>

arguments.name: layerID
arguments.description: The Layer ID

returnValues.description: The duration of the layer

functions.name: GetLayerPlaybackRate
functions.description:
Returns the layer playback rate. See also <page>Entity:GetLayerDuration</page>.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entites!</note>

arguments.name: layerID
arguments.description: The Layer ID

returnValues.name: rate
returnValues.description: The current playback rate.

functions.name: GetLayerWeight
functions.description:
Returns the current weight of the layer. See <page>Entity:SetLayerWeight</page> for more information.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entites!</note>
<note>Next update: is shared</note>

arguments.name: layerID
arguments.description: The Layer ID

returnValues.description: The current weight of the layer

functions.name: GetLightingOriginEntity
functions.description: Returns the entity that is being used as the light origin position for this entity.

returnValues.description: The lighting entity. This will usually be NULL.

functions.name: GetLocalAngles
functions.description: Returns the rotation of the entity relative to its parent entity.

returnValues.description: Relative angle

functions.name: GetLocalAngularVelocity
functions.description: Returns the non-VPhysics angular velocity of the entity relative to its parent entity.

returnValues.description: The velocity

functions.name: GetLocalPos
functions.description: Returns entity's position relative to it's parent.

returnValues.description: Relative position

functions.name: GetManipulateBoneAngles
functions.description: Gets the entity's angle manipulation of the given bone. This is relative to the default angle, so the angle is zero when unmodified.

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description: The bone's ID

returnValues.description: The entity's angle manipulation of the given bone.

functions.name: GetManipulateBoneJiggle
functions.description:
Returns the jiggle amount of the entity's bone.

See <page>Entity:ManipulateBoneJiggle</page> for more info.

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description: The bone ID

returnValues.description: Returns a value ranging from 0 to 255 depending on the value set with <page>Entity:ManipulateBoneJiggle</page>.

functions.name: GetManipulateBonePosition
functions.description: Gets the entity's position manipulation of the given bone. This is relative to the default position, so it is zero when unmodified.

arguments.name: boneId
arguments.description: The bone's ID

returnValues.description: The entity's position manipulation of the given bone.

functions.name: GetManipulateBoneScale
functions.description: Gets the entity's scale manipulation of the given bone. Normal scale is Vector( 1, 1, 1 )

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description: The bone's ID

returnValues.description: The entity's scale manipulation of the given bone

functions.name: GetMaterial
functions.description:
Returns the material override for this entity.

Returns an empty string if no material override exists. Use <page>Entity:GetMaterials</page> to list it's default materials.

<bug issue="3362">The server's value takes priority on the client.</bug>

returnValues.description: material

functions.name: GetMaterials
functions.description:
Returns all materials of the entity's model.

This function is unaffected by <page>Entity:SetSubMaterial</page> as it returns the original materials.

<bug issue="3362">The server's values take priority on the client.</bug>

<bug>The table returned by this function will not contain materials if they are missing from the disk/repository. This means that if you are attempting to find the ID of a material to replace with <page>Entity:SetSubMaterial</page> and there are missing materials on the model, all subsequent materials will be offset in the table, meaning that the ID you are trying to get will be incorrect.</bug>

returnValues.description:
A table containing full paths to the materials of the model.

<bug issue="3216">This table is limited to 127 materials, even if the entity has more.</bug>

functions.name: GetMaterialType
functions.description: Returns the surface material of this entity.

returnValues.description: Surface material. See <page>Enums/MAT</page>

functions.name: GetMaxHealth
functions.description: Returns the max health that the entity was given. It can be set via <page>Entity:SetMaxHealth</page>.

returnValues.description: Max health.

functions.name: GetModel
functions.description:
Gets the model of given entity.

<bug issue="2246">This does not necessarily return the model's path, as is the case for brush and virtual models. This is intentional behaviour, however, there is currently no way to retrieve the actual file path.</bug>

returnValues.description:
The entity's model. Will be a filesystem path for most models.

This will be <page>nil</page> for entities which cannot have models, such as point entities.

functions.name: GetModelBounds
functions.description: Returns the entity's model bounds. This is different than the collision bounds/hull. This is not scaled with <page>Entity:SetModelScale</page>, and will return the model's original, unmodified mins and maxs.

returnValues.description: The minimum vector of the bounds
The maximum vector of the bounds

functions.name: GetModelContents
functions.description: Returns the contents of the entity's current model.

returnValues.description: The contents of the entity's model. See <page>Enums/CONTENTS</page>.

functions.name: GetModelPhysBoneCount
functions.description: Gets the physics bone count of the entity's model. This is only applicable to `anim` type <page>Scripted Entities</page> with ragdoll models.

returnValues.description: How many physics bones exist on the model.

functions.name: GetModelRadius
functions.description: Gets the models radius.

returnValues.description: The radius of the model

functions.name: GetModelRenderBounds
functions.description: Returns the entity's model render bounds. By default this will return the same bounds as <page>Entity:GetModelBounds</page>.

returnValues.description: The minimum vector of the bounds
The maximum vector of the bounds

functions.name: GetModelScale
functions.description: Gets the selected entity's model scale.

returnValues.description: Scale of that entity's model.

functions.name: GetMomentaryRotButtonPos
functions.description:
Returns the amount a momentary_rot_button entity is turned based on the given angle. 0 meaning completely turned closed, 1 meaning completely turned open.

<warning>This only works on momentary_rot_button entities.</warning>

arguments.description: The angle of rotation to compare - usually should be <page>Entity:GetAngles</page>.

returnValues.description: The amount the momentary_rot_button is turned, ranging from 0 to 1, or nil if the entity is not a momentary_rot_button.

functions.name: GetMoveCollide

returnValues.description: The move collide type, see <page>Enums/MOVECOLLIDE</page>

functions.name: GetMoveParent
functions.description:
Returns the movement parent of this entity.

See <page>Entity:SetMoveParent</page> for more info.

returnValues.description: The movement parent of this entity.

functions.name: GetMoveType
functions.description: Returns the entity's movetype

returnValues.description: Move type. See <page>Enums/MOVETYPE</page>

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: Returns the mapping name of this entity.

returnValues.description: The name of the Entity

functions.name: GetNetworkAngles
functions.description: Gets networked angles for entity.

returnValues.description: angle

functions.description:

arguments.name: key

arguments.name: fallback

arguments.name: key

arguments.name: fallback
arguments.description: The value to return if we failed to retrieve the value. ( If it isn't set )

functions.name: GetNetworkedFloat
functions.description:

functions.name: GetParentAttachment
functions.description:
Returns the attachment index of the entity's parent. Returns 0 if the entity is not parented to a specific attachment or if it isn't parented at all.

This is set by second argument of <page>Entity:SetParent</page> or the **SetParentAttachment** input.

returnValues.description: The parented attachment index

functions.name: GetParentPhysNum
functions.description: If the entity is parented to an entity that has a model with multiple physics objects (like a ragdoll), this is used to retrieve what physics object number the entity is parented to on it's parent.

returnValues.description: The physics object id, or nil if the entity has no parent

functions.name: GetParentWorldTransformMatrix
functions.description: Returns the position and angle of the entity's move parent as a 3x4 matrix (<page>VMatrix</page> is 4x4 so the fourth row goes unused). The first three columns store the angle as a [rotation matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotation_matrix), and the fourth column stores the position vector.

returnValues.description:
The position and angle matrix.

If the entity has no move parent, an identity matrix will be returned.
If the entity is <page text="parented to attachment">Entity:GetParentAttachment</page> 0 or the parent isn't a BaseAnimating entity, the equivalent of <page>Entity</page>:<page text="GetMoveParent()">Entity:GetMoveParent</page>:<page text="GetWorldTransformMatrix()">Entity:GetWorldTransformMatrix</page> will be returned.

See also <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: physNum
arguments.description: The number corresponding to the <page>PhysObj</page> to grab. Starts at 0.

returnValues.description: The physics object

See <page>Entity:SetPoseParameter</page>'s example.</warning>

functions.name: GetSaveTable
functions.description:
Returns a table of save values for an entity.

These tables are not the same between the client and the server, and different entities may have different fields.

You can get the list different fields an entity has by looking at it's source code ( the 2013 SDK can be found online, https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013 ). Accessible fields are defined by each DEFINE_FIELD and DEFINE_KEYFIELD inside the DATADESC block.

Take the headcrab, for example:

```
BEGIN_DATADESC( CBaseHeadcrab )
// m_nGibCount - don't save
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bHidden, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flTimeDrown, FIELD_TIME ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bCommittedToJump, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_vecCommittedJumpPos, FIELD_POSITION_VECTOR ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flNextNPCThink, FIELD_TIME ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flIgnoreWorldCollisionTime, FIELD_TIME ),

DEFINE_KEYFIELD( m_bStartBurrowed, FIELD_BOOLEAN, "startburrowed" ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bBurrowed, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flBurrowTime, FIELD_TIME ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_nContext, FIELD_INTEGER ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bCrawlFromCanister, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bMidJump, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_nJumpFromCanisterDir, FIELD_INTEGER ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bHangingFromCeiling, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flIlluminatedTime, FIELD_TIME ),

DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "Burrow", InputBurrow ),
DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "BurrowImmediate", InputBurrowImmediate ),
DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "Unburrow", InputUnburrow ),
DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "StartHangingFromCeiling", InputStartHangingFromCeiling ),
DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "DropFromCeiling", InputDropFromCeiling ),

// Function Pointers
DEFINE_THINKFUNC( EliminateRollAndPitch ),
DEFINE_THINKFUNC( ThrowThink ),
DEFINE_ENTITYFUNC( LeapTouch ),
END_DATADESC()
```


For each **DEFINE_FIELD**, the save table will have a key with name of **first** argument.

For each **DEFINE_KEYFIELD**, the save table will have a key with name of the **third** argument.

See <page>Entity:GetInternalVariable</page> for only retrieving one key of the save table.

arguments.name: showAll
arguments.description: If set, shows all variables, not just the ones for save.

returnValues.description:
A table containing all save values in key/value format.

The value may be a sequential table (starting with 1) if the field in question is an array in engine.

functions.description: Return the index of the model sequence that is currently active for the entity.

functions.name: GetSequenceActivityName
functions.description: Returns the activity name for the given sequence id.

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description: The sequence id.

returnValues.description: The <page>Enums/ACT</page> as a string, returns "Not Found!" with an invalid sequence and "No model!" when no model is set.

functions.name: GetSequenceCount
functions.description: Returns the amount of sequences ( animations ) the entity's model has.

returnValues.description: The amount of sequences ( animations ) the entity's model has.

functions.name: GetSequenceGroundSpeed
functions.description: Returns the ground speed of the entity's sequence.

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description: The sequence ID.

returnValues.description: The ground speed of this sequence.

functions.name: GetSequenceInfo
functions.description: Returns a table of information about an entity's sequence.

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description: The sequence id of the entity.

returnValues.description: Table of information about the entity's sequence, or nil is ID is out of range. See <page>Structures/SequenceInfo</page>

functions.name: GetSequenceList
functions.description: Returns a list of all sequences ( animations ) the model has.

returnValues.description: The list of all sequences ( animations ) the model has. The indices start with 0!

functions.name: GetSequenceMoveDist
functions.description: Returns an entity's sequence move distance (the change in position over the course of the entire sequence).

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description: The sequence index.

returnValues.description: The move distance of the sequence.

functions.name: GetSequenceMovement
functions.description: Returns the delta movement and angles of a sequence of the entity's model.

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description: The sequence index. See <page>Entity:GetSequenceName</page>.

arguments.name: startCycle
arguments.description: The sequence start cycle. 0 is the start of the animation, 1 is the end.

arguments.name: endCyclnde
arguments.description: The sequence end cycle. 0 is the start of the animation, 1 is the end. Values like 2, etc are allowed.

returnValues.description: Whether the operation was successful
The delta vector of the animation, how much the model's origin point moved.
The delta angle of the animation.

functions.name: GetSequenceMoveYaw
functions.description: Returns the change in heading direction in between the start and the end of the sequence.

arguments.name: seq
arguments.description: The sequence index. See <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page>.

returnValues.description: The yaw delta. Returns 99999 for no movement.

functions.name: GetSequenceName
functions.description:
Return the name of the sequence for the index provided.
Refer to <page>Entity:GetSequence</page> to find the current active sequence on this entity.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index of the sequence to look up.

returnValues.description: Name of the sequence.

Checks if the entity plays a sound when picked up by a player.

functions.name: GetSpawnFlags

Returns the material override for the given index.

Returns "" if no material override exists. Use <page>Entity:GetMaterials</page> to list it's default materials.

<bug issue="3362">The server's value takes priority on the client.</bug>

returnValues.description: entTable

functions.name: GetTouchTrace

Returns the last trace used in the collision callbacks such as <page>ENTITY:StartTouch</page>, <page>ENTITY:Touch</page> and <page>ENTITY:EndTouch</page>.

<note>This returns the last collision trace used, regardless of the entity that caused it. As such, it's only reliable when used in the hooks mentioned above</note>

returnValues.description: The <page>Structures/TraceResult</page>

functions.name: GetTransmitWithParent
functions.description: Returns true if the TransmitWithParent flag is set or not.

functions.name: GetUnFreezable
