arguments.description: Whether or not the entity should be persistent.

functions.name: SetPhysConstraintObjects
functions.description:
When called on a constraint entity, sets the two physics objects to be constrained.

Usage is not recommended as the Constraint library provides easier ways to deal with constraints.

arguments.name: Phys1
arguments.description: The first physics object to be constrained.

arguments.name: Phys2
arguments.description: The second physics object to be constrained.

functions.name: SetPhysicsAttacker
functions.description:
Sets the player who gets credit if this entity kills something with physics damage within the time limit.

<note>This can only be called on props, "anim" type SENTs and vehicles.</note>

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: Player who gets the kills. Setting this to a non-player entity will not work.

arguments.name: timeLimit
arguments.description: Time in seconds until the entity forgets its physics attacker and prevents it from getting the kill credit.

functions.name: SetPlaybackRate
functions.description: Allows you to set how fast an entity's animation will play, with 1.0 being the default speed.

arguments.name: fSpeed
arguments.description: How fast the animation will play.

functions.name: SetPos
functions.description:
Moves the entity to the specified position.

<note>If the new position doesn't take effect right away, you can use <page>Entity:SetupBones</page> to force it to do so. This issue is especially common when trying to render the same entity twice or more in a single frame at different positions.</note>

<warning>Entities with <page>Entity:GetSolid</page> of SOLID_BBOX will have their angles reset!</warning>

<bug issue="2447">This will fail inside of predicted functions called during player movement processing. This includes <page>WEAPON:PrimaryAttack</page> and <page>WEAPON:Think</page>.</bug>

<note>Some entities, such as ragdolls, will appear unaffected by this function in the next frame. Consider <page>PhysObj:SetPos</page> if necessary.</note>

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The position to move the entity to.

functions.name: SetPoseParameter
functions.description:
Sets the specified pose parameter to the specified value.

You should call <page>Entity:InvalidateBoneCache</page> after calling this function.

<note>Avoid calling this in draw hooks, especially when animating things, as it might cause visual artifacts.</note>

arguments.name: poseName
arguments.description: Name of the pose parameter.

arguments.name: poseValue
arguments.description: The value to set the pose to.

functions.name: SetPredictable
functions.description:
Sets whether an entity should be predictable or not.
When an entity is set as predictable, its DT vars can be changed during predicted hooks. This is useful for entities which can be controlled by player input.

Any datatable value that mismatches from the server will be overridden and a prediction error will be spewed.

Weapons are predictable by default, and the drive system uses this function to make the controlled prop predictable as well.

Visit  for a list of all predicted hooks, and the <page>Prediction</page> page.
For further technical information on the subject, visit [valve's wiki](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Prediction).

<note>This function resets the datatable variables everytime it's called, it should ideally be called when a player starts using the entity and when he stops</note>
<note>Entities set as predictable with this function will be unmarked when the user lags and receives a full packet update, to handle such case visit <page>GM:NotifyShouldTransmit</page></note>

arguments.name: setPredictable
arguments.description: whether to make this entity predictable or not.

functions.name: SetPreventTransmit
functions.description:
Prevents the server from sending any further information about the entity to a player.

<bug issue="1736">This does not work for nextbots.</bug>



<validate>When using this function, <page>Entity:SetFlexScale</page> will conflict with this function. Instead, consider using <page>Entity:SetFlexScale</page> on the client.</validate>

arguments.name: player
arguments.description: The player to stop networking the entity to.

arguments.name: stopTransmitting
arguments.description: true to stop the entity from networking, false to make it network again.

functions.name: SetRagdollAng
functions.description: Sets the bone angles. This is used alongside Kinect in <page>Entity:SetRagdollBuildFunction</page>, for more info see ragdoll_motion entity.

arguments.name: boneid
arguments.description: Bone ID

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: Angle to set

functions.name: SetRagdollBuildFunction
functions.description: Sets the function to build the ragdoll. This is used alongside Kinect, for more info see ragdoll_motion entity.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description:
The build function. This function has one argument:
* <page>Entity</page> ragdoll - The ragdoll to build

functions.name: SetRagdollPos
functions.description: Sets the bone position. This is used alongside Kinect in <page>Entity:SetRagdollBuildFunction</page>, for more info see ragdoll_motion entity.

arguments.name: boneid
arguments.description: Bone ID

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: Position to set

functions.name: SetRenderAngles
functions.description: Sets the render angles of the Entity.

arguments.name: newAngles
arguments.description: The new render angles to be set to.

functions.name: SetRenderBounds
functions.description: Sets the render bounds for the entity. For world space coordinates see <page>Entity:SetRenderBoundsWS</page>.

arguments.name: mins
arguments.description: The minimum corner of the bounds, relative to origin of the entity.

arguments.name: maxs
arguments.description: The maximum corner of the bounds, relative to origin of the entity.

arguments.name: add
arguments.description: If defined, adds this vector to maxs and subtracts this vector from mins.

functions.name: SetRenderBoundsWS
functions.description: Sets the render bounds for the entity in world space coordinates. For relative coordinates see <page>Entity:SetRenderBounds</page>.

arguments.name: mins
arguments.description: The minimum corner of the bounds, relative to origin of the world/map.

arguments.name: maxs
arguments.description: The maximum corner of the bounds, relative to origin of the world/map.

arguments.name: add
arguments.description: If defined, adds this vector to maxs and subtracts this vector from mins.

functions.name: SetRenderClipPlane
functions.description: Used to specify a plane, past which an object will be visually clipped.

arguments.name: planeNormal
arguments.description: The normal of the plane. Anything behind the normal will be clipped.

arguments.name: planePosition
arguments.description: The position of the plane.

functions.name: SetRenderClipPlaneEnabled
functions.description: Enables the use of clipping planes to "cut" objects.

arguments.name: enabled
arguments.description: Enable or disable clipping planes

functions.name: SetRenderFX
functions.description: Sets entity's render FX.

arguments.name: renderFX
arguments.description: The new render FX to set, see <page>Enums/kRenderFx</page>

functions.name: SetRenderMode
functions.description: Sets the render mode of the entity.

arguments.name: renderMode
arguments.description: New render mode to set, see <page>Enums/RENDERMODE</page>.

functions.name: SetRenderOrigin
functions.description: Set the origin in which the Entity will be drawn from.

arguments.name: newOrigin
arguments.description: The new origin in world coordinates where the Entity's model will now be rendered from.

functions.name: SetSaveValue
functions.description:
Sets a save value for an entity. You can see a full list of an entity's save values by creating it and printing <page>Entity:GetSaveTable</page>().

See <page>Entity:GetInternalVariable</page> for the opposite of this function.

<bug issue="4065">This does not type-check entity keys. Setting an entity key to a non-entity value will treat it as NULL.</bug>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the save value to set

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to set

returnValues.description: Key successfully set

functions.name: SetSequence
functions.description:
Sets the entity's model sequence.

If the specified sequence is already active, the animation will not be restarted. See <page>Entity:ResetSequence</page> for a function that restarts the animation even if it is already playing.

In some cases you want to run <page>Entity:ResetSequenceInfo</page> to make this function run.

<note>This will not work properly if called directly after calling <page>Entity:SetModel</page>. Consider waiting until the next Tick.</note>

<note>Will not work on players due to the animations being reset every frame by the base gamemode animation system in <page>GM:CalcMainActivity</page>. For Players, use in <page>GM:UpdateAnimation</page> instead.</note>

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description:
The sequence to play. Also accepts strings.

<note>If set to a string, the function will automatically call <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page> to retrieve the sequence ID as a number.</note>

functions.name: SetShouldPlayPickupSound
functions.description: Sets whether or not the entity should make a physics contact sound when it's been picked up by a player.

arguments.name: playsound
arguments.description: True to play the pickup sound, false otherwise.

functions.name: SetShouldServerRagdoll
functions.description:
Sets if entity should create a server ragdoll on death or a client one.

<note>Player ragdolls created with this enabled will have an owner set, see <page>Entity:SetOwner</page> for more information on what effects this has.</note>

<note>This is reset for players when they respawn. (<page>Entity:Spawn</page>)</note>

arguments.name: serverragdoll
arguments.description: Set true if ragdoll should be created on server, false if on client

functions.name: SetSkin
functions.description: Sets the skin of the entity.

arguments.name: skinIndex
arguments.description: 0-based index of the skin to use.

functions.name: SetSolid
functions.description: Sets the solidity of an entity.

arguments.name: solid_type
arguments.description: The solid type. See the <page>Enums/SOLID</page>.

functions.name: SetSolidFlags
functions.description:
Sets solid flag(s) for the entity.

This overrides any other flags the entity might have had. See <page>Entity:AddSolidFlags</page> for adding flags.

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: The flag(s) to set, see <page>Enums/FSOLID</page>.

functions.name: SetSpawnEffect
functions.description:
Sets whether the entity should use a spawn effect when it is created on the client.

See <page>Entity:GetSpawnEffect</page> for more information on how the effect is applied.

<note>This function will only have an effect when the entity spawns. After that it will do nothing even is set to true.</note>

arguments.name: spawnEffect
arguments.description: Sets if we should show a spawn effect.

functions.name: SetSubMaterial
functions.description:
Overrides a single material on the model of this entity.

To set a Lua material created with <page>Global.CreateMaterial</page>, just prepend a "!" to the material name.

<bug issue="3362">The server's value takes priority on the client.</bug>

arguments.name: index
arguments.description:
Index of the material to override, acceptable values are from 0 to 31.

Indexes are by <page>Entity:GetMaterials</page>, but you have to subtract 1 from them.

If called with no arguments, all sub materials will be reset.

arguments.name: material
arguments.description: The material to override the default one with. Set to nil to revert to default material.

functions.name: SetTable
functions.description: Changes the table that can be accessed by indexing an entity. Each entity starts with its own table by default.

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table for the entity to use

functions.name: SetTransmitWithParent
functions.description:
When this flag is set the entity will only transmit to the player when its parent is transmitted. This is useful for things like viewmodel attachments since without this flag they will transmit to everyone (and cause the viewmodels to transmit to everyone too).

<note>In the case of scripted entities, this will override <page>ENTITY:UpdateTransmitState</page></note>

arguments.name: onoff
arguments.description: Will set the TransmitWithParent flag on or off

functions.name: SetTrigger
functions.description:
Marks the entity as a trigger, so it will generate <page>ENTITY:StartTouch</page>, <page>ENTITY:Touch</page> and <page>ENTITY:EndTouch</page> callbacks.

Internally this is stored as <page text="FSOLID_TRIGGER">Enums/FSOLID</page> flag.

arguments.name: maketrigger
arguments.description: Make the entity trigger or not

functions.name: SetUnFreezable
functions.description: Sets whether an entity can be unfrozen, meaning that it cannot be unfrozen using the physgun.

arguments.name: freezable
arguments.description: True to make the entity unfreezable, false otherwise.

functions.name: SetupBones
functions.description:
Forces the entity to reconfigure its bones. You might need to call this after changing your model's scales or when manually drawing the entity multiple times at different positions.

<note>This calls the BuildBonePositions callback added via <page>Entity:AddCallback</page>, so avoid calling this function inside it to prevent an infinite loop.</note>

functions.name: SetupPhonemeMappings
functions.description:
Initializes the class names of an entity's phoneme mappings (mouth movement data). This is called by default with argument "phonemes" when a flex-based entity (such as an <page>NPC</page>) is created.

<note>TF2 phonemes can be accessed by using a path such as "player/scout/phonemes/phonemes" , check TF2's "tf2_misc_dir.vpk" with GCFScape for other paths, however it seems that TF2 sounds don't contain phoneme definitions anymore after being converted to mp3 and only rely on VCD animations, this needs to be further investigated</note>

arguments.name: fileRoot
arguments.description: The file prefix of the phoneme mappings (relative to "garrysmod/expressions/").

functions.name: SetUseType
functions.description: Sets the use type of an entity, affecting how often <page>ENTITY:Use</page> will be called for Lua entities.

arguments.name: useType
arguments.description: The use type to apply to the entity. Uses <page>Enums/_USE</page>.

functions.name: SetVar
functions.description:
Allows to quickly set variable to entity's <page>Entity:GetTable</page>.

<note>This will not network the variable to client(s). You want <page>Entity:SetNWString</page> and similar functions for that</note>

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Key of the value to set

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to set the variable to

functions.name: SetVelocity
functions.description:
Sets the entity's velocity. For entities with physics, consider using <page>PhysObj:SetVelocity</page> on the <page>PhysObj</page> of the entity.

<note>Actually binds to CBaseEntity::SetBaseVelocity() which sets the entity's velocity due to forces applied by other entities.</note>

<warning>If applied to a player, this will actually **ADD** velocity, not set it.</warning>

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: The new velocity to set.

functions.name: SetWeaponModel
functions.description:
Sets the model and associated weapon to this viewmodel entity.

This is used internally when the player switches weapon.

<note>View models are not drawn without a weapons associated to them.</note>
<warning>This will silently fail if the entity is not a viewmodel.</warning>

arguments.name: viewModel
arguments.description:
The model string to give to this viewmodel.
Example: "models/weapons/c_smg1.mdl"

arguments.name: weapon
arguments.description: The weapon entity to associate this viewmodel to.

functions.name: SkinCount
functions.description: Returns the amount of skins the entity has.

returnValues.description: The amount of skins the entity's model has.

functions.name: SnatchModelInstance
functions.description:
Moves the model instance from the source entity to this entity. This can be used to transfer decals that have been applied on one entity to another.

Both entities must have the same model.

arguments.name: srcEntity
arguments.description: Entity to move the model instance from.

returnValues.description: Whether the operation was successful or not

functions.name: Spawn
functions.description:
Initializes the entity and starts its networking. If called on a player, it will respawn them.

This calls <page>ENTITY:Initialize</page> on Lua-defined entities.

functions.name: StartLoopingSound
functions.description:
Starts a "looping" sound. As with any other sound playing methods, this function expects the sound file to be looping itself and will not automatically loop a non looping sound file as one might expect.

This function is almost identical to <page>Global.CreateSound</page>, with the exception of the sound being created in the STATIC channel and with normal attenuation.

See also <page>Entity:StopLoopingSound</page>

arguments.name: sound
arguments.description: Sound to play. Can be either a sound script or a filepath.

returnValues.description: The ID number of started sound starting with 0, or -1 if we failed for some reason.

functions.name: StartMotionController
functions.description:
Starts a motion controller in the physics engine tied to this entity's <page>PhysObj</page>, which enables the use of <page>ENTITY:PhysicsSimulate</page>.

The motion controller can later be destroyed via <page>Entity:StopMotionController</page>.

Motion controllers are used internally to control other Entities' <page>PhysObj</page>ects, such as the Gravity Gun, +use pickup and the Physics Gun.

This function should be called every time you recreate the Entity's <page>PhysObj</page>. Or alternatively you should call <page>Entity:AddToMotionController</page> on the new <page>PhysObj</page>.

Also see <page>Entity:AddToMotionController</page> and <page>Entity:RemoveFromMotionController</page>.

<note>Only works on a scripted <page>Entity</page> of anim type.</note>

functions.name: StopAndDestroyParticles
functions.description: Stops all particle effects parented to the entity and immediately destroys them.

functions.name: StopLoopingSound
functions.description: Stops a sound created by <page>Entity:StartLoopingSound</page>.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The sound ID returned by <page>Entity:StartLoopingSound</page>

functions.name: StopMotionController
functions.description: Stops the motion controller created with <page>Entity:StartMotionController</page>.

functions.name: StopParticleEmission
functions.description:
Stops all particle effects parented to the entity.

This is ran automatically on every client by <page>Entity:StopParticles</page> if called on the server.

functions.name: StopParticles
functions.description:
Stops any attached to the entity .pcf particles using <page>Global.ParticleEffectAttach</page>.

On client, this is the same as <page>Entity:StopParticleEmission</page>. ( and you should use StopParticleEmission instead )


On server, this is the same as running <page>Entity:StopParticleEmission</page> on every client.

functions.name: StopParticlesNamed
functions.description: Stops all particle effects parented to the entity with given name.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the particle to stop.

functions.name: StopParticlesWithNameAndAttachment
functions.description: Stops all particle effects parented to the entity with given name on given attachment.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the particle to stop.

arguments.name: attachment
arguments.description: The attachment of the entity to stop particles on.

functions.name: StopSound
functions.description: Stops emitting the given sound from the entity, especially useful for looping sounds.

arguments.name: sound
arguments.description: The name of the sound script or the filepath to stop playback of.

functions.name: TakeDamage
functions.description:
Applies the specified amount of damage to the entity with <page text="DMG_GENERIC">Enums/DMG</page> flag.

<warning>Calling this function on the victim entity in <page>ENTITY:OnTakeDamage</page> can cause infinite loops.</warning>

arguments.name: damageAmount
arguments.description: The amount of damage to be applied.

arguments.name: attacker
arguments.description: The entity that initiated the attack that caused the damage.

arguments.name: inflictor
arguments.description: The entity that applied the damage, eg. a weapon.

functions.name: TakeDamageInfo
functions.description:
Applies the damage specified by the damage info to the entity.

<warning>Calling this function on the victim entity in <page>ENTITY:OnTakeDamage</page> can cause infinite loops.</warning>

arguments.name: damageInfo
arguments.description: The damage to apply.

functions.name: TakePhysicsDamage
functions.description: Applies forces to our physics object in response to damage.

arguments.name: dmginfo
arguments.description: The damageinfo to apply. Only <page>CTakeDamageInfo:GetDamageForce</page> and <page>CTakeDamageInfo:GetDamagePosition</page> are used.

functions.name: TestPVS
functions.description:
Check if the given position or entity is within this entity's PVS.

See also <page>Entity:IsDormant</page>.

<note>The function won't take in to account <page>Global.AddOriginToPVS</page> and the like.</note>

arguments.name: testPoint
arguments.description: <page>Entity</page> or <page>Vector</page> to test against. If an entity is given, this function will test using its bounding box.

returnValues.description: True if the testPoint is within our PVS.

functions.name: TranslateBoneToPhysBone
functions.description:
Returns the ID of a <page>PhysObj</page> attached to the given bone. To be used with <page>Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum</page>.

See <page>Entity:TranslatePhysBoneToBone</page> for reverse function.

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description: The ID of a bone to look up the "physics root" bone of.

returnValues.description:
The <page>PhysObj</page> ID of the given bone.

* -1 if we somehow cannot translate

functions.name: TranslatePhysBoneToBone
functions.description:
Returns the boneID of the bone the given <page>PhysObj</page> is attached to.

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page> for reverse function.

arguments.name: physNum
arguments.description: The <page>PhysObj</page> number on the entity

returnValues.description: The boneID of the bone the <page>PhysObj</page> is attached to.

functions.name: UseClientSideAnimation
functions.description:
<note>Does nothing on server.</note>

Animations will be handled purely clientside instead of a fixed animtime, enabling interpolation. This does not affect layers and gestures.

functions.name: UseTriggerBounds
functions.description:
Enables or disables trigger bounds.

This will give the entity a "trigger box" that extends around its bounding box by boundSize units in X/Y and (boundSize / 2) in +Z (-Z remains the same).
The trigger box is world aligned and will work regardless of the object's solidity and collision group.

Valve use trigger boxes for all pickup items. Their bloat size is 24, a surprisingly large figure.

<note>The trigger boxes can be made visible as a light blue box by using the **ent_bbox** console command while looking at the entity. Alternatively a classname or entity index can be used as the first argument.

This requires **developer** to be set to **1**.</note>

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Enable or disable the bounds.

arguments.name: boundSize
arguments.description: The distance/size of the trigger bounds.

functions.name: ViewModelIndex
functions.description: Returns the index of this view model, it can be used to identify which one of the player's view models this entity is.

returnValues.description: View model index, ranges from 0 to 2, nil if the entity is not a view model

functions.name: Visible
functions.description:
Returns whether the target/given entity is visible from the this entity.

This is meant to be used only with NPCs.

Differences from a simple trace include:
* If target has **FL_NOTARGET**, returns false
* If **ai_ignoreplayers** is turned on and target is a player, returns false
* Reacts to **ai_LOS_mode**:
* * If 1, does a simple trace with **COLLISION_GROUP_NONE** and **MASK_BLOCKLOS**
* * If not, does a trace with **MASK_BLOCKLOS_AND_NPCS** ( - **CONTENTS_BLOCKLOS** is target is player ) and a custom LOS filter ( **CTraceFilterLOS** )
* Returns true if hits a vehicle the target is driving

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: Entity to check for visibility to.

returnValues.description: If the entities can see each other.

functions.name: VisibleVec
functions.description:
Returns true if supplied vector is visible from the entity's line of sight.

This is achieved similarly to a trace.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to check for visibility

returnValues.description: Within line of sight

functions.name: WaterLevel
functions.description:
Returns an integer that represents how deep in water the entity is.


* **0** - The entity isn't in water.

* **1** - Slightly submerged (at least to the feet).

* **2** - The majority of the entity is submerged (at least to the waist).

* **3** - Completely submerged.

returnValues.description: The water level.

functions.name: Weapon_SetActivity
functions.description:
Sets the activity of the entity's active weapon.

<note>This does nothing on the client.</note>
<note>Only works for CBaseCombatCharacter entities, which includes players and NPCs.</note>

arguments.name: act
arguments.description: Activity number. See <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: How long the animation should take in seconds.

functions.name: Weapon_TranslateActivity
functions.description:
Calls and returns <page>WEAPON:TranslateActivity</page> on the weapon the entity ( player or NPC ) carries.

Despite existing on client, it doesn't actually do anything on client.

arguments.name: act
arguments.description: The activity to translate

returnValues.description: The translated activity

functions.name: WorldSpaceAABB
functions.description: Returns two vectors representing the minimum and maximum extent of the entity's bounding box.

returnValues.description: The minimum vector for the entity's bounding box.
The maximum vector for the entity's bounding box.

functions.name: WorldSpaceCenter
functions.description: Returns the center of the entity according to its collision model.

returnValues.description: The center of the entity

functions.name: WorldToLocal
functions.description: Converts a worldspace vector into a vector local to an entity

arguments.name: wpos
arguments.description: The world vector

returnValues.description: The local vector

functions.name: WorldToLocalAngles
functions.description: Converts world angles to local angles ( local to the entity )

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The world angles

returnValues.description: The local angles

name: File
description:
This is the file object. It used used primarily to read or write binary data from files.

The object is returned by <page>file.Open</page>.

functions.name: Close
functions.description: Dumps the file changes to disk and closes the file handle which makes the handle useless.

functions.name: EndOfFile
functions.description: Returns whether the <page>File</page> object has reached the end of file or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the file has reached end or not.

functions.name: Flush
functions.description: Dumps the file changes to disk and saves the file.

functions.name: Read
functions.description: Reads the specified amount of chars and returns them as a binary string.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: Reads the specified amount of chars.

functions.name: ReadBool
functions.description: Reads one byte of the file and returns whether that byte was not 0.

returnValues.description: val

functions.name: ReadByte
functions.description: Reads one unsigned 8-bit integer from the file.

returnValues.description: The unsigned 8-bit integer from the file.

functions.name: ReadDouble
functions.description: Reads 8 bytes from the file converts them to a double and returns them.

returnValues.description: value

functions.name: ReadFloat
functions.description: Reads 4 bytes from the file converts them to a float and returns them.

returnValues.description: The read value

functions.name: ReadLine
functions.description:
Returns the contents of the file from the current position up until the end of the current line.

<note>This function will look specifically for `Line Feed` characters `\n` and will **completely ignore `Carriage Return` characters** `\r`.</note>
<note>This function will not return more than 8192 characters.</note>

returnValues.description: The string of data from the read line.

functions.name: ReadLong
functions.description: Reads a signed 32-bit integer from the file.

returnValues.description: A signed 32-bit integer

functions.name: ReadShort
functions.description: Reads a signed 16-bit integer from the file.

returnValues.description: int16

functions.name: ReadULong
functions.description: Reads a unsigned 32-bit integer from the file.

returnValues.description: An unsigned 32-bit integer

functions.name: ReadUShort
functions.description: Reads a unsigned 16-bit integer from the file.

returnValues.description: The 16-bit integer

functions.name: Seek
functions.description: Sets the file pointer to the specified position.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: Pointer position.

functions.name: Size
functions.description: Returns the size of the file in bytes.

functions.name: Skip
functions.description: Moves the file pointer by the specified amount of chars.

arguments.name: amount
arguments.description: The amount of chars to skip, can be negative to skip backwards.

returnValues.description: amount

functions.name: Tell
functions.description: Returns the current position of the file pointer.

returnValues.description: pos

functions.name: Write
functions.description: Writes the given string into the file.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: Binary data to write to the file.

functions.name: WriteBool
functions.description: Writes a boolean value to the file as one **byte**.

arguments.name: bool
arguments.description: The bool to be written to the file.

functions.name: WriteByte
functions.description: Write an 8-bit unsigned integer to the file.

arguments.name: uint8
arguments.description: The 8-bit unsigned integer to be written to the file.

functions.name: WriteDouble
functions.description: Writes a 8byte floating point double to the file.

arguments.name: double
arguments.description: The double to be written to the file.

functions.name: WriteFloat
functions.description: Writes a 4byte float to the file.

arguments.name: float
arguments.description: The float to be written to the file.

functions.name: WriteLong
functions.description: Writes a 32-bit signed integer to the file.

arguments.name: int32
arguments.description: The 32-bit signed integer to be written to the file.

functions.name: WriteShort
functions.description: Writes a 16-bit signed integer to the file.

arguments.name: int16
arguments.description: The 16-bit signed integer to be written to the file.

functions.name: WriteULong
functions.description: Writes an unsigned 32-bit integer to the file.

arguments.name: uint32
arguments.description: The unsigned 32-bit integer to be written to the file.

functions.name: WriteUShort
functions.description: Writes an unsigned 16-bit integer to the file.

arguments.name: uint16
arguments.description: The unsigned 16-bit integer to the file.

name: IGModAudioChannel
description: A sound channel returned by a callback of <page>sound.PlayURL</page> and <page>sound.PlayFile</page>.

functions.name: EnableLooping
functions.description: Enables or disables looping of audio channel, requires noblock flag.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Enable or disable looping of this audio channel.

functions.name: FFT
functions.description:
Computes the [DFT (discrete Fourier transform)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discrete_Fourier_transform) of the sound channel.

The size parameter specifies the number of consecutive audio samples to use as the input to the DFT and is restricted to a power of two. A [Hann window](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hann_function) is applied to the input data.

The computed DFT has the same number of frequency bins as the number of samples. Only half of this DFT is returned, since [the DFT magnitudes are symmetric for real input data](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discrete_Fourier_transform#The_real-input_DFT). The magnitudes of the DFT (values from 0 to 1) are used to fill the output table, starting at index 1.

**Visualization protip:** For a size N DFT, bin k (1-indexed) corresponds to a frequency of (k - 1) / N * sampleRate.

**Visualization protip:** Sound energy is proportional to the square of the magnitudes. Adding magnitudes together makes no sense physically, but adding energies does.

**Visualization protip:** The human ear works on a logarithmic amplitude scale. You can convert to [decibels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decibel) by taking 20 * <page>math.log10</page> of frequency magnitudes, or 10 * <page>math.log10</page> of energy. The decibel values will range from -infinity to 0.

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to output the DFT magnitudes (numbers between 0 and 1) into. Indices start from 1.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: The number of samples to use. See <page>Enums/FFT</page>

returnValues.description: The number of frequency bins that have been filled in the output table.

functions.name: Get3DCone
functions.description: Returns 3D cone of the sound channel. See <page>IGModAudioChannel:Set3DCone</page>.

returnValues.description: The angle of the inside projection cone in degrees.
The angle of the outside projection cone in degrees.
The delta-volume outside the outer projection cone.

functions.name: Get3DEnabled
functions.description: Returns if the sound channel is currently in 3D mode or not. This value will be affected by <page>IGModAudioChannel:Set3DEnabled</page>.

returnValues.description: Is currently 3D or not.

functions.name: Get3DFadeDistance
functions.description: Returns 3D fade distances of a sound channel.

returnValues.description: The minimum distance. The channel's volume is at maximum when the listener is within this distance
The maximum distance. The channel's volume stops decreasing when the listener is beyond this distance

functions.name: GetAverageBitRate
functions.description: Returns the average bit rate of the sound channel.

returnValues.description: The average bit rate of the sound channel.

functions.name: GetBitsPerSample
functions.description:
Retrieves the number of bits per sample of the sound channel.

Doesn't work for mp3 and ogg files.

returnValues.description: Number of bits per sample, or 0 if unknown.

functions.name: GetFileName
functions.description: Returns the filename for the sound channel.

returnValues.description: The file name. This will not be always what you have put into the <page>sound.PlayURL</page> as first argument.

functions.name: GetLength
functions.description: Returns the length of sound played by the sound channel.

returnValues.description: The length of the sound. This value seems to be less then 0 for continuous radio streams.

functions.name: GetLevel
functions.description: Returns the right and left levels of sound played by the sound channel.

returnValues.description: The left sound level. The value is between 0 and 1.
The right sound level. The value is between 0 and 1.

functions.name: GetPan
functions.description: Gets the relative volume of the left and right channels.

returnValues.name: pan
returnValues.description: Relative volume between the left and right channels. -1 means only in left channel, 0 is center and 1 is only in the right channel. 0 by default.

functions.name: GetPlaybackRate
functions.description: Returns the playback rate of the sound channel.

returnValues.description: The current playback rate of the sound channel

functions.name: GetPos
functions.description: Returns position of the sound channel

returnValues.description: The position of the sound channel, previously set by <page>IGModAudioChannel:SetPos</page>

functions.name: GetSamplingRate
functions.description: Returns the sample rate for currently playing sound.

returnValues.description: The sample rate in Hz. This should always be 44100.

functions.name: GetState
functions.description: Returns the state of a sound channel

returnValues.description: The state of the sound channel, see <page>Enums/GMOD_CHANNEL</page>

functions.name: GetTagsHTTP
functions.description: Retrieves HTTP headers from a bass stream channel created by <page>sound.PlayURL</page>, if available.

returnValues.name: info
returnValues.description:
Returns a table of HTTP headers.
Returns nil if no information is available.

functions.name: GetTagsID3
functions.description:
Retrieves the ID3 version 1 info from a bass channel created by <page>sound.PlayFile</page> or <page>sound.PlayURL</page>, if available.

ID3v2 is not supported.

returnValues.name: info
returnValues.description:
Returns a table containing the information.
Returns nil if no information is available.

functions.name: GetTagsMeta
functions.description: Retrieves meta stream info from a bass stream channel created by <page>sound.PlayURL</page>, if available.

returnValues.name: info
returnValues.description:
Returns a string containing the information.
Returns nil if no information is available.

functions.name: GetTagsOGG
functions.description: Retrieves OGG media info tag, from a bass channel created by <page>sound.PlayURL</page> or <page>sound.PlayFile</page>, if available.

returnValues.name: info
returnValues.description:
Returns a table containing the information.
Returns nil if no information is available.

functions.name: GetTagsVendor
functions.description: Retrieves OGG Vendor tag, usually containing the application that created the file, from a bass channel created by <page>sound.PlayURL</page> or <page>sound.PlayFile</page>, if available.

returnValues.name: info
returnValues.description:
Returns a string containing the information.
Returns nil if no information is available.

functions.name: GetTime
functions.description: Returns the current time of the sound channel

returnValues.description: The current time of the stream

functions.name: GetVolume
functions.description: Returns volume of a sound channel

returnValues.description: The volume of the sound channel

functions.name: Is3D
functions.description: Returns if the sound channel is in 3D mode or not.

returnValues.description: Is 3D or not.

functions.name: IsBlockStreamed
functions.description: Returns whether the audio stream is block streamed or not.

returnValues.description: Is the audio stream block streamed or not.

functions.name: IsLooping
functions.description: Returns if the sound channel is looping or not.

returnValues.description: Is looping or not.

functions.name: IsOnline
functions.description: Returns if the sound channel is streamed from the Internet or not.

returnValues.description: Is online or not.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns if the sound channel is valid or not.

returnValues.description: Is the sound channel valid or not

functions.name: Pause
functions.description: Pauses the stream. It can be started again using <page>IGModAudioChannel:Play</page>

functions.name: Play
functions.description: Starts playing the stream.

functions.name: Set3DCone
functions.description: Sets 3D cone of the sound channel.

arguments.name: innerAngle
arguments.description:
The angle of the inside projection cone in degrees.




Range is from 0 (no cone) to 360 (sphere), -1 = leave current.

arguments.name: outerAngle
arguments.description:
The angle of the outside projection cone in degrees.




Range is from 0 (no cone) to 360 (sphere), -1 = leave current.

arguments.name: outerVolume
arguments.description:
The delta-volume outside the outer projection cone.




Range is from 0 (silent) to 1 (same as inside the cone), less than 0 = leave current.

functions.name: Set3DEnabled
functions.description:
Sets the 3D mode of the channel. This will affect <page>IGModAudioChannel:Get3DEnabled</page> but not <page>IGModAudioChannel:Is3D</page>.

This feature **requires** the channel to be initially created in 3D mode, i.e. <page>IGModAudioChannel:Is3D</page> should return true or this function will do nothing.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: true to enable, false to disable 3D.

functions.name: Set3DFadeDistance
functions.description: Sets 3D fade distances of a sound channel.

arguments.name: min
arguments.description:
The minimum distance. The channel's volume is at maximum when the listener is within this distance.




0 or less = leave current.

arguments.name: max
arguments.description:
The maximum distance. The channel's volume stops decreasing when the listener is beyond this distance.




0 or less = leave current.

functions.name: SetPan
functions.description: Sets the relative volume of the left and right channels.

arguments.name: pan
arguments.description: Relative volume between the left and right channels. -1 means only in left channel, 0 is center and 1 is only in the right channel.

functions.name: SetPlaybackRate
functions.description: Sets the playback rate of the sound channel. May not work with high values for radio streams.

arguments.name: rate
arguments.description: Playback rate to set to. 1 is normal speed, 0.5 is half the normal speed, etc.

functions.name: SetPos
functions.description: Sets position of sound channel in case the sound channel has a 3d option set.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to put the sound into

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: The direction of the sound

functions.name: SetTime
functions.description:
Sets the sound channel to specified time ( Rewind to that position of the song ). Does not work on online radio streams.

Streamed sounds must have "noblock" parameter for this to work and <page>IGModAudioChannel:IsBlockStreamed</page> must return false.

arguments.name: secs
arguments.description: The time to set the stream to, in seconds.

functions.name: SetVolume
functions.description: Sets the volume of a sound channel

arguments.name: volume
arguments.description: Volume to set. 1 meaning 100% volume, 0.5 is 50% and 3 is 300%, etc.

functions.name: Stop
functions.description:
Stop the stream. It can be started again using <page>IGModAudioChannel:Play</page>.

<bug issue="1497">Calling this invalidates the IGModAudioChannel object rendering it unusable for further functions.</bug>

name: IMaterial
description:
A Material object. It represents a game material, similarly to how a .vmt file does.

It can be created with <page>Global.Material</page> or <page>Global.CreateMaterial</page>.

functions.name: GetColor
functions.description:
Returns the color of the specified pixel of the $basetexture, only works for materials created from PNG files.

Basically identical to <page>ITexture:GetColor</page> used on <page>IMaterial:GetTexture</page>( "$basetexture" ).

<bug issue="2407">The returned color will not have the color metatable.</bug>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X coordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y coordinate.

returnValues.description: The color of the pixel as a <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: GetFloat
functions.description: Returns the specified material value as a float, or nil if the value is not set.

arguments.name: materialFloat
arguments.description: The name of the material value.

returnValues.description: float

functions.name: GetInt
functions.description:
Returns the specified material value as a int, rounds the value if its a float, or nil if the value is not set.

<note>Please note that certain material flags such as `$model` are stored in the `$flags` variable and cannot be directly retrieved with this function. See the full list here: <page>Material Flags</page></note>

arguments.name: materialInt
arguments.description: The name of the material integer.

returnValues.description: The retrieved value as an integer

functions.name: GetKeyValues
functions.description: Gets all the key values defined for the material.

returnValues.description: The material's key values.

functions.name: GetMatrix
functions.description: Returns the specified material matrix as a int, or nil if the value is not set or is not a matrix.

arguments.name: materialMatrix
arguments.description: The name of the material matrix.

returnValues.description: matrix

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: Returns the name of the material, in most cases the path.

returnValues.description: Material name/path

functions.name: GetShader
functions.description:
Returns the name of the materials shader.

<bug issue="3256">This function does not work serverside on Linux SRCDS.</bug>

returnValues.description: shaderName

functions.name: GetString
functions.description: Returns the specified material string, or nil if the value is not set or if the value can not be converted to a string.

arguments.name: materialString
arguments.description: The name of the material string.

returnValues.description: The value as a string

functions.name: GetTexture
functions.description: Returns an <page>ITexture</page> based on the passed shader parameter.

arguments.name: param
arguments.description: The [shader parameter](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Category:List_of_Shader_Parameters) to retrieve. This should normally be `$basetexture`.

returnValues.description: The value of the shader parameter. Returns nothing if the param doesn't exist.

functions.name: GetVector
functions.description:
Returns the specified material vector, or nil if the value is not set.

See also <page>IMaterial:GetVectorLinear</page>

arguments.name: materialVector
arguments.description: The name of the material vector.

returnValues.description: The color vector

functions.name: GetVectorLinear
functions.description:
Returns the specified material linear color vector, or nil if the value is not set.

See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gamma_correction

See also <page>IMaterial:GetVector</page>

arguments.name: materialVector
arguments.description: The name of the material vector.

returnValues.description: The linear color vector

functions.name: Height
functions.description: Returns the height of the member texture set for $basetexture.

returnValues.description: height

functions.name: IsError
functions.description: Returns whenever the material is valid, i.e. whether it was not loaded successfully from disk or not.

returnValues.description: Is this material the error material? (___error)

functions.name: Recompute
functions.description:
Recomputes the material's snapshot. This needs to be called if you have changed variables on your material and it isn't changing.

Be careful though - this function is slow - so try to call it only when needed!

functions.name: SetFloat
functions.description: Sets the specified material float to the specified float, does nothing on a type mismatch.

arguments.name: materialFloat
arguments.description: The name of the material float.

arguments.name: float
arguments.description: The new float value.

functions.name: SetInt
functions.description:
Sets the specified material value to the specified int, does nothing on a type mismatch.

<note>Please note that certain material flags such as `$model` are stored in the `$flags` variable and cannot be directly set with this function. See the full list here: <page>Material Flags</page></note>

arguments.name: materialInt
arguments.description: The name of the material int.

arguments.name: int
arguments.description: The new int value.

functions.name: SetMatrix
functions.description: Sets the specified material value to the specified matrix, does nothing on a type mismatch.

arguments.name: materialMatrix
arguments.description: The name of the material int.

arguments.name: matrix
arguments.description: The new matrix.

functions.name: SetShader
functions.description: <deprecated>This function does nothing</deprecated>The functionality of this function was removed due to the amount of crashes it caused.

arguments.name: shaderName
arguments.description: Name of the shader

functions.name: SetString
functions.description: Sets the specified material value to the specified string, does nothing on a type mismatch.

arguments.name: materialString
arguments.description: The name of the material string.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The new string.

functions.name: SetTexture
functions.description: Sets the specified material texture to the specified texture, does nothing on a type mismatch.

arguments.name: materialTexture
arguments.description: The name of the keyvalue on the material to store the texture on.

arguments.name: texture
arguments.description: The new texture. This can also be a string, the name of the new texture.

functions.name: SetUndefined
functions.description: Unsets the value for the specified material value.

arguments.name: materialValueName
arguments.description: The name of the material value to be unset.

functions.name: SetVector
functions.description: Sets the specified material vector to the specified vector, does nothing on a type mismatch.

arguments.name: MaterialVector
arguments.description: The name of the material vector.

arguments.name: vec
arguments.description: The new vector.

functions.name: Width
functions.description: Returns the width of the member texture set for $basetexture.

returnValues.description: width

name: IMesh
description:
Renderable mesh object, can be used to create models on the fly. The only way to create your own IMesh object is to call <page text="Mesh">Global.Mesh</page>.

<bug issue="2301">IMeshes only respond to one projected texture.</bug>

functions.name: BuildFromTriangles
functions.description:
Builds the mesh from a table mesh vertexes.

See <page>Global.Mesh</page> and <page>util.GetModelMeshes</page> for examples.

arguments.name: vertexes
arguments.description: A table consisting of <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page>s.

functions.name: Destroy
functions.description: Deletes the mesh and frees the memory used by it.

functions.name: Draw
functions.description: Renders the mesh with the active matrix.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns whether this <page>IMesh</page> is valid or not.

returnValues.description: Whether this <page>IMesh</page> is valid or not.

name: IRestore
description:
The object used in the <page>saverestore</page>, mainly in <page>saverestore.AddRestoreHook</page>.

It allows you to read blocks directly from the save game files used by Half-Life 2 save system when such save is loaded.

functions.name: EndBlock
functions.description:
Ends current data block started with <page>IRestore:StartBlock</page> and returns to the parent block.

To avoid all sorts of errors, you **must** end all blocks you start.

functions.name: ReadAngle
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as an <page>Angle</page>.

returnValues.description: The angle that has been read

functions.name: ReadBool
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as a <page>boolean</page>.

returnValues.description: The boolean that has been read

functions.name: ReadEntity
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as an <page>Entity</page>.

returnValues.description: The entity that has been read.

functions.name: ReadFloat
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as a floating point <page>number</page>.

returnValues.description: The read floating point number.

functions.name: ReadInt
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as an integer <page>number</page>.

returnValues.description: The read integer number.

functions.name: ReadString
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as a <page>string</page>.

returnValues.description: The read string. Maximum length is 1024.

functions.name: ReadVector
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as a <page>Vector</page>.

returnValues.description: The read vector.

functions.name: StartBlock
functions.description: Loads next block of data to be read inside current block. Blocks **must** be ended with <page>IRestore:EndBlock</page>.

returnValues.description: The name of the next data block to be read.

name: ISave
description:
The object used in the <page>saverestore</page>, mainly in <page>saverestore.AddSaveHook</page>.

It allows you to write blocks directly into the save game files used by Half-Life 2 save system when such save is being saved.

functions.name: EndBlock
functions.description:
Ends current data block started with <page>ISave:StartBlock</page> and returns to the parent block.

To avoid all sorts of errors, you **must** end all blocks you start.

functions.name: StartBlock
functions.description: Starts a new block of data that you can write to inside current block. Blocks **must** be ended with <page>ISave:EndBlock</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the new block. Used for determining which block is which, returned by <page>IRestore:StartBlock</page> during game load.

functions.name: WriteAngle
functions.description: Writes an <page>Angle</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The angle to write.

functions.name: WriteBool
functions.description: Writes a <page>boolean</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: bool
arguments.description: The boolean to write.

functions.name: WriteEntity
functions.description: Writes an <page>Entity</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to write.

functions.name: WriteFloat
functions.description: Writes a floating point <page>number</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: float
arguments.description: The floating point number to write.

functions.name: WriteInt
functions.description: Writes an integer <page>number</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: int
arguments.description: The integer number to write.

functions.name: WriteString
functions.description: Writes a <page>string</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The string to write. Maximum length is 1024.

functions.name: WriteVector
functions.description: Writes a <page>Vector</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: vec
arguments.description: The vector to write.

name: ITexture
description: An object representing game texture, like a .vtf file. Do not confuse with <page>IMaterial</page>. Returned by <page>IMaterial:GetTexture</page>

functions.name: Download
functions.description: Invokes the generator of the texture. Reloads file based textures from disk and clears render target textures.

functions.name: GetColor
functions.description:
Returns the color of the specified pixel, only works for textures created from PNG files.

<bug issue="2407">The returned color will not have the color metatable.</bug>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X coordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y coordinate.

returnValues.description: The color of the pixel as a <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: GetMappingHeight
functions.description: Returns the true unmodified height of the texture.

returnValues.description: height

functions.name: GetMappingWidth
functions.description: Returns the true unmodified width of the texture.

returnValues.description: width

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: Returns the name of the texture, in most cases the path.

returnValues.description: name

functions.name: Height
functions.description: Returns the modified height of the texture, this value may be affected by mipmapping and other factors.

returnValues.description: height

functions.name: IsError
functions.description:
Returns whenever the texture is valid. (i.e. was loaded successfully or not)

<note>The "error" texture is a valid texture, and therefore this function will return false when used on it. Use <page>ITexture:IsErrorTexture</page>, instead.</note>

returnValues.description: Whether the texture was loaded successfully or not.

functions.name: IsErrorTexture
functions.description: Returns whenever the texture is the error texture (pink and black checkerboard pattern).

returnValues.description: Whether the texture is the error texture or not.

functions.name: Width
functions.description: Returns the modified width of the texture, this value may be affected by mipmapping and other factors.

returnValues.description: width

name: IVideoWriter
description: This is returned from <page>video.Record</page>.

functions.name: AddFrame
functions.description: Adds the current framebuffer to the video stream.

arguments.name: frameTime
arguments.description: Usually set to what <page>Global.FrameTime</page> is, or simply 1/fps.

arguments.name: downsample
arguments.description: If true it will downsample the whole screenspace to the videos width and height, otherwise it will just record from the top left corner to the given width and height and therefor not the whole screen.

functions.name: Finish
functions.description: Ends the video recording and dumps it to disk.

functions.name: Height
functions.description: Returns the height of the video stream.

returnValues.description: height

functions.name: SetRecordSound
functions.description: Sets whether to record sound or not.

arguments.name: record
arguments.description: Record.

functions.name: Width
functions.description: Returns the width of the video stream.

returnValues.description: width

name: MarkupObject
description: Object containing parsed markup for later rendering. Created by <page>markup.Parse</page>.

functions.name: Draw
functions.description: Draws the computed markupobject to the screen.

arguments.name: xOffset
arguments.description: The X coordinate on the screen.

arguments.name: yOffset
arguments.description: The Y coordinate on the screen.

arguments.name: xAlign
arguments.description: The alignment of the x coordinate using <page>Enums/TEXT_ALIGN</page>

arguments.name: yAlign
arguments.description: The alignment of the y coordinate using <page>Enums/TEXT_ALIGN</page>

arguments.name: alphaoverride
arguments.description: Sets the alpha of all drawn objects to this.

functions.name: GetHeight
functions.description: Gets computed the height of the markupobject.

returnValues.name: Height
returnValues.description: The computed height.

functions.name: GetWidth
functions.description: Gets computed the width of the markupobject.

returnValues.name: Width
returnValues.description: The computed width.

functions.name: Size
functions.description: Gets computed the width and height of the markupobject.

returnValues.description: The computed width.
The computed height.

name: NextBot
description:
NextBots are a new system to create NPCs in the Source Engine, utilizing the more powerful <page>navmesh</page> system for navigation over the old node based system.

This page lists all possible functions usable with NextBots.

See <page>NextBot NPC Creation</page> for more information on how to create NextBot NPCs.

functions.name: BecomeRagdoll
functions.description: Become a ragdoll and remove the entity.

arguments.name: info
arguments.description: Damage info passed from an onkilled event

returnValues.description: The created ragdoll, if any.

functions.name: BodyMoveXY
functions.description:
Should only be called in BodyUpdate. This sets the move_x and move_y pose parameters of the bot to fit how they're currently moving, sets the animation speed to suit the ground speed, and calls FrameAdvance.

<bug issue="3420">This function might cause crashes with some activities.</bug>

functions.name: FindSpot
functions.description: Like <page>NextBot:FindSpots</page> but only returns a vector.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Either "random", "near", "far"

arguments.name: options
arguments.description:
This table should contain the search info.





<page>string</page> type - The type (Only'hiding' for now)

<page>Vector</page> pos - the position to search.

<page>number</page> radius - the radius to search.

<page>number</page> stepup - the highest step to step up.

<page>number</page> stepdown - the highest we can step down without being hurt.

returnValues.description: If it finds a spot it will return a vector. If not it will return nil.

functions.name: FindSpots
functions.description: Returns a table of hiding spots.

arguments.name: specs
arguments.description:
This table should contain the search info.





<page>string</page> type - The type (optional, only 'hiding' supported)

<page>Vector</page> pos - the position to search.

<page>number</page> radius - the radius to search.

<page>number</page> stepup - the highest step to step up.

<page>number</page> stepdown - the highest we can step down without being hurt.

returnValues.description:
An unsorted table of tables containing:




<page>Vector</page> vector - The position of the hiding spot

<page>number</page> distance - the distance to that position

functions.name: GetActivity
functions.description: Returns the currently running activity

returnValues.description: The current activity

functions.name: GetRangeSquaredTo
functions.description:
Returns squared distance to an entity or a position.

See also <page>NextBot:GetRangeTo</page>.

arguments.name: to
arguments.description: The position to measure distance to. Can be an entity.

returnValues.description: The squared distance

functions.name: GetRangeTo
functions.description:
Returns the distance to an entity or position.

See also <page>NextBot:GetRangeSquaredTo</page>.

arguments.name: to
arguments.description: The position to measure distance to. Can be an entity.

returnValues.description: The distance

functions.name: GetSolidMask
functions.description: Returns the solid mask for given NextBot.

returnValues.description: The solid mask, see <page>Enums/CONTENTS</page> and <page>Enums/MASK</page>

functions.name: HandleStuck
functions.description:
Called from Lua when the NPC is stuck. This should only be called from the behaviour coroutine - so if you want to override this function and do something special that yields - then go for it.

You should always call self.loco:ClearStuck() in this function to reset the stuck status - so it knows it's unstuck. See <page>CLuaLocomotion:ClearStuck</page>.

functions.name: MoveToPos
functions.description: To be called in the behaviour coroutine only! Will yield until the bot has reached the goal or is stuck

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position we want to get to

arguments.name: options
arguments.description:
A table containing a bunch of tweakable options.





<page>number</page> lookahead - Minimum look ahead distance.


<page>number</page> tolerance - How close we must be to the goal before it can be considered complete.


<page>boolean</page> draw - Draw the path. Only visible on listen servers and single player.


<page>number</page> maxage - Maximum age of the path before it times out.


<page>number</page> repath - Rebuilds the path after this number of seconds.

returnValues.description: Either "failed", "stuck", "timeout" or "ok" - depending on how the NPC got on

functions.name: PlaySequenceAndWait
functions.description: To be called in the behaviour coroutine only! Plays an animation sequence and waits for it to end before returning.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The sequence name

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: Playback Rate of that sequence

functions.name: SetSolidMask
functions.description:
Sets the solid mask for given NextBot.

The default solid mask of a NextBot is <page text="MASK_NPCSOLID">Enums/MASK</page>.

arguments.name: mask
arguments.description: The new mask, see <page>Enums/CONTENTS</page> and <page>Enums/MASK</page>

functions.name: StartActivity
functions.description: Start doing an activity (animation)

arguments.name: activity
arguments.description: One of the <page>Enums/ACT</page>

name: NPC
description: This is a list of all methods only available for NPCs. It is also possible to call [Entity](http://wiki.garrysmod.com/index.php?title=Category:Entity) functions on NPCs.

functions.name: AddEntityRelationship
functions.description:
Makes the NPC like, hate, feel neutral towards, or fear the entity in question. If you want to setup relationship towards a certain entity `class`, use <page>NPC:AddRelationship</page>.

<note>NPCs do not see <page>NextBot</page>s by default. This can be fixed by adding the <page text="FL_OBJECT">Enums/FL</page> flag to the NextBot.</note>

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The entity for the relationship to be applied to.

arguments.name: disposition
arguments.description: A <page>Enums/D</page> representing the relationship type.

arguments.name: priority
arguments.description: How strong the relationship is.

functions.name: AddRelationship
functions.description: Changes how an NPC feels towards another NPC.  If you want to setup relationship towards a certain `entity`, use <page>NPC:AddEntityRelationship</page>.

arguments.name: relationstring
arguments.description:
A string representing how the relationship should be set up.
Should be formatted as "npc_class <page>Enums/D</page> numberPriority".

functions.name: AlertSound
functions.description: Force an NPC to play his Alert sound.

functions.name: CapabilitiesAdd
functions.description: Adds a capability to the NPC.

arguments.name: capabilities
arguments.description: Capabilities to add, see <page>Enums/CAP</page>

functions.name: CapabilitiesClear
functions.description: Removes all of Capabilities the NPC has.

functions.name: CapabilitiesGet
functions.description: Returns the NPC's capabilities along the ones defined on its weapon.

returnValues.description:
The capabilities as a bitflag.
See <page>Enums/CAP</page>

functions.name: CapabilitiesRemove
functions.description: Remove a certain capability.

arguments.name: capabilities
arguments.description: Capabilities to remove, see <page>Enums/CAP</page>

functions.name: Classify
functions.description: Returns the NPC class. Do not confuse with <page>Entity:GetClass</page>!

returnValues.description: See <page>Enums/CLASS</page>

functions.name: ClearCondition
functions.description: Clears out the specified <page>Enums/COND</page> on this NPC.

arguments.name: condition
arguments.description: The <page>Enums/COND</page> to clear out.

functions.name: ClearEnemyMemory
functions.description: Clears the Enemy from the NPC's memory, effectively forgetting it until met again with either the NPC vision or with <page>NPC:UpdateEnemyMemory</page>.

functions.name: ClearExpression
functions.description: Clears the NPC's current expression which can be set with <page>NPC:SetExpression</page>.

functions.name: ClearGoal
functions.description: Clears the current NPC goal or target.

functions.name: ClearSchedule
functions.description: Stops the current schedule that the NPC is doing.

functions.name: ConditionName
functions.description: Translates condition ID to a string.

arguments.name: cond
arguments.description: The NPCs condition ID, see <page>Enums/COND</page>

returnValues.description: A human understandable string equivalent of that condition.

functions.name: Disposition
functions.description: Returns the way the NPC "feels" about the entity.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to get the disposition from.

returnValues.description: The NPCs disposition, see <page>Enums/D</page>.

functions.name: DropWeapon
functions.description: Forces the NPC to drop the specified weapon.

arguments.name: weapon
arguments.description: Weapon to be dropped. If unset, will default to the currently equipped weapon.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: If set, launches the weapon at given position. There is a limit to how far it is willing to throw the weapon. Overrides velocity argument.

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: If set and previous argument is unset, launches the weapon with given velocity. If the velocity is higher than 400, it will be clamped to 400.

functions.name: ExitScriptedSequence
functions.description: Makes an NPC exit a scripted sequence, if one is playing.

functions.name: FearSound
functions.description: Force an NPC to play his Fear sound.

functions.name: FoundEnemySound
functions.description: Force an NPC to play its FoundEnemy sound.

functions.name: GetActiveWeapon
functions.description: Returns the weapon the NPC is currently carrying, or <page text="NULL">Global_Variables</page>.

returnValues.description: The NPCs current weapon

functions.name: GetActivity
functions.description: Returns the NPC's current activity.

returnValues.description: Current activity, see <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

functions.name: GetAimVector
functions.description: Returns the aim vector of the NPC. NPC alternative of <page>Player:GetAimVector</page>.

returnValues.description: The aim direction of the NPC.

functions.name: GetArrivalActivity
functions.description: Returns the activity to be played when the NPC arrives at its goal

functions.name: GetArrivalSequence
functions.description: Returns the sequence to be played when the NPC arrives at its goal.

returnValues.description: Sequence ID to be played, or -1 if there's no sequence.

functions.name: GetBlockingEntity
functions.description: Returns the entity blocking the NPC along its path.

returnValues.description: Blocking entity

functions.name: GetCurrentSchedule
functions.description: Returns the NPC's current schedule.

returnValues.description: The NPCs schedule, see <page>Enums/SCHED</page> or -1 if we failed for some reason

functions.name: GetCurrentWeaponProficiency
functions.description: Returns how proficient (skilled) an NPC is with its current weapon.

returnValues.description: NPC's proficiency for current weapon. See <page>Enums/WEAPON_PROFICIENCY</page>.

functions.name: GetCurWaypointPos
functions.description: Gets the NPC's current waypoint position (where NPC is currently moving towards), if any is available.

returnValues.description: The position of the current NPC waypoint.

functions.name: GetEnemy
functions.description:
Returns the entity that this NPC is trying to fight.

<bug issue="3132">This returns nil if the NPC has no enemy. You should use <page>Global.IsValid</page> (which accounts for nil and NULL) on the return to verify validity of the enemy.</bug>

returnValues.description: Enemy NPC.

functions.name: GetExpression
functions.description: Returns the expression file the NPC is currently playing.

returnValues.description: The file path of the expression.

functions.name: GetHullType
functions.description: Returns NPCs hull type set by <page>NPC:SetHullType</page>.

returnValues.description: Hull type, see <page>Enums/HULL</page>

functions.name: GetMovementActivity
functions.description: Returns the NPC's current movement activity.

returnValues.description: Current NPC movement activity, see <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

functions.name: GetMovementSequence
functions.description: Returns the index of the sequence the NPC uses to move.

returnValues.description: The movement sequence index

functions.name: GetNextWaypointPos
functions.description: Gets the NPC's next waypoint position, where NPC will be moving after reaching current waypoint, if any is available.

returnValues.description: The position of the next NPC waypoint.

functions.name: GetNPCState
functions.description: Returns the NPC's state.

returnValues.description: The NPC's current state, see <page>Enums/NPC_STATE</page>.

functions.name: GetPathDistanceToGoal
functions.description: Returns the distance the NPC is from Target Goal.

returnValues.description: The number of hammer units the NPC is away from the Goal.

functions.name: GetPathTimeToGoal
functions.description: Returns the amount of time it will take for the NPC to get to its Target Goal.

returnValues.description: The amount of time to get to the target goal.

functions.name: GetShootPos
functions.description:
Returns the shooting position of the NPC.

<note>This only works properly when called on an NPC that can hold weapons, otherwise it will return the same value as <page>Entity:GetPos</page>.</note>

returnValues.description: The NPC's shooting position.

functions.name: GetTarget
functions.description:
Returns the NPC's current target set by <page>NPC:SetTarget</page>.

<bug issue="3132">This returns nil if the NPC has no target. You should use <page>Global.IsValid</page> (which accounts for nil and NULL) on the return to verify validity of the target.</bug>

returnValues.description: Target entity

functions.name: Give
functions.description: Used to give a weapon to an already spawned NPC.

arguments.name: weapon
arguments.description: Class name of the weapon to equip to the NPC.

returnValues.description: The weapon entity given to the NPC.

functions.name: HasCondition
functions.description: Returns whether or not the NPC has the given condition.

arguments.name: condition
arguments.description: The condition index, see <page>Enums/COND</page>.

returnValues.description: True if the NPC has the given condition, false otherwise.

functions.name: IdleSound
functions.description: Force an NPC to play his Idle sound.

functions.name: IsCurrentSchedule
functions.description: Returns whether or not the NPC is performing the given schedule.

arguments.name: schedule
arguments.description: The schedule number, see <page>Enums/SCHED</page>.

returnValues.description: True if the NPC is performing the given schedule, false otherwise.

functions.name: IsMoving
functions.description: Returns whether the NPC is moving or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the NPC is moving or not.

functions.name: IsRunningBehavior
functions.description: Checks if the NPC is running an **ai_goal**. ( e.g. An npc_citizen NPC following the Player. )

returnValues.description: Returns true if running an ai_goal, otherwise returns false.

functions.name: IsUnreachable
functions.description:
Returns true if the entity was remembered as unreachable. The memory is updated automatically from following engine tasks if they failed:
* TASK_GET_CHASE_PATH_TO_ENEMY
* TASK_GET_PATH_TO_ENEMY_LKP
* TASK_GET_PATH_TO_INTERACTION_PARTNER
* TASK_ANTLIONGUARD_GET_CHASE_PATH_ENEMY_TOLERANCE
* SCHED_FAIL_ESTABLISH_LINE_OF_FIRE - Combine NPCs, also when failing to change their enemy

arguments.name: testEntity
arguments.description: The entity to test.

returnValues.description: If the entity is reachable or not.

functions.name: LostEnemySound
functions.description: Force an NPC to play his LostEnemy sound.

functions.name: MaintainActivity
functions.description: Tries to achieve our ideal animation state, playing any transition sequences that we need to play to get there.

functions.name: MarkEnemyAsEluded
functions.description: Causes the NPC to temporarily forget the current enemy and switch on to a better one.

functions.name: MoveOrder
functions.description:
Makes the NPC walk toward the given position. The NPC will return to the player after amount of time set by **player_squad_autosummon_time** <page>ConVar</page>.

Only works on Citizens (npc_citizen) and is a part of the Half-Life 2 squad system.

The NPC **must** be in the player's squad for this to work.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The target position for the NPC to walk to.

functions.name: NavSetGoal
functions.description: Sets the goal position for the NPC.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The position to set as the goal

functions.name: NavSetGoalTarget
functions.description: Set the goal target for an NPC.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The targeted entity to set the goal to.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The offset to apply to the targeted entity's position.

functions.name: NavSetRandomGoal
functions.description: Creates a random path of specified minimum length between a closest start node and random node in the specified direction.

arguments.name: minPathLength
arguments.description: Minimum length of path in units

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: Unit vector pointing in the direction of the target random node

functions.name: NavSetWanderGoal
functions.description: Sets a goal in x, y offsets for the npc to wander to

arguments.name: xoffset
arguments.description: X offset

arguments.name: yoffset
arguments.description: Y offset

functions.name: PlaySentence
functions.description: Forces the NPC to play a sentence from scripts/sentences.txt

arguments.name: sentence
arguments.description: The sentence string to speak.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: Delay in seconds until the sentence starts playing.

arguments.name: volume
arguments.description: The volume of the sentence, from 0 to 1.

returnValues.description: Returns the sentence index, -1 if the sentence couldn't be played.

functions.name: RemoveMemory
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

This function crashes the game no matter how it is used and will be removed in a future update.

Use <page>NPC:ClearEnemyMemory</page> instead.

functions.name: RunEngineTask
functions.description:
Starts an engine task.

Used internally by the <page>ai_task</page>.

arguments.name: taskID
arguments.description: The task ID, see [ai_task.h](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/server/ai_task.h#L89-L502)

arguments.name: taskData
arguments.description: The task data.

functions.name: SentenceStop
functions.description:
Stops any sounds (speech) the NPC is currently palying.

Equivalent to `Entity:EmitSound( "AI_BaseNPC.SentenceStop" )`

functions.name: SetArrivalDistance
functions.description: Sets the distance to goal at which the NPC should stop moving and continue to other business such as doing the rest of their tasks in a schedule.

arguments.name: dist
arguments.description: The distance to goal that is close enough for the NPC

functions.name: SetCondition
functions.description: Sets an NPC condition.

arguments.name: condition
arguments.description: The condition index, see <page>Enums/COND</page>.

functions.name: SetCurrentWeaponProficiency
functions.description: Sets the weapon proficiency of an NPC (how skilled an NPC is with its current weapon).

arguments.name: proficiency
arguments.description: The proficiency for the NPC's current weapon. See <page>Enums/WEAPON_PROFICIENCY</page>.

functions.name: SetEnemy
functions.description: Sets the target for an NPC.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy that the NPC should target

arguments.name: newenemy
arguments.description: Calls <page>NPC:SetCondition</page>(COND_NEW_ENEMY) if the new enemy is valid and not equal to the last enemy.

functions.name: SetExpression
