functions.description: Sets the NPC's .vcd expression. Similar to <page>Entity:PlayScene</page> except the scene is looped until it's interrupted by default NPC behavior or <page>NPC:ClearExpression</page>.

arguments.name: expression
arguments.description: The expression filepath.

functions.name: SetHullSizeNormal
functions.description: Updates the NPC's hull and physics hull in order to match its model scale. <page>Entity:SetModelScale</page> seems to take care of this regardless.

functions.name: SetHullType
functions.description: Sets the hull type for the NPC.

arguments.name: hullType
arguments.description: Hull type. See <page>Enums/HULL</page>

functions.name: SetLastPosition
functions.description:
Sets the last registered or memorized position for an npc. When using scheduling, the NPC will focus on navigating to the last position via nodes.

<note>The navigation requires ground nodes to function properly, otherwise the NPC could only navigate in a small area. (https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Info_node)</note>

arguments.name: Position
arguments.description: Where the NPC's last position will be set.

functions.name: SetMaxRouteRebuildTime
functions.description: Sets how how long to try rebuilding path before failing task.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: How long to try rebuilding path before failing task

functions.name: SetMovementActivity
functions.description: Sets the activity the NPC uses when it moves.

arguments.name: activity
arguments.description: The movement activity, see <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

functions.name: SetMovementSequence
functions.description: Sets the sequence the NPC navigation path uses for speed calculation. Doesn't seem to have any visible effect on NPC movement.

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description: The movement sequence index

functions.name: SetNPCState
functions.description: Sets the state the NPC is in to help it decide on a ideal schedule.

arguments.name: state
arguments.description: New NPC state, see <page>Enums/NPC_STATE</page>

functions.name: SetSchedule
functions.description: Sets the NPC's current schedule.

arguments.name: schedule
arguments.description: The NPC schedule, see <page>Enums/SCHED</page>.

functions.name: SetTarget
functions.description: Sets the NPC's target. This is used in some engine schedules.

arguments.name: entity
arguments.description: The target of the NPC.

functions.name: StartEngineTask
functions.description: Forces the NPC to start an engine task, this has different results for every NPC.

arguments.name: task
arguments.description: The id of the task to start, see [ai_task.h](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/server/ai_task.h#L89-L502)

arguments.name: taskData
arguments.description: The task data as a float, not all tasks make use of it.

functions.name: StopMoving
functions.description: Resets the NPC's movement animation and velocity. Does not actually stop the NPC from moving.

functions.name: TargetOrder
functions.description:
Cancels <page>NPC:MoveOrder</page> basically.

Only works on Citizens (npc_citizen) and is a part of the Half-Life 2 squad system.

The NPC **must** be in the player's squad for this to work.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: Must be a player, does nothing otherwise.

functions.name: TaskComplete
functions.description:
Marks the current NPC task as completed.

This is meant to be used alongside <page>NPC:TaskFail</page> to complete or fail custom Lua defined tasks. (<page>Schedule:AddTask</page>)

functions.name: TaskFail
functions.description:
Marks the current NPC task as failed.

This is meant to be used alongside <page>NPC:TaskComplete</page> to complete or fail custom Lua defined tasks. (<page>Schedule:AddTask</page>)

arguments.name: task
arguments.description: A string most likely defined as a Source Task, for more information on Tasks go to https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Task

functions.name: UpdateEnemyMemory
functions.description: Force the NPC to update information on the supplied enemy, as if it had line of sight to it.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy to update.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The last known position of the enemy.

functions.name: UseActBusyBehavior
functions.description: Only usable on "ai" base entities.

returnValues.description: If we succeeded setting the behavior.

functions.name: UseFollowBehavior
functions.description: Only usable on "ai" base entities.

returnValues.description: If we succeeded setting the behavior.

functions.name: UseNoBehavior
functions.description:
Undoes the other Use*Behavior functions.

Only usable on "ai" base entities.

functions.name: Add
functions.description: Adds the specified object to the panel.

arguments.name: object
arguments.description:
The panel to be added (parented). Can also be:
* <page>string</page> Class Name - creates panel with the specified name and adds it to the panel.
* <page>table</page> PANEL table - creates a panel from table and adds it to the panel.

returnValues.description: New panel

functions.name: AddText
functions.description:
<deprecated>Does nothing</deprecated>
This function does nothing.

functions.name: AlignBottom
functions.description: Aligns the panel on the bottom of its parent with the specified offset.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The align offset.

functions.name: AlignLeft
functions.description: Aligns the panel on the left of its parent with the specified offset.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The align offset.

functions.name: AlignRight
functions.description: Aligns the panel on the right of its parent with the specified offset.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The align offset.

functions.name: AlignTop
functions.description: Aligns the panel on the top of its parent with the specified offset.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The align offset.

functions.name: AlphaTo
functions.description: Uses animation to transition the current alpha value of a panel to a new alpha, over a set period of time and after a specified delay.

arguments.name: alpha
arguments.description: The alpha value (0-255) to approach.

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: The time in seconds it should take to reach the alpha.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: The delay before the animation starts.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called once the animation finishes. Arguments are:
* <page>table</page> animData - The AnimationData that was used. See <page>Structures/AnimationData</page>
* <page>Panel</page> pnl - The panel object whose alpha was changed.

functions.name: AnimationThinkInternal
functions.description:
<internal></internal> Performs the per-frame operations required for panel animations.

This is called every frame by <page>PANEL:AnimationThink</page>.

functions.name: AnimTail
functions.description: Returns the <page>Global.SysTime</page> value when all animations for this panel object will end.

returnValues.description: The system time value when all animations will end for this panel.

functions.name: AppendText
functions.description: Appends text to a <page>RichText</page> element. This does not automatically add a new line.

arguments.name: txt
arguments.description: The text to append (add on).

functions.name: ApplyGWEN
functions.description:
Used by <page>Panel:LoadGWENFile</page> and <page>Panel:LoadGWENString</page> to apply a GWEN controls table to a panel object.

You can do this manually using <page>file.Read</page> and <page>util.JSONToTable</page> to import and create a GWEN table structure from a `.gwen` file. This method can then be called, passing the GWEN table's `Controls` member.

arguments.name: GWENTable
arguments.description: The GWEN controls table to apply to the panel.

functions.name: Center
functions.description: Centers the panel on its parent.

functions.name: CenterHorizontal
functions.description: Centers the panel horizontally with specified fraction.

arguments.name: fraction
arguments.description: The center fraction.

functions.name: CenterVertical
functions.description: Centers the panel vertically with specified fraction.

arguments.name: fraction
arguments.description: The center fraction.

functions.name: ChildCount
functions.description: Returns the amount of children of the of panel.

returnValues.description: The amount of children the panel has.

functions.name: ChildrenSize
functions.description: Returns the width and height of the space between the position of the panel (upper-left corner) and the max bound of the children panels (farthest reaching lower-right corner).

returnValues.description: The children size width.
The children size height.

functions.name: Clear
functions.description: Marks all of the panel's children for deletion.

functions.name: ColorTo
functions.description: Fades panels color to specified one. It won't work unless panel has SetColor function.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color to fade to

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: Length of the animation

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: Delay before start fading

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: Function to execute when finished

functions.name: Command
functions.description: Sends an action command signal to the panel. The response is handled by <page>PANEL:ActionSignal</page>.

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: The command to send to the panel.

functions.name: ConVarChanged
functions.description: Updates a panel object's associated console variable. This must first be set up with <page>Global.Derma_Install_Convar_Functions</page>, and have a ConVar set using <page>Panel:SetConVar</page>.

arguments.name: newValue
arguments.description: The new value to set the associated console variable to.

functions.name: ConVarNumberThink
functions.description:
A think hook for <page>Panel</page>s using ConVars as a value. Call it in the Think hook. Sets the panel's value should the convar change.

This function is best for: checkboxes, sliders, number wangs

For a string alternative, see <page>Panel:ConVarStringThink</page>.

`Important`: Make sure your Panel has a SetValue function, else you may get errors.

functions.name: ConVarStringThink
functions.description:
A think hook for <page text="panels">Panel</page> using ConVars as a value. Call it in the Think hook. Sets the panel's value should the convar change.

This function is best for: text inputs, read-only inputs, dropdown selects

For a number alternative, see <page>Panel:ConVarNumberThink</page>.

`Important`: Make sure your Panel has a SetValue function, else you may get errors.

functions.name: CopyBase
functions.description: Gets the size, position and dock state of the passed panel object, and applies it to this one.

arguments.name: srcPanel
arguments.description: The panel to copy the boundary and dock settings from.

functions.name: CopyBounds
functions.description: Copies position and size of the panel.

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: The panel to copy size and position from.

functions.name: CopyHeight
functions.description: Copies the height of the panel.

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: Panel to copy the height from.

functions.name: CopyPos
functions.description: Copies the position of the panel.

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: Panel to position the width from.

functions.name: CopySelected
functions.description: Performs the "CONTROL + C" key combination effect ( Copy selection to clipboard ) on selected text.

functions.name: CopyWidth
functions.description: Copies the width of the panel.

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: Panel to copy the width from.

functions.name: CursorPos
functions.description:
Returns the cursor position relative to the top left of the panel.

This is equivalent to calling <page>gui.MousePos</page> and then <page>Panel:ScreenToLocal</page>.

<warning>This function uses a cached value for the screen position of the panel, computed at the end of the last VGUI Think/Layout pass.

ie. inaccurate results may be returned if the panel or any of its ancestors have been repositioned outside of <page>PANEL:Think</page> or <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page> within the last frame.</warning>

returnValues.description: X coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top left of the panel.
Y coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top left of the panel.

functions.name: CutSelected
functions.description: Performs the "CONTROL + X" ( delete text and copy it to clipboard buffer ) action on selected text.

functions.name: DeleteCookie
functions.description: Deletes a cookie value using the panel's cookie name ( <page>Panel:GetCookieName</page> ) and the passed extension.

arguments.name: cookieName
arguments.description: The unique cookie name to delete.

functions.name: DisableLerp
functions.description:
Resets the panel object's <page>Panel:SetPos</page> method and removes its animation table (`Panel.LerpAnim`). This effectively undoes the changes made by <page>Panel:LerpPositions</page>.

In order to use Lerp animation again, you must call <page>Panel:Stop</page> before setting its `SetPosReal` property to 'nil'. See the example below.

functions.name: Distance
functions.description: Returns the linear distance from the center of this panel object and another. **Both panels must have the same parent for this function to work properly.**

arguments.name: tgtPanel
arguments.description: The target object with which to compare position.

returnValues.description: The linear (straight-line) distance between the center of the two objects.

functions.name: DistanceFrom
functions.description: Returns the distance between the center of this panel object and a specified point **local to the parent panel**.

arguments.name: posX
arguments.description: The horizontal (x) position in pixels of the point to compare with. Local to the parent panel, or container, not the panel the function is called on.

arguments.name: posY
arguments.description: The vertical (y) position in pixels of the point to compare with. Local to the parent panel, or container, not the panel the function is called on.

returnValues.description: The linear (straight-line) distance between the specified point local to parent panel and the center of this panel object.

functions.name: Dock
functions.description:
Sets the dock type of the panel.

<note>After using this function, if you want to get the correct panel's bounds (position, size), use <page>Panel:InvalidateParent</page> (use **true** as argument if you need to update immediately)</note>

arguments.name: dockType
arguments.description: Dock type using <page>Enums/DOCK</page>.

functions.name: DockMargin
functions.description:
Sets the dock margin of the panel.

The dock margin is the extra space that will be left around the edge when this element is docked inside its parent element.

arguments.name: marginLeft
arguments.description: The left margin to the parent.

arguments.name: marginTop
arguments.description: The top margin to the parent.

arguments.name: marginRight
arguments.description: The right margin to the parent.

arguments.name: marginBottom
arguments.description: The bottom margin to the parent.

functions.name: DockPadding
functions.description:
Sets the dock padding of the panel.

The dock padding is the extra space that will be left around the edge when child elements are docked inside this element.

arguments.name: paddingLeft
arguments.description: The left padding to the parent.

arguments.name: paddingTop
arguments.description: The top padding to the parent.

arguments.name: paddingRight
arguments.description: The right padding to the parent.

arguments.name: paddingBottom
arguments.description: The bottom padding to the parent.

functions.name: DoModal
functions.description:
Makes the panel "lock" the screen until it is removed. It will silently fail if used while cursor is not visible. Call <page>Panel:MakePopup</page> before calling this function.

<bug issue="3457">You can still click in the world even if locked.</bug>

functions.name: DragClick
functions.description: <internal></internal> Called by <page>Panel:DragMouseRelease</page> when a user clicks one mouse button whilst dragging with another.

returnValues.description: Always returns `true`.

functions.name: DragHover
functions.description: <internal></internal> Called by <page>dragndrop.HoverThink</page> to perform actions on an object that is dragged and hovered over another.

arguments.name: HoverTime
arguments.description: If this time is greater than 0.1, <page>PANEL:DragHoverClick</page> is called, passing it as an argument.

functions.name: DragHoverEnd
functions.description: <internal></internal> Called to end a drag and hover action. This resets the panel's <page>PANEL:PaintOver</page> method, and is primarily used by <page>dragndrop.StopDragging</page>.

functions.name: DragMousePress
functions.description: Called to inform the <page>dragndrop</page> that a mouse button is being held down on a panel object.

arguments.name: mouseCode
arguments.description: The code for the mouse button pressed, passed by, for example, <page>PANEL:OnMousePressed</page>. See the <page>Enums/MOUSE</page>.

functions.name: DragMouseRelease
functions.description: Called to inform the <page>dragndrop</page> that a mouse button has been depressed on a panel object.

arguments.name: mouseCode
arguments.description: The code for the mouse button pressed, passed by, for example, <page>PANEL:OnMouseReleased</page>. See the <page>Enums/MOUSE</page>.

returnValues.description: `true` if an object was being dragged, otherwise `false`.

functions.name: DrawDragHover
functions.description: <internal></internal> Called to draw the drop target when an object is being dragged across another. See <page>Panel:SetDropTarget</page>.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the drop area.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the drop area.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The width of the drop area.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The height of the drop area.

functions.name: DrawFilledRect
functions.description: Draws a coloured rectangle to fill the panel object this method is called on. The colour is set using <page>surface.SetDrawColor</page>. This should only be called within the object's <page>PANEL:Paint</page> or <page>PANEL:PaintOver</page> hooks, as a shortcut for <page>surface.DrawRect</page>.

functions.name: DrawOutlinedRect
functions.description: Draws a hollow rectangle the size of the panel object this method is called on, with a border width of 1 px. The border colour is set using <page>surface.SetDrawColor</page>. This should only be called within the object's <page>PANEL:Paint</page> or <page>PANEL:PaintOver</page> hooks, as a shortcut for <page>surface.DrawOutlinedRect</page>.

functions.name: DrawSelections
functions.description: Used to draw the magenta highlight colour of a panel object when it is selected. This should be called in the object's <page>PANEL:PaintOver</page> hook. Once this is implemented, the highlight colour will be displayed only when the object is selectable and selected. This is achieved using <page>Panel:SetSelectable</page> and <page>Panel:SetSelected</page> respectively.

functions.name: DrawTextEntryText
functions.description: Used to draw the text in a <page>DTextEntry</page> within a derma skin. This should be called within the <page>SKIN:PaintTextEntry</page> skin hook.

arguments.name: textCol
arguments.description: The colour of the main text.

arguments.name: highlightCol
arguments.description: The colour of the selection highlight (when selecting text).

arguments.name: cursorCol
arguments.description: The colour of the text cursor (or caret).

functions.name: DrawTexturedRect
functions.description: Draws a textured rectangle to fill the panel object this method is called on. The texture is set using <page>surface.SetTexture</page> or <page>surface.SetMaterial</page>. This should only be called within the object's <page>PANEL:Paint</page> or <page>PANEL:PaintOver</page> hooks, as a shortcut for <page>surface.DrawTexturedRect</page>.

functions.name: Droppable
functions.description:
Makes this panel droppable. This is used with <page>Panel:Receiver</page> to create drag and drop events.

Can be called multiple times with different names allowing to be dropped onto different receivers.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of your droppable panel

returnValues.description: Blank table stored on the panel itself under pnl.m_DragSlot[ name ]. Is reset every time this function is called and does not appear to be used or exposed anywhere else.

functions.name: EndBoxSelection
functions.description: Completes a box selection. If the end point of the selection box is within the selection canvas, mouse capture is disabled for the panel object, and the selected state of each child object within the selection box is toggled.

returnValues.description: Whether the end point of the selection box was within the selection canvas.

functions.name: Exec
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used to run commands within a <page>DHTML</page> window.

arguments.name: cmd
arguments.description: The command to be run.

functions.name: Find
functions.description: Finds a panel in its children(and sub children) with the given name.

arguments.name: panelName
arguments.description: The name of the panel that should be found.

returnValues.description: foundPanel

functions.name: FocusNext
functions.description: Focuses the next panel in the focus queue.

functions.name: FocusPrevious
functions.description: Focuses the previous panel in the focus queue.

functions.name: GetAlpha
functions.description: Returns the alpha multiplier for this panel.

returnValues.description: alphaMul

functions.name: GetBGColor
functions.description:
Returns the background color of a panel such as a <page>RichText</page>, <page>Label</page> or <page>DColorCube</page>.

<note>This doesn't apply to all VGUI elements and its function varies between them</note>

returnValues.name: color
returnValues.description: The <page>Color</page> structure

functions.name: GetBounds
functions.description:
Returns the position and size of the panel.

This is equivalent to calling <page>Panel:GetPos</page> and <page>Panel:GetSize</page> together.

returnValues.description: The x coordinate of the panel, relative to its parent's top left.
The y coordinate of the panel, relative to its parent's top left.
The width of the panel.
The height of the panel.

functions.name: GetCaretPos
functions.description: Returns the position/offset of the caret (or text cursor) in a text-based panel object.

returnValues.description: The caret position/offset from the start of the text. A value of `0` means the caret sits before the first character.

functions.name: GetChild
functions.description: Gets a child by its index.

arguments.name: childIndex
arguments.description:
The index of the child to get.

<note>This index starts at 0, except when you use this on a <page>DMenu</page>.</note>

functions.name: GetChildPosition
functions.description: Gets a child object's position relative to this panel object. The number of levels is not relevant; the child may have many parents between itself and the object on which the method is called.

arguments.name: pnl
arguments.description: The panel to get the position of.

returnValues.description: The horizontal (x) position of the child relative to this panel object.
The vertical (y) position of the child relative to this panel object.

functions.name: GetChildren
functions.description: Returns a table with all the child panels of the panel.

returnValues.description: children

functions.name: GetChildrenInRect
functions.description: Returns a table of all visible, selectable children of the panel object that lie at least partially within the specified rectangle.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The horizontal (x) position of the top-left corner of the rectangle, relative to the panel object.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The vertical (y) position of the top-left corner of the rectangle, relative to the panel object.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: The width of the rectangle.

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: The height of the rectangle.

returnValues.description: A table of panel objects that lie at least partially within the specified rectangle.

functions.name: GetClassName
functions.description: Returns the class name of the panel.

returnValues.description: className

functions.name: GetClosestChild
functions.description: Returns the child of this panel object that is closest to the specified point. The point is relative to the object on which the method is called. The distance the child is from this point is also returned.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The horizontal (x) position of the point.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The vertical (y) position of the point.

returnValues.description: The child object that was closest to the specified point.
The distance that this child was from the point.

functions.name: GetContentSize
functions.description:
Gets the size of the content/children within a panel object.

Only works with <page>Label</page> derived panels by default such as <page>DLabel</page>.


Will also work on any panel that manually implements this method.

returnValues.description: The content width of the object.
The content height of the object.

functions.name: GetCookie
functions.description:
Gets the value of a cookie stored by the panel object. This can also be done with <page>cookie.GetString</page>, using the panel's cookie name, a fullstop, and then the actual name of the cookie.

Make sure the panel's cookie name has not changed since writing, or the cookie will not be accessible. This can be done with <page>Panel:GetCookieName</page> and <page>Panel:SetCookieName</page>.

arguments.name: cookieName
arguments.description: The name of the cookie from which to retrieve the value.

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: The default value to return if the cookie does not exist.

returnValues.description: The value of the stored cookie, or the default value should the cookie not exist.

functions.name: GetCookieName
functions.description: Gets the name the panel uses to store cookies. This is set with <page>Panel:SetCookieName</page>.

returnValues.description:
The name the panel uses when reading or writing cookies. The format used is as follows:
```
panelCookieName.individualCookieName
```

functions.name: GetCookieNumber
functions.description:
Gets the value of a cookie stored by the panel object, as a number. This can also be done with <page>cookie.GetNumber</page>, using the panel's cookie name, a fullstop, and then the actual name of the cookie.

Make sure the panel's cookie name has not changed since writing, or the cookie will not be accessible. This can be done with <page>Panel:GetCookieName</page> and <page>Panel:SetCookieName</page>.

arguments.name: cookieName
arguments.description: The name of the cookie from which to retrieve the value.

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: The default value to return if the cookie does not exist.

returnValues.description: The number value of the stored cookie, or the default value should the cookie not exist.

functions.name: GetDock
functions.description: Returns a dock enum for the panel's current docking type.

returnValues.description: The dock enum for the panel. See <page>Enums/DOCK</page>.

functions.name: GetDockMargin
functions.description: Returns the docked margins of the panel. (set by <page>Panel:DockMargin</page>)

returnValues.description: Left margin.
Top margin.
Right margin.
Bottom margin.

functions.name: GetDockPadding
functions.description: Returns the docked padding of the panel. (set by <page>Panel:DockPadding</page>)

returnValues.description: Left padding.
Top padding.
Right padding.
Bottom padding.

functions.name: GetFGColor
functions.description:
Returns the foreground color of the panel.

For a <page>Label</page> or <page>RichText</page>, this is the color of its text.

<note>This doesn't apply to all VGUI elements (such as <page>DLabel</page>) and its function varies between them</note>

returnValues.name: color
returnValues.description: A color structure. See <page>Color</page>

functions.name: GetFont
functions.description:
Returns the name of the font that the panel renders its text with.

This is the same font name set with <page>Panel:SetFontInternal</page>.

returnValues.description: fontName

functions.name: GetHTMLMaterial
functions.description: Returns the panel's HTML material. Only works with <page>Awesomium</page>, <page>HTML</page> and <page>DHTML</page> panels that have been fully loaded.

returnValues.description: The HTML material used by the panel. Typically starts with "__vgui_texture_" followed by an incremental number.

functions.name: GetMaximumCharCount
functions.description:
Returns the current maximum character count.

This function will only work on <page>RichText</page> and <page>TextEntry</page> panels and their derivatives.

returnValues.name: maxChar
returnValues.description: The maximum amount of characters this panel is allowed to contain.

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: Returns the internal name of the panel.

returnValues.description: name

functions.name: GetNumLines
functions.description:
Returns the number of lines in a <page>RichText</page>. You must wait a couple frames before calling this after using <page>Panel:AppendText</page> or <page>Panel:SetText</page>, otherwise it will return the number of text lines before the text change.

<note>Even though this function can be called on any panel, it will only work with <page>RichText</page></note>

returnValues.description: The number of lines.

functions.name: GetParent
functions.description: Returns the parent of the panel, returns nil if there is no parent.

returnValues.description: The parent of given panel

functions.name: GetPos
functions.description:
Returns the position of the panel relative to its <page>Panel:GetParent</page>.

If you require the panel's position **and** size, consider using <page>Panel:GetBounds</page> instead.


If you need the position in screen space, see <page>Panel:LocalToScreen</page>.

returnValues.description: X coordinate, relative to this panels parents top left corner.
Y coordinate, relative to this panels parents top left corner.

functions.name: GetSelectedChildren
functions.description: Returns a table of all children of the panel object that are selected. This is recursive, and the returned table will include tables for any child objects that also have children. This means that not all first-level members in the returned table will be of type <page>Panel</page>.

returnValues.description: A table of any child objects that are selected, including tables for children of the child objects (These tables may also contain table members, as the method is recursive).

functions.name: GetSelectedTextRange
functions.description:
Returns the currently selected range of text.

This function will only work on <page>RichText</page> and <page>TextEntry</page> panels and their derivatives.

returnValues.name: start
returnValues.description: The start of the range. If no text is selected it may be 0 and/or equal to the end range.

returnValues.name: endrange
returnValues.description: The end of the range. If no text is selected it may be 0 and/or equal to the start range.

functions.name: GetSelectionCanvas
functions.description: Returns the panel object (`self`) if it has been enabled as a selection canvas. This is achieved using <page>Panel:SetSelectionCanvas</page>.

returnValues.description: The panel object this method was called on if enabled as a selection canvas, otherwise `nil`.

functions.name: GetSize
functions.description:
Returns the size of the panel.

If you require both the panel's position and size, consider using <page>Panel:GetBounds</page> instead.

returnValues.description: width
height

functions.name: GetSkin
functions.description: Returns the table for the derma skin currently being used by this panel object.

returnValues.description: The derma skin table currently being used by this object.

functions.name: GetTable
functions.description: Returns the internal Lua table of the panel.

returnValues.description: A table containing all the members of given panel object.

functions.name: GetTall
functions.description: Returns the height of the panel.

returnValues.description: height

functions.name: GetText
functions.description:
Returns the panel's text (where applicable).

This method returns a maximum of 1023 bytes, except for <page>DTextEntry</page>.

returnValues.description: The panel's text.

functions.name: GetTextInset
functions.description: Gets the left and top text margins of a text-based panel object, such as a <page>DButton</page> or <page>DLabel</page>. This is set with <page>Panel:SetTextInset</page>.

returnValues.description: The left margin of the text, in pixels.
The top margin of the text, in pixels.

functions.name: GetTextSize
functions.description:
Gets the size of the text within a <page>Label</page> derived panel.

<bug issue="2576">This can return 0 incorrectly.</bug>

returnValues.description: The width of the text in the DLabel.
The height of the text in the DLabel.

functions.name: GetValidReceiverSlot
functions.description: Gets valid receiver slot of currently dragged panel.

returnValues.description: The panel this was called on if a valid receiver slot exists, otherwise false.
The slot table.

functions.name: GetValue
functions.description:
Returns the value the panel holds.

In engine is only implemented for <page>CheckButton</page>, <page>Label</page> and <page>TextEntry</page> as a string.

<note>This function is limited to 8092 Bytes. If using <page>DTextEntry</page>, use <page>Panel:GetText</page> for unlimited bytes.</note>

returnValues.description: The value the panel holds.

functions.name: GetWide
functions.description: Returns the width of the panel.

returnValues.description: width

functions.name: GetZPos
functions.description: Returns the Z position of the panel.

returnValues.description: The Z order position of the panel.

functions.name: GoBack
functions.description: Goes back one page in the HTML panel's history if available.

functions.name: GoForward
functions.description: Goes forward one page in the HTML panel's history if available.

functions.name: GoToHistoryOffset
functions.description: Goes to the page in the HTML panel's history at the specified relative offset.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The offset in the panel's back/forward history, relative to the current page, that you would like to skip to. Because this is relative, 0 = current page while negative goes back and positive goes forward. For example, -2 will go back 2 pages in the history.

functions.name: GotoTextEnd
functions.description: Causes a <page>RichText</page> element to scroll to the bottom of its text.

functions.name: GotoTextStart
functions.description:
Causes a <page>RichText</page> element to scroll to the top of its text.

<bug issue="2239">This does not work on the same frame as <page>Panel:SetText</page>.</bug>

functions.name: GWEN_SetCheckboxText
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `CheckboxText` property to a <page>DCheckBoxLabel</page>. This does exactly the same as <page>Panel:GWEN_SetText</page>, but exists to cater for the seperate GWEN properties.

arguments.name: txt
arguments.description: The text to be applied to the DCheckBoxLabel.

functions.name: GWEN_SetControlName
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `ControlName` property to a panel. This calls <page>Panel:SetName</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The new name to apply to the panel.

functions.name: GWEN_SetDock
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Dock` property to a  panel object. This calls <page>Panel:Dock</page>.

arguments.name: dockState
arguments.description:
The dock mode to pass to the panel's `Dock` method. This reads a string and applies the approriate <page>Enums/DOCK</page>.
* `Right`: Dock right.
* `Left`: Dock left.
* `Bottom`: Dock at the bottom.
* `Top`: Dock at the top.
* `Fill`: Fill the parent panel.

functions.name: GWEN_SetHorizontalAlign
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `HorizontalAlign` property to a  panel object. This calls <page>Panel:SetContentAlignment</page>.

arguments.name: hAlign
arguments.description:
The alignment, as a string, to pass to <page>Panel:SetContentAlignment</page>. Accepts:
* `Right`: Align mid-right.
* `Left`: Align mid-left.
* `Center`: Align mid-center.

functions.name: GWEN_SetMargin
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Margin` property to a  panel object. This calls <page>Panel:DockMargin</page>.

arguments.name: margins
arguments.description:
A four-membered table containing the margins as numbers:
* <page>number</page> left - The left margin.
* <page>number</page> top - The top margin.
* <page>number</page> right - The right margin.
* <page>number</page> bottom - The bottom margin.

functions.name: GWEN_SetMax
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Max` property to a  <page>DNumberWang</page>, <page>Slider</page>, <page>DNumSlider</page> or <page>DNumberScratch</page>. This calls `SetMax` on one of the previously listed methods.

arguments.name: maxValue
arguments.description: The maximum value the element is to permit.

functions.name: GWEN_SetMin
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Min` property to a  <page>DNumberWang</page>, <page>Slider</page>, <page>DNumSlider</page> or <page>DNumberScratch</page>. This calls `SetMin` on one of the previously listed methods.

arguments.name: minValue
arguments.description: The minimum value the element is to permit.

functions.name: GWEN_SetPosition
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Position` property to a  panel object. This calls <page>Panel:SetPos</page>.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description:
A two-membered table containing the x and y coordinates as numbers:
* <page>number</page> x - The x coordinate.
* <page>number</page> y - The y coordinate.

functions.name: GWEN_SetSize
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Size` property to a  panel object. This calls <page>Panel:SetSize</page>.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description:
A two-membered table containing the width and heights as numbers:
* <page>number</page> w - The width.
* <page>number</page> h - The height.

functions.name: GWEN_SetText
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Text` property to a panel.

arguments.name: txt
arguments.description: The text to be applied to the panel.

functions.name: HasChildren
functions.description: Returns whenever the panel has child panels.

returnValues.description: hasChilds

functions.name: HasFocus
functions.description: Returns if the panel is focused.

returnValues.description: hasFocus

functions.name: HasHierarchicalFocus
functions.description: Returns if the panel or any of its children(sub children and so on) has the focus.

returnValues.description: hasHierarchicalFocus

functions.name: HasParent
functions.description: Returns whether the panel is a descendent of the given panel.

returnValues.description: True if the panel is contained within parentPanel.

functions.name: Hide
functions.description: Makes a panel invisible.

functions.name: InsertClickableTextEnd
functions.description: Marks the end of a clickable text segment in a <page>RichText</page> element, started with <page>Panel:InsertClickableTextStart</page>.

functions.name: InsertClickableTextStart
functions.description:
Starts the insertion of clickable text for a <page>RichText</page> element. Any text appended with <page>Panel:AppendText</page> between this call and <page>Panel:InsertClickableTextEnd</page> will become clickable text.

The hook <page>PANEL:ActionSignal</page> is called when the text is clicked, with "TextClicked" as the signal name and `signalValue` as the signal value.

<note>The clickable text is a separate Derma panel which will not inherit the current font from the `RichText`.</note>

arguments.name: signalValue
arguments.description: The text passed as the action signal's value.

functions.name: InsertColorChange
functions.description: Inserts a color change in a <page>RichText</page> element, which affects the color of all text added with <page>Panel:AppendText</page> until another color change is applied.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red value (0 - 255).

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green value (0 - 255).

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue value (0 - 255).

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha value (0 - 255).

functions.name: InsertFade
functions.description:
Begins a text fade for a <page>RichText</page> element where the last appended text segment is fully faded out after a specific amount of time, at a specific speed.

The alpha of the text at any given time is determined by the text's base alpha * ((`sustain` - <page>Global.CurTime</page>) / `length`) where <page>Global.CurTime</page> is added to `sustain` when this method is called.

arguments.name: sustain
arguments.description: The number of seconds the text remains visible.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description:
The number of seconds it takes the text to fade out.

If set **lower** than `sustain`, the text will not begin fading out until (`sustain` - `length`) seconds have passed.

If set **higher** than `sustain`, the text will begin fading out immediately at a fraction of the base alpha.

If set to **-1**, the text doesn't fade out.

functions.name: InvalidateChildren
functions.description: Invalidates the layout of this panel object and all its children. This will cause these objects to re-layout immediately, calling <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page>. If you want to perform the layout in the next frame, you will have loop manually through all children, and call <page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page> on each.

arguments.name: recursive
arguments.description: If `true`, the method will recursively invalidate the layout of all children. Otherwise, only immediate children are affected.

functions.name: InvalidateLayout
functions.description:
Causes the panel to re-layout in the next frame. During the layout process  <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page> will be called on the target panel.

You should avoid calling this function every frame.

<bug issue="2574">Using this on a panel after clicking on a docked element will cause docked elements to reorient themselves incorrectly. This can be fixed by assigning a unique <page>Panel:SetZPos</page> to each docked element.</bug>

arguments.name: layoutNow
arguments.description: If true the panel will re-layout instantly and not wait for the next frame.

functions.name: InvalidateParent
functions.description: Invalidates the layout of the parent of this panel object. This will cause it to re-layout, calling <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page>.

arguments.name: layoutNow
arguments.description: If `true`, the re-layout will occur immediately, otherwise it will be performed in the next frame.

functions.name: IsChildHovered
functions.description: Determines whether the mouse cursor is hovered over one of this panel object's children. This is a reverse process using <page>vgui.GetHoveredPanel</page>, and looks upward to find the parent.

arguments.name: immediate
arguments.description: Set to true to check only the immediate children of given panel ( first level )

returnValues.description: Whether or not one of this panel object's children is being hovered over.

functions.name: IsDraggable
functions.description: Returns whether this panel is draggable ( if user is able to drag it ) or not.

returnValues.description: Whether this panel is draggable ( if user is able to drag it ) or not.

functions.name: IsDragging
functions.description: Returns whether this panel is currently being dragged or not.

returnValues.description: Whether this panel is currently being dragged or not.

functions.name: IsEnabled
functions.description:
Returns whether the the panel is enabled or disabled.

See <page>Panel:SetEnabled</page> for a function that makes the panel enabled or disabled.

returnValues.description: Whether the panel is enabled or disabled.

functions.name: IsHovered
functions.description:
Returns whether the mouse cursor is hovering over this panel or not

Uses <page>vgui.GetHoveredPanel</page> internally.

Requires <page>Panel:SetMouseInputEnabled</page> to be set to true.

returnValues.description: true if the panel is hovered

functions.name: IsKeyboardInputEnabled
functions.description: Returns true if the panel can receive keyboard input.

returnValues.description: keyboardInputEnabled

functions.name: IsLoading

returnValues.description: Whether or not the (D)HTML object is loading.

functions.name: IsMarkedForDeletion
functions.description: Returns if the panel is going to be deleted in the next frame.

returnValues.description: markedForDeletion

functions.name: IsMouseInputEnabled
functions.description: Returns true if the panel can receive mouse input.

returnValues.description: mouseInputEnabled

functions.name: IsOurChild
functions.description: Returns whether the panel contains the given panel, recursively.

returnValues.description: True if the panel contains childPanel.

functions.name: IsSelectable
functions.description: Determines if the panel object is selectable (like icons in the Spawn Menu, holding <key>Shift</key>). This is set with <page>Panel:SetSelectable</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the panel is selectable or not.

functions.name: IsSelected
functions.description: Returns if the panel object is selected (like icons in the Spawn Menu, holding <key>Shift</key>). This can be set in Lua using <page>Panel:SetSelected</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the panel object is selected or not. Always returns false if the object is not selectable. This can be modified using <page>Panel:SetSelectable</page>.

functions.name: IsSelectionCanvas
functions.description: Determines if the panel object is a selection canvas or not. This is set with <page>Panel:SetSelectionCanvas</page>.

returnValues.description: The value (if any) set by <page>Panel:SetSelectionCanvas</page>.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns if the panel is valid and not marked for deletion.

returnValues.description: True if the object is valid.

functions.name: IsVisible
functions.description: Returns if the panel is visible.

returnValues.description: isVisible

functions.name: IsWorldClicker
functions.description: Returns if a panel allows world clicking set by <page>Panel:SetWorldClicker</page>.

returnValues.description: If the panel allows world clicking.

functions.name: KillFocus
functions.description: Remove the focus from the panel.

functions.name: LerpPositions
functions.description:
Redefines the panel object's <page>Panel:SetPos</page> method to operate using frame-by-frame linear interpolation (Lerp). When the panel's position is changed, it will move to the target position at the speed defined. You can undo this with <page>Panel:DisableLerp</page>.

Unlike the other panel animation functions, such as <page>Panel:MoveTo</page>, this animation method will not operate whilst the game is paused. This is because it relies on <page>Global.FrameTime</page>.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description:
The speed at which to move the panel. This is affected by the value of `easeOut`. Recommended values are:
* **0.1 - 10** when `easeOut` is `false`.
* **0.1 - 1** when `easeOut` is `true`.

arguments.name: easeOut
arguments.description: This causes the panel object to 'jump' at the target, slowing as it approaches. This affects the `speed` value significantly, see above.

functions.name: LoadControlsFromFile
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>
<internal></internal>
Similar to <page>Panel:LoadControlsFromString</page> but loads controls from a file.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: The path to load the controls from.

functions.name: LoadControlsFromString
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>
<internal></internal>
Loads controls(positions, etc) from given data. This is what the default options menu uses.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The data to load controls from. Format unknown.

functions.name: LoadGWENFile
functions.description:
Loads a .gwen file (created by GWEN Designer) and calls <page>Panel:LoadGWENString</page> with the contents of the loaded file.

Used to load panel controls from a file.

arguments.name: filename
arguments.description: The file to open. The path is relative to garrysmod/garrysmod/.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description:
The path used to look up the file.

* "GAME" Structured like base folder (garrysmod/), searches all the mounted content (main folder, addons, mounted games etc)
* "LUA" or "lsv" - All Lua folders (lua/) including gamesmodes and addons
* "DATA" Data folder (garrysmod/data)
* "MOD" Strictly the game folder (garrysmod/), ignores mounting.

functions.name: LoadGWENString
functions.description: Loads controls for the panel from a JSON string.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: JSON string containing information about controls to create.

functions.name: LocalCursorPos
functions.description: Returns the cursor position local to the position of the panel (usually the upper-left corner).

returnValues.description: The x coordinate
The y coordinate

functions.name: LocalToScreen
functions.description:
Gets the absolute screen position of the position specified relative to the panel.

See also <page>Panel:ScreenToLocal</page>.

<warning>This function uses a cached value for the screen position of the panel, computed at the end of the last VGUI Think/Layout pass, so inaccurate results may be returned if the panel or any of its ancestors have been re-positioned outside of <page>PANEL:Think</page> or <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page> within the last frame.</warning>

<note>If the panel uses <page>Panel:Dock</page>, this function will return 0, 0 when the panel was created. The position will be updated in the next frame.</note>

arguments.name: posX
arguments.description: The X coordinate of the position on the panel to translate.

arguments.name: posY
arguments.description: The Y coordinate of the position on the panel to translate.

returnValues.description: The X coordinate relative to the screen.
The Y coordinate relative to the screen.

functions.name: MakePopup
functions.description:
Focuses the panel and enables it to receive input.

This automatically calls <page>Panel:SetMouseInputEnabled</page> and <page>Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled</page> and sets them to true.

<note>Panels derived from <page>Panel</page> will not work properly with this function. Due to this, any children will not be intractable with keyboard. Derive from <page>EditablePanel</page> instead.</note>

functions.name: MouseCapture
functions.description: Allows the panel to receive mouse input even if the mouse cursor is outside the bounds of the panel.

arguments.name: doCapture
arguments.description: Set to true to enable, set to false to disable.

arguments.name: panel
arguments.description: Panel to position relatively to.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The align offset.

functions.name: MoveBelow
functions.description: Places the panel below the passed panel with the specified offset.

arguments.name: panel
arguments.description: Panel to position relatively to.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The align offset.

functions.name: MoveBy
functions.description: Moves the panel by the specified coordinates using animation.

arguments.name: moveX
arguments.description: The number of pixels to move by in the horizontal (x) direction.

arguments.name: moveY
arguments.description: The number of pixels to move by in the vertical (y) direction.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: The time (in seconds) in which to perform the animation.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: The delay (in seconds) before the animation begins.

arguments.name: ease
arguments.description: The easing of the start and/or end speed of the animation. See <page>Panel:NewAnimation</page> for how this works.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called once the animation is complete. Arguments are:
* <page>table</page> animData - The <page>AnimationData that was used.</page>
* <page>Panel</page> pnl - The panel object that was moved.

functions.name: MoveLeftOf
functions.description: Places the panel left to the passed panel with the specified offset.

arguments.name: panel
arguments.description: Panel to position relatively to.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The align offset.

functions.name: MoveRightOf
functions.description: Places the panel right to the passed panel with the specified offset.

arguments.name: panel
arguments.description: Panel to position relatively to.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The align offset.

functions.name: MoveTo
functions.description:
Moves the panel to the specified position using animation.
<note>Setting the ease argument to 0 will result in the animation happening instantly, this applies to all MoveTo/SizeTo functions</note>

arguments.name: posX
arguments.description: The target x coordinate of the panel.

arguments.name: posY
arguments.description: The target y coordinate of the panel.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: The time to perform the animation within.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: The delay before the animation starts.

arguments.name: ease
arguments.description: The easing of the start and/or end speed of the animation. See <page>Panel:NewAnimation</page> for how this works.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called once the animation finishes. Arguments are:
* <page>table</page> animData - The <page>AnimationData that was used.</page>
* <page>Panel</page> pnl - The panel object that was moved.

functions.name: MoveToAfter
functions.description: Moves this panel object in front of the specified sibling (child of the same parent) in the render order, and shuffles up the Z-positions of siblings now behind.

arguments.name: siblingPanel
arguments.description: The panel to move this one in front of. Must be a child of the same parent panel.

returnValues.description: `false` if the passed panel is not a sibling, otherwise `nil`.

functions.name: MoveToBack
functions.description: Moves the panel object behind all other panels on screen. If the panel has been made a pop-up with <page>Panel:MakePopup</page>, it will still draw in front of any panels that haven't.

functions.name: MoveToBefore
functions.description: Moves this panel object behind the specified sibling (child of the same parent) in the render order, and shuffles up the <page>Panel:SetZPos</page> of siblings now in front.

arguments.name: siblingPanel
arguments.description: The panel to move this one behind. Must be a child of the same parent panel.

returnValues.description: `false` if the passed panel is not a sibling, otherwise `nil`.

functions.name: MoveToFront
functions.description: Moves the panel in front of all other panels on screen. Unless the panel has been made a pop-up using <page>Panel:MakePopup</page>, it will still draw behind any that have.

functions.name: NewAnimation
functions.description:
Creates a new animation for the panel object.

Methods that use this function:
* <page>Panel:MoveTo</page>
* <page>Panel:SizeTo</page>
* <page>Panel:SlideUp</page>
* <page>Panel:SlideDown</page>
* <page>Panel:ColorTo</page>
* <page>Panel:AlphaTo</page>
* <page>Panel:MoveBy</page>
* <page>Panel:LerpPositions</page>

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: The length of the animation in seconds.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: The delay before the animation starts.

arguments.name: ease
arguments.description:
The power/index to use for easing.
* Positive values greater than 1 will ease in; the higher the number, the sharper the curve's gradient (less linear).
* A value of 1 removes all easing.
* Positive values between 0 and 1 ease out; values closer to 0 increase the curve's gradient (less linear).
* A value of 0 will break the animation and should be avoided.
* Any value less than zero will ease in/out; the value has no effect on the gradient.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called when the animation ends. Arguments passed are:
* <page>table</page> animTable - The <page>AnimationData that was used.</page>
* <page>Panel</page> tgtPanel - The panel object that was animated.

returnValues.description:
Partially filled <page>Structures/AnimationData</page> with members:
* <page>number</page> EndTime - Equal to `length` and `delay` arguments added together, plus either the <page>Global.SysTime if there is no other animation queued or the end time of the last animation in the queue.</page>
* <page>number</page> StartTime - Equal to the `delay` argument, plus either the <page>Global.SysTime if there is no other animation queued or the end time of the last animation in the queue.</page>
* <page>number</page> Ease - Equal to the `ease` argument.
* <page>function</page> OnEnd - Equal to the `callback` argument.

functions.name: NewObject
functions.description: <internal></internal>

functions.name: NewObjectCallback
functions.description: <internal></internal>

functions.name: NoClipping
functions.description:
Sets whether this panel's drawings should be clipped within the parent panel's bounds.

See also <page>Global.DisableClipping</page> and <page>surface.DisableClipping</page>.

arguments.name: clip
arguments.description: Whether to clip or not.

functions.name: NumSelectedChildren
functions.description: Returns the number of children of the panel object that are selected. This is equivalent to calling <page>Panel:IsSelected</page> on all child objects and counting the number of returns that are `true`.

returnValues.description: The number of child objects that are currently selected. This does not include the parent object you are calling the method from.

functions.name: PaintAt
functions.description: Paints a ghost copy of the panel at the given position.

arguments.name: posX
arguments.description: The x coordinate to draw the panel from.

arguments.name: posY
arguments.description: The y coordinate to draw the panel from.

functions.name: PaintManual
functions.description: Paints the panel at its current position. To use this you must call <page>Panel:SetPaintedManually</page>(true).

functions.description:
Parents the panel to the HUD.
Makes it invisible on the escape-menu and disables controls.

functions.name: Paste
functions.description:
<warning>Due to privacy concerns, this function has been disabled</warning>

Only works for TextEntries.

Pastes the contents of the clipboard into the TextEntry.

<note>Tab characters will be dropped from the pasted text</note>

functions.name: PositionLabel
functions.description: Sets the width and position of a <page>DLabel</page> and places the passed panel object directly to the right of it. Returns the `y` value of the bottom of the tallest object. The panel on which this method is run is not relevant; only the passed objects are affected.

arguments.name: lblWidth
arguments.description: The width to set the label to.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The horizontal (x) position at which to place the label.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The vertical (y) position at which to place the label.

arguments.name: lbl
arguments.description: The label to resize and position.

arguments.name: panelObj
arguments.description: The panel object to place to the right of the label.

returnValues.description: The distance from the top of the parent panel to the bottom of the tallest object (the `y` position plus the height of the label or passed panel, depending on which is tallest).

functions.name: PostMessage
functions.description: <deprecated>Only used in deprecated Derma controls.</deprecated>Sends a command to the panel.

arguments.name: messageName
arguments.description: The name of the message.

arguments.name: valueType
arguments.description: The type of the variable to post.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to post.

functions.name: Prepare
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Installs Lua defined functions into the panel.

functions.name: Queue
functions.description: Enables the queue for panel animations. If enabled, the next new animation will begin after all current animations have ended. This must be called before <page>Panel:NewAnimation</page> to work, and only applies to the next new animation. If you want to queue many, you must call this before each.

functions.name: RebuildSpawnIcon
functions.description: Causes a <page>SpawnIcon</page> to rebuild its model image.

functions.name: RebuildSpawnIconEx
functions.description:
Re-renders a spawn icon with customized cam data.

<page>Global.PositionSpawnIcon</page> can be used to easily calculate the necessary camera parameters.

<note>This function does **not** accept the standard <page>Structures/CamData</page>.</note>

arguments.name: data
arguments.description:
A four-membered table containing the information needed to re-render:
* <page>Vector</page> cam_pos - The relative camera position the model is viewed from.
* <page>Angle</page> cam_ang - The camera angle the model is viewed from.
* <page>number</page> cam_fov - The camera's field of view (FOV).
* <page>Entity</page> ent - The entity object of the model.
See the example below for how to retrieve these values.

functions.name: Receiver
functions.description: Allows the panel to receive drag and drop events. Can be called multiple times with different names to receive multiple different draggable panel events.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of DnD panels to receive. This is set on the drag'n'drop-able panels via  <page>Panel:Droppable</page>

arguments.name: func
arguments.description:
This function is called whenever a panel with valid name is hovering above and dropped on this panel. It has next arguments:
* <page>Panel</page> pnl - The receiver panel
* <page>table</page> tbl - A table of panels dropped onto receiver panel
* <page>boolean</page> dropped - False if hovering over, true if dropped onto
* <page>number</page> menuIndex - Index of clicked menu item from third argument of <page>Panel:Receiver</page>
* <page>number</page> x - Cursor pos, relative to the receiver
* <page>number</page> y - Cursor pos, relative to the receiver

arguments.name: menu
arguments.description: A table of strings that will act as a menu if drag'n'drop was performed with a right click

functions.name: Refresh
functions.description: Refreshes the HTML panel's current page.

arguments.name: ignoreCache
arguments.description: If true, the refresh will ignore cached content similar to "ctrl+f5" in most browsers.

functions.name: Remove
functions.description:
Marks a panel for deletion so it will be deleted on the next frame.

This will not mark child panels for deletion this frame, but they will be marked and deleted in the next frame.

See also <page>Panel:IsMarkedForDeletion</page>

Will automatically call <page>Panel:InvalidateParent</page>.

functions.name: RequestFocus
functions.description: Attempts to obtain focus for this panel.

functions.name: ResetAllFades
functions.description: Resets all text fades in a <page>RichText</page> element made with <page>Panel:InsertFade</page>.

arguments.name: hold
arguments.description: True to reset fades, false otherwise.

arguments.name: expiredOnly
arguments.description: Any value equating to `true` will reset fades only on text segments that are completely faded out.

arguments.name: newSustain
arguments.description: The new sustain value of each faded text segment. Set to -1 to keep the old sustain value.

functions.name: RunJavascript
functions.description:
Runs/Executes a string as JavaScript code in a panel. This function does **NOT** evaluate expression (i.e. allow you to pass variables from JavaScript (JS) to Lua context).
Because a return value is nil/no value (a.k.a. void).
If you wish to pass/return values from JS to Lua, you may want to use DHTML:AddFunction function to accomplish that job.

arguments.name: js
arguments.description: Specify JavaScript code to be executed.

functions.name: SaveUndoState
functions.description:
Saves the current state (caret position and the text inside) of a <page>TextEntry</page> as an undo state.

See also <page>Panel:Undo</page>.

functions.name: ScreenToLocal
functions.description:
Translates global screen coordinate to coordinates relative to the panel.

See also <page>Panel:LocalToScreen</page>.

<warning>This function uses a cached value for the screen position of the panel, computed at the end of the last VGUI Think/Layout pass, so inaccurate results may be returned if the panel or any of its ancestors have been re-positioned outside of <page>PANEL:Think</page> or <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page> within the last frame.</warning>

arguments.name: screenX
arguments.description: The x coordinate of the screen position to be translated.

arguments.name: screenY
arguments.description: The y coordinate of the screed position be to translated.

returnValues.description: Relativeposition X
Relativeposition Y

functions.name: SelectAll
functions.description: Selects all items within a panel or object. For text-based objects, selects all text.

functions.name: SelectAllOnFocus
functions.description: If called on a text entry, clicking the text entry for the first time will automatically select all of the text ready to be copied by the user.

functions.name: SelectAllText
functions.description: Selects all the text in a panel object. Will not select non-text items; for this, use <page>Panel:SelectAll</page>.

functions.name: SelectNone
functions.description: Deselects all items in a panel object. For text-based objects, this will deselect all text.

functions.name: SetAchievement
functions.description: Sets the achievement to be displayed by <page>AchievementIcon</page>.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: Achievement number ID

functions.name: SetActionFunction
functions.description:
<deprecated>Does nothing at all.</deprecated>

Used in <page>Button</page> to call a function when the button is clicked and in <page>Slider</page> when the value changes.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description:
Function to call when the <page>Button</page> is clicked or the <page>Slider</page> value is changed.

Arguments given are:
* <page>Panel</page> self - The panel itself
* <page>string</page> action - "Command" on button press, "SliderMoved" on slider move.
* <page>number</page> val - The new value of the <page>Slider</page>. Will always equal 0 for buttons.
* <page>number</page> zed - Always equals 0.

functions.name: SetAllowNonAsciiCharacters
functions.description:
Configures a text input to allow user to type characters that are not included in the US-ASCII (7-bit ASCII) character set.

Characters not included in US-ASCII are multi-byte characters in UTF-8. They can be accented characters, non-Latin characters and special characters.

arguments.name: allowed
arguments.description: Set to true in order not to restrict input characters.

functions.name: SetAlpha
functions.description: Sets the alpha multiplier for the panel

arguments.name: alpha
arguments.description: The alpha value in the range of 0-255.

functions.name: SetAnimationEnabled
functions.description: Enables or disables animations for the panel object by overriding the <page>PANEL:AnimationThink</page> hook to nil and back.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Whether to enable or disable animations.

functions.name: SetAutoDelete
functions.description: Sets whenever the panel should be removed if the parent was removed.

arguments.name: autoDelete
arguments.description: Whenever to delete if the parent was removed or not.

functions.name: SetBGColor
functions.description:
Sets the background color of a panel such as a <page>RichText</page>, <page>Label</page> or <page>DColorCube</page>.

<note>This doesn't apply to all VGUI elements and its function varies between them</note>

For <page>DLabel</page> elements, you must use <page>Panel:SetPaintBackgroundEnabled</page>( true ) before applying the color.

This will not work on setup of the panel - you should use this function in a hook like <page>PANEL:ApplySchemeSettings</page> or <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page>.

arguments.name: r or color
arguments.description: The red channel of the color, or a <page>Color</page>. If you pass the latter, the following three arguments are ignored.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green channel of the color.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue channel of the color.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha channel of the color.

functions.name: SetBGColorEx
functions.description: <internal></internal>Sets the background color of the panel.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red channel of the color.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green channel of the color.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue channel of the color.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha channel of the color.

functions.name: SetCaretPos
functions.description: Sets the position of the caret (or text cursor) in a text-based panel object.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: Caret position/offset from the start of text. A value of `0` places the caret before the first character.

functions.name: SetCommand
functions.description:
Sets the action signal command that's fired when a <page>Button</page> is clicked. The hook <page>PANEL:ActionSignal</page> is called as the click response.

This has no effect on buttons unless it has had its `AddActionSignalTarget` method called (an internal function not available by default in Garry's Mod LUA).

A better alternative is calling <page>Panel:Command</page> when a <page>DButton</page> is clicked.

functions.name: SetContentAlignment
functions.description: Sets the alignment of the contents.

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description:
The direction of the content, based on the number pad. 1: **bottom-left**
2: **bottom-center**
3: **bottom-right**
4: **middle-left**
5: **center**
6: **middle-right**
7: **top-left**
8: **top-center**
9: **top-right**

functions.name: SetConVar
functions.description:
<warning>This function does not exist on all panels</warning>
<warning>This function cannot interact with serverside convars unless you are host</warning>
<note>Blocked convars will not work with this, see <page>Blocked ConCommands</page></note>

Sets this panel's convar. When the convar changes this panel will update automatically.

For developer implementation, see <page>Global.Derma_Install_Convar_Functions</page>.

arguments.name: convar
arguments.description: The console variable to check.

functions.name: SetCookie
functions.description:
Stores a string in the named cookie using <page>Panel:GetCookieName</page> as prefix.

You can also retrieve and modify this cookie by using the <page>cookie</page>. Cookies are stored in this format:

```
panelCookieName.cookieName
```


<warning>The panel's cookie name MUST be set for this function to work. See <page>Panel:SetCookieName</page>.</warning>

arguments.name: cookieName
arguments.description: The unique name used to retrieve the cookie later.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to store in the cookie. This can be retrieved later as a <page>string</page> or <page>number</page>.

functions.name: SetCookieName
functions.description: Sets the panel's cookie name. Calls <page>PANEL:LoadCookies</page> if defined.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The panel's cookie name. Used as prefix for <page>Panel:SetCookie</page>

functions.name: SetCursor
functions.description: Sets the appearance of the cursor.

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description:
The cursor to be set. Can be one of the following:

* arrow
* beam
* hourglass
* waitarrow
* crosshair
* up
* sizenwse
* sizenesw
* sizewe
* sizens
* sizeall
* no
* hand
* blank

Set to anything else to set it to "none", the default fallback. Do note that a value of "none" does not, as one might assume, result in no cursor being drawn - hiding the cursor requires a value of "blank" instead.

functions.name: SetDragParent
functions.description:
Sets the drag parent.

Drag parent means that when we start to drag this panel, we'll really start dragging the defined parent.

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: The panel to set as drag parent.

functions.name: SetDrawLanguageID
functions.description:
Sets the visibility of the language selection box in a TextEntry when typing in non-English mode.

See <page>Panel:SetDrawLanguageIDAtLeft</page> for a function that changes the position of the language selection box.

arguments.name: visible
arguments.description: true to make it visible, false to hide it.

functions.name: SetDrawLanguageIDAtLeft
functions.description:
Sets where to draw the language selection box.

See <page>Panel:SetDrawLanguageID</page> for a function that hides or shows the language selection box.

arguments.name: left
arguments.description: true = left, false = right

functions.name: SetDrawOnTop
functions.description:
Makes the panel render in front of all others, including the spawn menu and main menu.

Priority is given based on the last call, so of two panels that call this method, the second will draw in front of the first.

<note>This only makes the panel **draw** above other panels. If there's another panel that would have otherwise covered it, users will not be able to interact with it.</note>
<warning>This does not work when using <page>PANEL:SetPaintedManually</page> or <page>PANEL:PaintAt</page>!</warning>

arguments.name: drawOnTop
arguments.description: Whether or not to draw the panel in front of all others.

functions.name: SetDropTarget
functions.description:
Sets the target area for dropping when an object is being dragged around this panel using the <page>dragndrop</page>.

This draws a target box of the specified size and position, until <page>Panel:DragHoverEnd</page> is called. It uses <page>Panel:DrawDragHover</page> to draw this area.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the drop area.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the drop area.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The width of the drop area.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The height of the drop area.

functions.name: SetEnabled
functions.description:
Sets the enabled state of a disable-able panel object, such as a <page>DButton</page> or <page>DTextEntry</page>.

See <page>Panel:IsEnabled</page> for a function that retrieves the "enabled" state of a panel.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Whether to enable or disable the panel object.

functions.name: SetExpensiveShadow
functions.description: Adds a shadow falling to the bottom right corner of the panel's text. This has no effect on panels that do not derive from Label.

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: The distance of the shadow from the panel.

arguments.name: Color
arguments.description: The color of the shadow. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: SetFGColor
functions.description:
Sets the foreground color of a panel.

For a <page>Label</page> or <page>RichText</page>, this is the color of its text.

This function calls <page>Panel:SetFGColorEx</page> internally.

<note>This doesn't apply to all VGUI elements (such as <page>DLabel</page>) and its function varies between them</note>

arguments.name: r or color
arguments.description: The red channel of the color, or a <page>Color</page>. If you pass the latter, the following three arguments are ignored.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green channel of the color.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue channel of the color.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha channel of the color.

functions.name: SetFGColorEx
functions.description:
<internal></internal>Sets the foreground color of the panel.

For labels, this is the color of their text.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red channel of the color.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green channel of the color.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue channel of the color.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha channel of the color.

functions.name: SetFocusTopLevel
functions.description: Sets the panel that owns this FocusNavGroup to be the root in the focus traversal hierarchy.

functions.name: SetFontInternal
functions.description:
Sets the font used to render this panel's text.

To retrieve the font used by a panel, call <page>Panel:GetFont</page>.

arguments.name: fontName
arguments.description:
The name of the font.

See <page text="here">Default_Fonts</page> for a list of existing fonts.
Alternatively, use <page>surface.CreateFont</page> to create your own custom font.

functions.name: SetHeight
functions.description:
Sets the height of the panel.

Calls <page>PANEL:OnSizeChanged</page> and marks this panel for layout (<page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page>).


See also <page>Panel:SetSize</page>.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The height to be set.

functions.name: SetHTML
functions.description: Allows you to set HTML code within a panel.

arguments.name: HTML code
arguments.description: The code to set.

functions.name: SetKeyboardInputEnabled
functions.description: Allows or disallows the panel to receive keyboard focus and input. This is recursively applied to all children.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Whether keyboard input should be enabled for this panel.

functions.name: SetKeyBoardInputEnabled
functions.description: <deprecated>Alias of <page text="Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled">Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled(lowercase)</page></deprecated>Enables or disables the keyboard input for the panel.

arguments.name: keyboardInput
arguments.description: Whether to enable or disable keyboard input.

functions.name: SetMaximumCharCount
functions.description:
Sets the maximum character count this panel should have.

This function will only work on <page>RichText</page> and <page>TextEntry</page> panels and their derivatives.

arguments.name: maxChar
arguments.description: The new maximum amount of characters this panel is allowed to contain.

functions.name: SetMinimumSize
functions.description:
Sets the minimum dimensions of the panel or object.
