You can restrict either or both values.

Calling the function without arguments will remove the minimum size.

arguments.name: minW
arguments.description: The minimum width of the object.

arguments.name: minH
arguments.description: The minimum height of the object.

functions.name: SetModel
functions.description:
Sets the model to be displayed by <page>SpawnIcon</page>.

<note>This must be called after setting size if you wish to use a different size spawnicon</note>

arguments.name: ModelPath
arguments.description: The path of the model to set

arguments.name: skin
arguments.description: The skin to set

arguments.name: bodygroups
arguments.description: The body groups to set. Each single-digit number in the string represents a separate bodygroup, **up to 9 in total**.

functions.name: SetMouseInputEnabled
functions.description: Enables or disables the mouse input for the panel.

arguments.name: mouseInput
arguments.description: Whenever to enable or disable mouse input.

functions.name: SetName
functions.description: Sets the internal name of the panel.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The new name of the panel.

functions.name: SetPaintBackgroundEnabled
functions.description: Sets whenever all the default background of the panel should be drawn or not.

arguments.name: paintBackground
arguments.description: Whenever to draw the background or not.

functions.name: SetPaintBorderEnabled
functions.description: Sets whenever all the default border of the panel should be drawn or not.

arguments.name: paintBorder
arguments.description: Whenever to draw the border or not.

functions.name: SetPaintedManually
functions.description: Enables or disables painting of the panel manually with <page>Panel:PaintManual</page>.

arguments.name: paintedManually
arguments.description: True if the panel should be painted manually.

functions.name: SetPaintFunction
functions.description:
<deprecated>This function does nothing.</deprecated>
This function does nothing.

functions.name: SetParent
functions.description: Sets the parent of the panel.

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: The new parent of the panel.

functions.name: SetPlayer
functions.description: Used by <page>AvatarImage</page> to load an avatar for given player.

arguments.name: player
arguments.description: The player to use avatar of.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: The size of the avatar to use. Acceptable sizes are 32, 64, 184.

functions.name: SetPopupStayAtBack
functions.description: If this panel object has been made a popup with <page>Panel:MakePopup</page>, this method will prevent it from drawing in front of other panels when it receives input focus.

arguments.name: stayAtBack
arguments.description: If `true`, the popup panel will not draw in front of others when it gets focus, for example when it is clicked.

functions.name: SetPos
functions.description:
Sets the position of the panel's top left corner.

This will trigger <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page>. You should avoid calling this function in <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page> to avoid infinite loops.

<note>If you wish to position and re-size panels without much guesswork and have them look good on different screen resolutions, you may find <page>Panel:Dock</page> useful</note>

arguments.name: posX
arguments.description: The x coordinate of the position.

arguments.name: posY
arguments.description: The y coordinate of the position.

functions.name: SetRenderInScreenshots
functions.description: Sets whenever the panel should be rendered in the next screenshot.

arguments.name: renderInScreenshot
arguments.description: Whenever to render or not.

functions.name: SetSelectable
functions.description: Sets whether the panel object can be selected or not (like icons in the Spawn Menu, holding <key>Shift</key>). If enabled, this will affect the function of a <page>DButton</page> whilst <key>Shift</key> is pressed. <page>Panel:SetSelected</page> can be used to select/deselect the object.

arguments.name: selectable
arguments.description: Whether the panel object should be selectable or not.

functions.name: SetSelected
functions.description: Sets the selected state of a selectable panel object. This functionality is set with <page>Panel:SetSelectable</page> and checked with <page>Panel:IsSelectable</page>.

arguments.name: selected
arguments.description: Whether the object should be selected or deselected. <page>Panel:IsSelected</page> can be used to determine the selected state of the object.

functions.name: SetSelectionCanvas
functions.description: Enables the panel object for selection (much like the spawn menu).

arguments.name: selCanvas
arguments.description: Any value other than `nil` or `false` will enable the panel object for selection. It is recommended to pass `true`.

functions.name: SetSize
functions.description:
Sets the size of the panel.

Calls <page>PANEL:OnSizeChanged</page> and marks this panel for layout (<page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page>).


See also <page>Panel:SetWidth</page> and <page>Panel:SetHeight</page>.

<note>If you wish to position and re-size panels without much guesswork and have them look good on different screen resolutions, you may find <page>Panel:Dock</page> useful</note>

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The width of the panel.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The height of the panel.

functions.name: SetSkin
functions.description: Sets the derma skin that the panel object will use, and refreshes all panels with <page>derma.RefreshSkins</page>.

arguments.name: skinName
arguments.description: The name of the skin to use. The default derma skin is `Default`.

functions.name: SetSpawnIcon
functions.description:
Sets the .png image to be displayed on a  <page>SpawnIcon</page> or the panel it is based on <page>ModelImage</page>.

Only .png images can be used with this function.

arguments.name: icon
arguments.description: A path to the .png material, for example one of the <page>Silkicons</page> shipped with the game.

functions.name: SetSteamID
functions.description: Used by <page>AvatarImage</page> panels to load an avatar by its 64-bit Steam ID (community ID).

arguments.name: steamid
arguments.description: The 64bit SteamID of the player to load avatar of

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: The size of the avatar to use. Acceptable sizes are 32, 64, 184.

functions.name: SetTabPosition
functions.description: When TAB is pressed, the next selectable panel in the number sequence is selected.

functions.name: SetTall
functions.description: Sets height of a panel. An alias of <page>Panel:SetHeight</page>.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: Desired height to set

functions.name: SetTerm
functions.description:
Removes the panel after given time in seconds.
<note>This function will not work if <page>PANEL:AnimationThink</page> is overridden, unless <page>Panel:AnimationThinkInternal</page> is called every frame.</note>

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: Delay in seconds after which the panel should be removed.

functions.name: SetText
functions.description:
Sets the text value of a panel object containing text, such as a <page>Label</page>, <page>TextEntry</page> or  <page>RichText</page> and their derivatives, such as <page>DLabel</page>, <page>DTextEntry</page> or <page>DButton</page>.

<warning>When used on a <page>Label</page> or its derivatives ( <page>DLabel</page> and <page>DButton</page> ), it will automatically call <page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page>, meaning that you should avoid running this function every frame on these panels to avoid unnecessary performance loss.</warning>

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: The text value to set.

functions.name: SetTextInset
functions.description: Sets the left and top text margins of a text-based panel object, such as a <page>DButton</page> or <page>DLabel</page>.

arguments.name: insetX
arguments.description: The left margin for the text, in pixels. This will only affect centered text if the margin is greater than its x-coordinate.

arguments.name: insetY
arguments.description: The top margin for the text, in pixels.

functions.name: SetToFullHeight
functions.description:
Sets the height of a <page>RichText</page> element to accommodate the text inside.

<note>This function internally relies on <page>Panel:GetNumLines</page>, so it should be called at least a couple frames after modifying the text using <page>Panel:AppendText</page></note>

functions.name: SetTooltip
functions.description: Sets the tooltip to be displayed when a player hovers over the panel object with their cursor.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The text to be displayed in the tooltip. Set false to disable it.

functions.name: SetTooltipPanel
functions.description:
Sets the panel to be displayed as contents of a <page>DTooltip</page> when a player hovers over the panel object with their cursor. See <page>Panel:SetTooltipPanelOverride</page> if you are looking to override <page>DTooltip</page> itself.

<note><page>Panel:SetTooltip</page> will override this functionality.</note>

<warning>Calling this from <page>PANEL:OnCursorEntered</page> is too late! The tooltip will not be displayed or be updated.</warning>
<warning>Given panel or the previously set one will NOT be automatically removed.</warning>

arguments.name: tooltipPanel
arguments.description: The panel to use as the tooltip.

functions.name: SetTooltipPanelOverride
functions.description: Sets the panel class to be created instead of <page>DTooltip</page> when the player hovers over this panel and a tooltip needs creating.

arguments.name: override
arguments.description:
The panel class to override the default <page>DTooltip</page>. The new panel class must have the following methods:
* <page text="SetText">Panel:SetText</page> - If you are using <page>Panel:SetTooltip</page>
* <page text="SetContents">DTooltip:SetContents</page> - If you are using <page>Panel:SetTooltipPanel</page>
* <page text="OpenForPanel">DTooltip:OpenForPanel</page> - A "hook" type function that gets called shortly after creation (and after the above 2) to open and position the tooltip. You can see this logic in `lua/includes/util/tooltips.lua`

functions.name: SetUnderlineFont
functions.description:
Sets the underlined font for use by clickable text in a <page>RichText</page>. See also <page>Panel:InsertClickableTextStart</page>

This function will only work on <page>RichText</page> panels.

arguments.name: fontName
arguments.description:
The name of the font.

See <page text="here">Default_Fonts</page> for a list of existing fonts.
Alternatively, use <page>surface.CreateFont</page> to create your own custom font.

functions.name: SetURL
functions.description: Sets the URL of a link-based panel such as <page>DLabelURL</page>.

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: The URL to set. This **must** begin with `http://`.

functions.name: SetVerticalScrollbarEnabled
functions.description:
Sets the visibility of the vertical scrollbar.

Works for <page>RichText</page> and <page>TextEntry</page>.

arguments.name: display
arguments.description: True to display the vertical text scroll bar, false to hide it.

functions.name: SetVisible
functions.description: Sets the "visibility" of the panel.

arguments.name: visible
arguments.description: The visibility of the panel.

functions.name: SetWide
functions.description: Sets width of a panel. An alias of <page>Panel:SetWidth</page>.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: Desired width to set

functions.name: SetWidth
functions.description:
Sets the width of the panel.

Calls <page>PANEL:OnSizeChanged</page> and marks this panel for layout (<page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page>).


See also <page>Panel:SetSize</page>.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The new width of the panel.

functions.name: SetWorldClicker
functions.description:
This makes it so that when you're hovering over this panel you can `click` on the world. Your viewmodel will aim etc. This is primarily used for the Sandbox context menu.

<bug issue="3467">This function doesn't scale with custom FOV specified by <page>GM:CalcView</page> or <page>WEAPON:TranslateFOV</page>.</bug>

functions.name: SetWrap
functions.description:
Sets whether text wrapping should be enabled or disabled on <page>Label</page> and <page>DLabel</page> panels.
Use <page>DLabel:SetAutoStretchVertical</page> to automatically correct vertical size; <page>Panel:SizeToContents</page> will not set the correct height.

arguments.name: wrap
arguments.description: True to enable text wrapping, false otherwise.

functions.name: SetZPos
functions.description:
Sets the panels z position which determines the rendering order.

Panels with lower z positions appear behind panels with higher z positions.

This also controls in which order panels docked with <page>Panel:Dock</page> appears.

arguments.name: zIndex
arguments.description:
The z position of the panel.
Can't be lower than -32768 or higher than 32767.

functions.name: Show
functions.description: Makes a panel visible.

functions.name: SizeTo
functions.description: Uses animation to resize the panel to the specified size.

arguments.name: sizeW
arguments.description: The target width of the panel. Use -1 to retain the current width.

arguments.name: sizeH
arguments.description: The target height of the panel. Use -1 to retain the current height.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: The time to perform the animation within.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: The delay before the animation starts.

arguments.name: ease
arguments.description: Easing of the start and/or end speed of the animation. See <page>Panel:NewAnimation</page> for how this works.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called once the animation finishes. Arguments are:
* <page>table</page> animData - The <page>AnimationData that was used.</page>
* <page>Panel</page> pnl - The panel object that was resized.

functions.name: SizeToChildren
functions.description:
Resizes the panel to fit the bounds of its children.

<note>Your panel must have its layout updated (<page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page>) for this function to work properly.</note>
<note>The sizeW and sizeH parameters are false by default. Therefore, calling this function with no arguments will result in a no-op.</note>

arguments.name: sizeW
arguments.description: Resize with width of the panel.

arguments.name: sizeH
arguments.description: Resize the height of the panel.

functions.name: SizeToContents
functions.description:
Resizes the panel so that its width and height fit all of the content inside.

<note>Only works on <page>Label</page> derived panels such as <page>DLabel</page> by default, and on any panel that manually implemented the <page>Panel:SizeToContents</page> method, such as <page>DNumberWang</page> and <page>DImage</page>.</note>

<warning>You must call this function **AFTER** setting text/font, adjusting child panels or otherwise altering the panel.</warning>

functions.name: SizeToContentsX
functions.description:
Resizes the panel object's width to accommodate all child objects/contents.

Only works on <page>Label</page> derived panels such as <page>DLabel</page> by default, and on any panel that manually implemented <page>Panel:GetContentSize</page> method.

<note>You must call this function **AFTER** setting text/font or adjusting child panels.</note>

arguments.name: addVal
arguments.description: The number of extra pixels to add to the width. Can be a negative number, to reduce the width.

functions.name: SizeToContentsY
functions.description:
Resizes the panel object's height to accommodate all child objects/contents.

Only works on <page>Label</page> derived panels such as <page>DLabel</page> by default, and on any panel that manually implemented <page>Panel:GetContentSize</page> method.

<note>You must call this function **AFTER** setting text/font or adjusting child panels.</note>

arguments.name: addVal
arguments.description: The number of extra pixels to add to the height.

functions.name: SlideDown
functions.description: Slides the panel in from above.

arguments.name: Length
arguments.description: Time to complete the animation.

functions.name: SlideUp
functions.description: Slides the panel out to the top.

arguments.name: Length
arguments.description: Time to complete the animation.

functions.name: StartBoxSelection
functions.description: Begins a box selection, enables mouse capture for the panel object, and sets the start point of the selection box to the mouse cursor's position, relative to this object. For this to work, either the object or its parent must be enabled as a selection canvas. This is set using <page>Panel:SetSelectionCanvas</page>.

functions.name: Stop
functions.description: Stops all panel animations by clearing its animation list. This also clears all delayed animations.

functions.name: StretchBottomTo
functions.description: Resizes the panel object's height so that its bottom is aligned with the top of the passed panel. An offset greater than zero will reduce the panel's height to leave a gap between it and the passed panel.

arguments.name: tgtPanel
arguments.description: The panel to align the bottom of this one with.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The gap to leave between this and the passed panel. Negative values will cause the panel's height to increase, forming an overlap.

functions.name: StretchRightTo
functions.description: Resizes the panel object's width so that its right edge is aligned with the left of the passed panel. An offset greater than zero will reduce the panel's width to leave a gap between it and the passed panel.

arguments.name: tgtPanel
arguments.description: The panel to align the right edge of this one with.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The gap to leave between this and the passed panel. Negative values will cause the panel's width to increase, forming an overlap.

functions.name: StretchToParent
functions.description: Sets the dimensions of the panel to fill its parent. It will only stretch in directions that aren't nil.

arguments.name: offsetLeft
arguments.description: The left offset to the parent.

arguments.name: offsetTop
arguments.description: The top offset to the parent.

arguments.name: offsetRight
arguments.description: The right offset to the parent.

arguments.name: offsetBottom
arguments.description: The bottom offset to the parent.

functions.name: ToggleSelection
functions.description: Toggles the selected state of a selectable panel object. This functionality is set with <page>Panel:SetSelectable</page> and checked with <page>Panel:IsSelectable</page>. To check whether the object is selected or not, <page>Panel:IsSelected</page> is used.

functions.name: ToggleVisible
functions.description: Toggles the visibility of a panel and all its children.

functions.name: Undo
functions.description:
Restores the last saved state (caret position and the text inside) of a <page>TextEntry</page>. Should act identically to pressing CTRL+Z in a <page>TextEntry</page>.

See also <page>Panel:SaveUndoState</page>.

functions.name: UnselectAll
functions.description: Recursively deselects this panel object and all of its children. This will cascade to all child objects at every level below the parent.

functions.name: UpdateHTMLTexture
functions.description:
Forcibly updates the panels' HTML Material, similar to when Paint is called on it.
This is only useful if the panel is not normally visible, i.e the panel exists purely for its HTML Material. Only works on with panels that have a HTML Material. See Panel:GetHTMLMaterial for more details. A good place to call this is in the GM:PreRender hook

functions.name: Valid
functions.description: <deprecated>Use <page>Panel:IsValid</page> instead.</deprecated>Returns if a given panel is valid or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the panel is valid or not, true being it is, false being it isn't.

name: PathFollower
description: Path object for a NextBot NPC. Returned by <page>Global.Path</page>.

functions.name: Chase
functions.description: If you created your path with type "Chase" this functions should be used in place of <page>PathFollower:Update</page> to cause the bot to chase the specified entity.

arguments.name: bot
arguments.description: The bot to update along the path

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity we want to chase

functions.name: Compute
functions.description: Compute shortest path from bot to 'goal' via A* algorithm.

arguments.name: from
arguments.description: The nextbot we're generating for

arguments.name: to
arguments.description: To point

arguments.name: generator
arguments.description: A funtion that allows you to alter the path generation. See example below for the default function.

returnValues.description:
* If returns true, path was found to the goal position.
* If returns false, path may either be invalid (use IsValid() to check), or valid but doesn't reach all the way to the goal.

functions.name: Draw
functions.description: Draws the path. This is meant for debugging - and uses debug overlay.

functions.name: FirstSegment
functions.description: Returns the first segment of the path.

returnValues.description: A table with <page>Structures/PathSegment</page>.

functions.name: GetAge
functions.description: Returns the age since the path was built

returnValues.description: Path age

functions.name: GetAllSegments
functions.description: Returns all of the segments of the given path.

returnValues.description: A table of tables with <page>Structures/PathSegment</page>.

functions.name: GetClosestPosition
functions.description: The closest position along the path to a position

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The point we're querying for

returnValues.description: The closest position on the path

functions.name: GetCurrentGoal
functions.description: Returns the current goal data. Can return nil if the current goal is invalid, for example immediately after <page>PathFollower:Update</page>.

returnValues.description: A table with <page>Structures/PathSegment</page>.

functions.name: GetCursorData
functions.description: Returns the cursor data

returnValues.description:
A table with 3 keys:
<page>number</page> curvature


<page>Vector</page> forward


<page>Vector</page> pos

functions.name: GetCursorPosition
functions.description: Returns the current progress along the path

returnValues.description: The current progress

functions.name: GetEnd
functions.description: Returns the path end position

returnValues.description: The end position

functions.name: GetGoalTolerance
functions.description: Returns how close we can get to the goal to call it done.

returnValues.description: The distance we're setting it to

functions.name: GetLength
functions.description: Returns the total length of the path

returnValues.description: The length of the path

functions.name: GetMinLookAheadDistance
functions.description: Returns the minimum range movement goal must be along path.

returnValues.description: The minimum look ahead distance

functions.name: GetPositionOnPath
functions.description: Returns the vector position of distance along path

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: The distance along the path to query

returnValues.description: The position

functions.name: GetStart
functions.description: Returns the path start position

returnValues.description: The start position

functions.name: Invalidate
functions.description: Invalidates the current path

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns true if the path is valid

returnValues.description: Wether the path is valid or not.

functions.name: LastSegment
functions.description: Returns the last segment of the path.

returnValues.description: A table with <page>Structures/PathSegment</page>.

functions.name: MoveCursor
functions.description:
Moves the cursor by give distance.

For a function that sets the distance, see <page>PathFollower:MoveCursorTo</page>.

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: The distance to move the cursor (in relative world units)

functions.name: MoveCursorTo
functions.description:
Sets the cursor position to given distance.

For relative distance, see <page>PathFollower:MoveCursor</page>.

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: The distance to move the cursor (in world units)

functions.name: MoveCursorToClosestPosition
functions.description: Moves the cursor of the path to the closest position compared to given vector.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description:
Seek type


0 = SEEK_ENTIRE_PATH - Search the entire path length


1 = SEEK_AHEAD - Search from current cursor position forward toward end of path


2 = SEEK_BEHIND - Search from current cursor position backward toward path start

functions.name: MoveCursorToEnd
functions.description: Moves the cursor to the end of the path

functions.name: MoveCursorToStart
functions.description: Moves the cursor to the end of the path

functions.name: ResetAge
functions.description: Resets the age which is retrieved by <page>PathFollower:GetAge</page> to 0.

functions.name: SetGoalTolerance
functions.description: How close we can get to the goal to call it done

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: The distance we're setting it to

functions.name: SetMinLookAheadDistance
functions.description: Sets minimum range movement goal must be along path

arguments.name: mindist
arguments.description: The minimum look ahead distance

functions.name: Update
functions.description: Move the bot along the path.

arguments.name: bot
arguments.description: The bot to update along the path

name: PhysCollide
description:
A PhysCollide holds collision data from VPhysics. These objects can be used to run (currently quite limited) collision tests, but do not represent actual physics objects.

Created by <page>Global.CreatePhysCollideBox</page> or <page>Global.CreatePhysCollidesFromModel</page>.

functions.name: Destroy
functions.description: Destroys the <page>PhysCollide</page> object.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description:
Checks whether this <page>PhysCollide</page> object is valid or not.

You should just use <page>Global.IsValid</page> instead.

returnValues.description: Is valid or not.

functions.name: TraceBox
functions.description: Performs a trace against this PhysCollide with the given parameters. This can be used for both line traces and box traces.

arguments.name: origin
arguments.description: The origin for the PhysCollide during the trace

arguments.name: angles
arguments.description: The angles for the PhysCollide during the trace

arguments.name: rayStart
arguments.description: The start position of the trace

arguments.name: rayEnd
arguments.description: The end position of the trace

arguments.name: rayMins
arguments.description: The mins of the trace's bounds

arguments.name: rayMaxs
arguments.description: The maxs of the trace's bounds

returnValues.description: Hit position of the trace. This is false if the trace did not hit.
Hit normal of the trace
Fraction of the trace. This is calculated from the distance between startPos, hitPos, and endPos.

name: PhysObj
description:
This is the object returned by <page>Entity:GetPhysicsObject</page> and <page>Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum</page>.

It represents a physics object.
<pagelist category="classfunc" filter="^PhysObj:"></pagelist>

functions.name: AddAngleVelocity
functions.description: Adds the specified velocity to the current.

arguments.name: angularVelocity
arguments.description: Additional velocity.

functions.name: AddGameFlag
functions.description: Adds one or more bit flags.

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: Bitflag, see <page>Enums/FVPHYSICS</page>.

functions.name: AddVelocity
functions.description: Adds the specified velocity to the current.

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: Additional velocity.

functions.name: AlignAngles
functions.description: Rotates the object so that it's angles are aligned to the ones inputted.

functions.name: ApplyForceCenter
functions.description:
Applies the specified force to the physics object. (in Newtons)

<note>This will not work on players, use <page>Entity:SetVelocity</page> instead.</note>

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: The force to be applied.

functions.name: ApplyForceOffset
functions.description: Applies the specified force on the physics object at the specified position

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: The force to be applied.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The position in world coordinates where the force is applied to the physics object.

functions.name: ApplyTorqueCenter
functions.description: Applies specified torque to the physics object.

arguments.name: torque
arguments.description: The torque to be applied in kg * degrees / s.

functions.name: CalculateForceOffset
functions.description: Calculates the force and torque on the center of mass for an offset force impulse. The outputs can be directly passed to <page>PhysObj:ApplyForceCenter</page> and <page>PhysObj:ApplyTorqueCenter</page>, respectively.

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: The initial force

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The location of the force in world coordinates

returnValues.description: The calculated force on the physics object's center of mass
The calculated torque on the physics object's center of mass

functions.name: CalculateVelocityOffset
functions.description: Calculates the linear and angular velocities on the center of mass for an offset force impulse. The outputs can be directly passed to <page>PhysObj:AddVelocity</page> and <page>PhysObj:AddAngleVelocity</page>, respectively.

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: The initial force

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The location of the force in world coordinates

returnValues.description: The calculated linear velocity from the force on the physics object's center of mass
The calculated angular velocity from the force on the physics object's center of mass

functions.name: ClearGameFlag
functions.description: Removes one of more specified flags.

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: Bitflag, see <page>Enums/FVPHYSICS</page>.

functions.name: ComputeShadowControl
functions.description: Allows you to move a PhysObj to a point and angle in 3D space.

arguments.name: shadowparams
arguments.description: The parameters for the shadow. See example code to see how its used.

functions.name: EnableCollisions
functions.description:
Sets whether the physics object should collide with anything or not, including world.

<warning>This function currently has major problems with player collisions, and as such should be avoided at all costs.



A better alternative to this function would be using <page>Entity:SetCollisionGroup</page>( COLLISION_GROUP_WORLD ).</warning>

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: True to enable, false to disable.

functions.name: EnableDrag
functions.description: Sets whenever the physics object should be affected by drag.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: True to enable, false to disable.

functions.name: EnableGravity
functions.description: Sets whether the PhysObject should be affected by gravity

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: True to enable, false to disable.

functions.name: EnableMotion
functions.description:
Sets whether the physobject should be able to move or not.

This is the exact method the Physics Gun uses to freeze props. If a motion-disabled physics object is grabbed with the physics gun, the object will be able to move again. To disallow this, use <page>GM:PhysgunPickup</page>.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: True to enable, false to disable.

functions.name: GetAABB
functions.description: Returns the mins and max of the physics object.

returnValues.description: Mins
Maxs

functions.name: GetAngles
functions.description: Returns the angles of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The angles of the physics object.

functions.name: GetAngleVelocity
functions.description: Gets the angular velocity of the object in degrees per second.

returnValues.description: The angular velocity

functions.name: GetContents
functions.description: Returns the contents flag of the <page>PhysObj</page>.

returnValues.description: The <page>Enums/CONTENTS</page>.

functions.name: GetDamping
functions.description: Returns the linear and angular damping of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The linear damping
The angular damping

functions.name: GetEnergy
functions.description: Returns the kinetic energy of the physobject.

returnValues.description: The kinetic energy

functions.name: GetEntity
functions.description: Returns the parent entity of the physics object.

returnValues.description: parent

functions.name: GetFrictionSnapshot
functions.description: Returns the friction snapshot of this physics object. This is useful for determining if an object touching ground for example.

returnValues.description:
A table of tables containing the following data:
* <page>PhysObj</page> Other - The other physics object we came in contact with
* <page>number</page> EnergyAbsorbed -
* <page>number</page> FrictionCoefficient -
* <page>number</page> NormalForce -
* <page>Vector</page> Normal - Direction of the friction event
* <page>Vector</page> ContactPoint - Contact point of the friction event
* <page>number</page> Material - Surface Property ID of our physics obj
* <page>number</page> MaterialOther - Surface Property ID of the physics obj we came in contact with

functions.name: GetInertia
functions.description: Returns the directional inertia of the physics object.

returnValues.description: directionalInertia

functions.name: GetInvInertia
functions.description: Returns 1 divided by the inertia.

returnValues.description: The inverted inertia

functions.name: GetInvMass
functions.description: Returns 1 divided by the physics object's mass.

returnValues.description: The inverted mass.

functions.name: GetMass
functions.description: Returns the mass of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The mass in kilograms.

functions.name: GetMassCenter
functions.description: Returns the center of mass of the physics object as a local vector.

returnValues.description: The center of mass of the physics object.

functions.name: GetMaterial
functions.description: Returns the physical material of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The physical material

functions.name: GetMesh
functions.description: Returns the physics mesh of the object which is used for physobj-on-physobj collision.

returnValues.description: Table of <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page>s where each three vertices represent a triangle. Returns nil if the physics object is a sphere.

functions.name: GetMeshConvexes
functions.description: Returns all convex physics meshes of the object. See <page>Entity.PhysicsInitMultiConvex</page> for more information.

returnValues.description: Table of <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page>s where each <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page> is an independent convex mesh and each three vertices represent a triangle. Returns nil if the physics object is a sphere.

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: Returns the name of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The name of the physics object.

functions.name: GetPos
functions.description: Returns the position of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The position

functions.name: GetPositionMatrix
functions.description: Returns the position and angle of the physics object as a 3x4 matrix (<page>VMatrix</page> is 4x4 so the fourth row goes unused). The first three columns store the angle as a [rotation matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotation_matrix), and the fourth column stores the position vector.

returnValues.description: The position and angle matrix.

functions.name: GetRotDamping
functions.description: Returns the rotation damping of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The rotation damping

functions.name: GetShadowAngles
functions.description: Returns the angles of the <page>PhysObj</page> shadow. See <page>PhysObj:UpdateShadow</page>.

returnValues.description: The angles of the <page>PhysObj</page> shadow.

functions.name: GetShadowPos
functions.description: Returns the position of the <page>PhysObj</page> shadow. See <page>PhysObj:UpdateShadow</page>.

returnValues.description: The position of the <page>PhysObj</page> shadow.

functions.name: GetSpeedDamping
functions.description: Returns the speed damping of the physics object.

returnValues.description: speedDamping

functions.name: GetStress
functions.description: Returns the stress of the entity.

returnValues.description: exertedStress

functions.name: GetSurfaceArea
functions.description: Returns the surface area of the physics object in source-units. Or nil if the PhysObj is a generated sphere or box.

returnValues.description: The surface area or nil if the PhysObj is a generated sphere or box.

functions.name: GetVelocity
functions.description: Returns the absolute directional velocity of the physobject.

returnValues.description: velocity

functions.name: GetVelocityAtPoint
functions.description: Returns the world velocity of a point in world coordinates about the object.

functions.name: GetVolume
functions.description: Returns the volume in source units. Or nil if the PhysObj is a generated sphere or box.

returnValues.description: The volume or nil if the PhysObj is a generated sphere or box.

functions.name: HasGameFlag
functions.description: Returns whenever the specified flag(s) is/are set.

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: Bitflag, see <page>Enums/FVPHYSICS</page>.

returnValues.description: If flag was set or not

functions.name: IsAsleep
functions.description:
Returns whether the physics object is "sleeping".

See <page>PhysObj:Sleep</page> for more information.

returnValues.description: Whether the physics object is sleeping.

functions.name: IsCollisionEnabled
functions.description: Returns whenever the entity is able to collide or not.

returnValues.description: isCollisionEnabled

functions.name: IsDragEnabled
functions.description: Returns whenever the entity is affected by drag.

returnValues.description: dragEnabled

functions.name: IsGravityEnabled
functions.description: Returns whenever the entity is affected by gravity.

returnValues.description: gravitated

functions.name: IsMotionEnabled
functions.description: Returns if the physics object can move itself (by velocity, acceleration)

returnValues.description: motionEnabled

functions.name: IsMoveable
functions.description: Returns whenever the entity is able to move.

returnValues.description: movable

functions.name: IsPenetrating
functions.description:
Returns whenever the physics object is penetrating another physics object.

This is internally implemented as `PhysObj:HasGameFlag( FVPHYSICS_PENETRATING )` and thus is only updated for non-static physics objects.

returnValues.description: Whether the physics object is penetrating another object.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns if the physics object is valid/not NULL.

returnValues.description: isValid

functions.name: LocalToWorld
functions.description:
Mapping a vector in local frame of the physics object to world frame.

<note>this function does translation and rotation, with translation done first.</note>

arguments.name: LocalVec
arguments.description: A vector in the physics object's local frame

returnValues.description: The corresponding vector in world frame

functions.name: LocalToWorldVector
functions.description:
Rotate a vector from the local frame of the physics object to world frame.

<note>This function only rotates the vector, without any translation operation.</note>

arguments.name: LocalVec
arguments.description: A vector in the physics object's local frame

returnValues.description: The corresponding vector in world frame

functions.name: OutputDebugInfo
functions.description: Prints debug info about the state of the physics object to the console.

functions.name: RecheckCollisionFilter
functions.description: Call this when the collision filter conditions change due to this object's state (e.g. changing solid type or collision group)

functions.name: RotateAroundAxis
functions.description: A convinience function for <page>Angle:RotateAroundAxis</page>.

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: Direction, around which we will rotate

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: Amount of rotation, in degrees

returnValues.description: The resulting angle

functions.name: SetAngleDragCoefficient
functions.description: Sets the amount of [drag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drag_(physics)) to apply to a physics object when attempting to rotate.

arguments.name: coefficient
arguments.description: [Drag coefficient](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drag_coefficient). The bigger this value is, the slower the angles will change.

functions.name: SetAngles
functions.description: Sets the angles of the physobject.

arguments.name: angles
arguments.description: The new angles of the physobject.

functions.name: SetBuoyancyRatio
functions.description: Sets the buoyancy ratio of the physics object. (How well it floats in water)

arguments.name: buoyancy
arguments.description: Buoyancy ratio, where 0 is not buoyant at all (like a rock), and 1 is very buoyant (like wood). You can set values larger than 1 for greater effect.

functions.name: SetContents
functions.description: Sets the contents flag of the <page>PhysObj</page>.

arguments.name: contents
arguments.description: The <page>Enums/CONTENTS</page>.

functions.name: SetDamping
functions.description: Sets the linear and angular damping of the physics object.

arguments.name: linearDamping
arguments.description: Linear damping.

arguments.name: angularDamping
arguments.description: Angular damping.

functions.name: SetDragCoefficient
functions.description: Modifies how much drag (air resistance) affects the object.

arguments.name: drag
arguments.description:
The drag coefficient
It can be positive or negative.

functions.name: SetInertia
functions.description: Sets the directional inertia.

arguments.name: directionalInertia
arguments.description:
The directional inertia of the object.
A value of Vector(0,0,0) makes the physobject go invalid.

functions.name: SetMass
functions.description: Sets the mass of the physics object.

arguments.name: mass
arguments.description: The mass in kilograms.

functions.name: SetMaterial
functions.description:
Sets the material of the physobject.

<note>Impact sounds will only change if this is called on client</note>

arguments.name: materialName
arguments.description: The name of the phys material to use. From this list: [Valve Developer](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Material_surface_properties)

functions.name: SetPos
functions.description: Sets the position of the physobject.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The new position of the physobject.

functions.name: SetVelocity
functions.description: Sets the velocity of the physics object for the next iteration.

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: The new velocity of the physics object.

functions.name: SetVelocityInstantaneous
functions.description: Sets the velocity of the physics object.

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: The new velocity of the physics object.

functions.name: Sleep
functions.description:
Makes the physics object "sleep".

The physics object will no longer be moving unless it is "woken up" by either a collision with another moving object, or by <page>PhysObj:Wake</page>. This is an optimization feature of the physics engine.

functions.name: UpdateShadow
functions.description:
Unlike PhysObj:SetPos and PhysObj:SetAngles, this allows the movement of a physobj while leaving physics interactions intact.
This is used internally by the motion controller of the Gravity Gun , the +use pickup and the Physics Gun, and entities such as the crane. This is the ideal function to move a physics shadow created with Entity:PhysicsInitShadow or Entity:MakePhysicsObjectAShadow.

arguments.name: targetPosition
arguments.description: The position we should move to.

arguments.name: targetAngles
arguments.description: The angle we should rotate towards.

arguments.name: frameTime
arguments.description:
The frame time to use for this movement, can be generally filled with <page>Global.FrameTime</page> or <page>ENTITY:PhysicsSimulate</page> with the deltaTime.

Can be set to 0 when you need to update the physics object just once.

functions.name: Wake
functions.description:
Wakes the physics object.

See <page>PhysObj:Sleep</page> for more information.

functions.name: WorldToLocal
functions.description: Converts a vector to a relative to the physics object coordinate system.

arguments.name: vec
arguments.description: The vector in world space coordinates.

returnValues.description: The vector local to <page>PhysObj:GetPos</page>.

functions.name: WorldToLocalVector
functions.description:
Rotate a vector from the world frame to the local frame of the physics object.

<note>This function only rotates the vector, without any translation operation.</note>

arguments.name: WorldVec
arguments.description: A vector in the world frame

returnValues.description: The corresponding vector relative to the PhysObj

name: Player
description: This is a list of all methods only available for players. It is also possible to call <page>Entity</page> functions on the Player.

functions.name: AccountID
functions.description:
Returns the player's AccountID aka SteamID3.

For bots this will return values starting with 0 for the first bot, 1 for the second bot and so on.
In singleplayer, this will return no value.

returnValues.description: Player's SteamID3 aka AccountID.

functions.name: AddCleanup
functions.description: Adds an entity to the players clean up list.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Cleanup type

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: Entity to add

functions.name: AddCount
functions.description: Adds an entity to the total count of entities of same class.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: Entity type

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: Entity

functions.name: AddDeaths
functions.description: Add a certain amount to the player's death count

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: number of deaths to add

functions.name: AddFrags
functions.description: Add a certain amount to the player's frag count (or kills count)

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: number of frags to add

functions.name: AddFrozenPhysicsObject
functions.description: Adds a entity to the players list of frozen objects.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: Entity

arguments.name: physobj
arguments.description: Physics object belonging to ent

functions.name: AddPlayerOption
functions.description:
Sets up the voting system for the player.
This is a really barebone system. By calling this a vote gets started, when the player presses 0-9 the callback function gets called along with the key the player pressed. Use the draw callback to draw the vote panel.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the vote

arguments.name: timeout
arguments.description: Time until the vote expires

arguments.name: vote_callback
arguments.description: The function to be run when the player presses 0-9 while a vote is active.

arguments.name: draw_callback
arguments.description: Used to draw the vote panel.

functions.name: AddVCDSequenceToGestureSlot
functions.description: Plays a sequence directly from a sequence number, similar to <page>Player:AnimRestartGesture</page>. This function has the advantage to play sequences that haven't been bound to an existing <page>Enums/ACT</page>

arguments.name: slot
arguments.description: Gesture slot using <page>Enums/GESTURE_SLOT</page>

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description: The sequence ID to play, can be retrieved with <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page>.

arguments.name: cycle
arguments.description: The cycle to start the animation at, ranges from 0 to 1.

arguments.name: autokill
arguments.description: If the animation should not loop. true = stops the animation, false = the animation keeps playing.

functions.name: Alive
functions.description: Checks if the player is alive.

returnValues.description: Whether the player is alive

functions.name: AllowFlashlight
functions.description: Sets if the player can toggle his flashlight. Function exists on both the server and client but has no effect when ran on the client.

arguments.name: canFlashlight
arguments.description: True allows flashlight toggling

functions.name: AllowImmediateDecalPainting
functions.description: Lets the player spray his decal without delay

arguments.name: allow
arguments.description: Allow or disallow

functions.name: AnimResetGestureSlot
functions.description: Resets player gesture in selected slot.

arguments.name: slot
arguments.description: Slot to reset. See the <page>Enums/GESTURE_SLOT</page>.

functions.name: AnimRestartGesture
functions.description:
Restart a gesture on a player, within a gesture slot.

<warning>This is not automatically networked. This function has to be called on the client to be seen by said client.</warning>

arguments.name: slot
arguments.description: Gesture slot using <page>Enums/GESTURE_SLOT</page>

arguments.name: activity
arguments.description: The activity ( see <page>Enums/ACT</page> ) or sequence that should be played

arguments.name: autokill
arguments.description: Whether the animation should be automatically stopped. true = stops the animation, false = the animation keeps playing/looping

functions.name: AnimRestartMainSequence
functions.description: Restarts the main animation on the player, has the same effect as calling <page>Entity:SetCycle</page>( 0 ).

functions.name: AnimSetGestureSequence
functions.description: Sets the sequence of the animation playing in the given gesture slot.

arguments.name: slot
arguments.description: The gesture slot. See <page>Enums/GESTURE_SLOT</page>

arguments.name: sequenceID
arguments.description: Sequence ID to set.

functions.name: AnimSetGestureWeight
functions.description: Sets the weight of the animation playing in the given gesture slot.

arguments.name: slot
arguments.description: The gesture slot. See <page>Enums/GESTURE_SLOT</page>

arguments.name: weight
arguments.description: The weight this slot should be set to. Value must be ranging from 0 to 1.

functions.name: Armor
functions.description: Returns the player's armor.

returnValues.description: The player's armor.

functions.name: Ban
functions.description: Bans the player from the server for a certain amount of minutes.

arguments.name: minutes
arguments.description: Duration of the ban in minutes (0 is permanent)

arguments.name: kick
arguments.description: Whether to kick the player after banning them or not

functions.name: CanUseFlashlight
functions.description:
Returns true if the player's flashlight hasn't been disabled by <page>Player:AllowFlashlight</page>.

<note>This is not synchronized between clients and server automatically!</note>

returnValues.description: Whether the player can use flashlight.

functions.name: ChatPrint
functions.description:
Prints a string to the chatbox of the client.

<warning>Just like the <page>usermessage</page>, this function is affected by the 255 byte limit!</warning>

arguments.name: message
arguments.description: String to be printed

functions.name: CheckLimit
functions.description: Checks if the limit is hit or not. If it is, it will throw a notification saying so.

arguments.name: limitType
arguments.description:
Limit type. In unmodified Sandbox possible values are:
* "props"
* "ragdolls"
* "vehicles"
* "effects"
* "balloons"
* "cameras"
* "npcs"
* "sents"
* "dynamite"
* "lamps"
* "lights"
* "wheels"
* "thrusters"
* "hoverballs"
* "buttons"
* "emitters"

returnValues.description: Returns true if limit is not hit, false if it is hit

functions.name: ConCommand
functions.description:
Runs the concommand on the player. This does not work on bots.

If you wish to directly modify the movement input of bots, use <page>GM:StartCommand</page> instead.

<note>Some commands/convars are blocked from being ran/changed using this function, usually to prevent harm/annoyance to clients. For a list of blocked commands, see <page>Blocked ConCommands</page>.</note>

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: command to run

functions.name: CreateRagdoll
functions.description:
Creates the player's death ragdoll entity and deletes the old one.

This is normally used when a player dies, to create their death ragdoll.

The ragdoll will be created with the player's properties such as <page text="Position">Entity:GetPos</page>, <page text="Angles">Entity:GetAngles</page>, <page text="PlayerColor">Player:GetPlayerColor</page>, <page text="Velocity">Entity:GetVelocity</page> and <page text="Model">Entity:GetModel</page>.

You can retrieve the entity this creates with <page>Player:GetRagdollEntity</page>.

functions.name: CrosshairDisable
functions.description: Disables the default player's crosshair. Can be reenabled with <page>Player:CrosshairEnable</page>. This will affect <page>WEAPON:DoDrawCrosshair</page>.

functions.name: CrosshairEnable
functions.description: Enables the player's crosshair, if it was previously disabled via <page>Player:CrosshairDisable</page>.

functions.name: Crouching
functions.description: Returns whether the player is crouching or not. (FL_DUCKING flag)

returnValues.description: Whether the player is crouching

functions.name: Deaths
functions.description: Returns the player's death count

returnValues.description: The number of deaths the player has had.

functions.name: DebugInfo
functions.description: Prints the players' name and position to the console.

functions.name: DetonateTripmines
functions.description: Detonates all tripmines belonging to the player.

functions.name: DoAnimationEvent
functions.description:
Sends a third person animation event to the player.

Calls <page>GM:DoAnimationEvent</page> with <page text="PLAYERANIMEVENT_CUSTOM_GESTURE">Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT</page> as the event, data as the given data.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The data to send.

functions.name: DoAttackEvent
functions.description:
Starts the player's attack animation. The attack animation is determined by the weapon's HoldType.

Similar to other animation event functions, calls <page>GM:DoAnimationEvent</page> with <page text="PLAYERANIMEVENT_ATTACK_PRIMARY">Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT</page> as the event and no extra data.

functions.name: DoCustomAnimEvent
functions.description:
Sends a specified third person animation event to the player.

Calls <page>GM:DoAnimationEvent</page> with specified arguments.

arguments.name: event
arguments.description: The event to send. See <page>Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT</page>.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The data to send alongside the event.

functions.name: DoReloadEvent
functions.description:
Sends a third person reload animation event to the player.

Similar to other animation event functions, calls <page>GM:DoAnimationEvent</page> with <page text="PLAYERANIMEVENT_RELOAD">Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT</page> as the event and no extra data.

functions.name: DoSecondaryAttack
functions.description:
Sends a third person secondary fire animation event to the player.

Similar to other animation event functions, calls <page>GM:DoAnimationEvent</page> with <page text="PLAYERANIMEVENT_ATTACK_SECONDARY">Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT</page> as the event and no extra data.

functions.name: DrawViewModel
functions.description: Show/Hide the player's weapon's viewmodel.

arguments.name: draw
arguments.description: Should draw

arguments.name: vm
arguments.description: Which view model to show/hide, 0-2.

functions.name: DrawWorldModel
functions.description: Show/Hide the player's weapon's worldmodel.

arguments.name: draw
arguments.description: Should draw

functions.name: DropNamedWeapon
functions.description: Drops the players' weapon of a specific class.

arguments.name: class
arguments.description: The class to drop.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: If set, launches the weapon at given position. There is a limit to how far it is willing to throw the weapon. Overrides velocity argument.

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: If set and previous argument is unset, launches the weapon with given velocity. If the velocity is higher than 400, it will be clamped to 400.

functions.name: DropObject
functions.description: Drops any object the player is currently holding with either gravitygun or +Use (E key)

functions.name: DropWeapon
functions.description: Forces the player to drop the specified weapon

arguments.name: weapon
arguments.description: Weapon to be dropped. If unset, will default to the currently equipped weapon.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: If set, launches the weapon at given position. There is a limit to how far it is willing to throw the weapon. Overrides velocity argument.

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: If set and previous argument is unset, launches the weapon with given velocity. If the velocity is higher than 400, it will be clamped to 400.

functions.name: EnterVehicle
functions.description: Enters the player into specified vehicle

arguments.name: vehicle
arguments.description: Vehicle the player will enter

functions.name: EquipSuit
functions.description:
Equips the player with the HEV suit. Allows the player to zoom, walk slowly, sprint, pickup armor batteries, use the health and armor stations and also shows the HUD.
The player also emits a flatline sound on death, which can be overridden with GM:PlayerDeathSound. The player is automatically equipped with the suit on spawn, if you wish to stop that, use Player:RemoveSuit.

functions.name: ExitVehicle
functions.description: Makes the player exit the vehicle if they're in one.

functions.name: Flashlight
functions.description: Enables/Disables the player's flashlight

arguments.name: isOn
arguments.description: Turns the flashlight on/off

functions.name: FlashlightIsOn
functions.description: Returns true if the player's flashlight is on.

returnValues.description: Whether the player's flashlight is on.

functions.name: Frags
functions.description: Returns the amount of kills a player has.

returnValues.description: kills

functions.name: Freeze
functions.description:
Freeze the player. Frozen players cannot move, look around, or attack. Key bindings are still called. Similar to <page>Player:Lock</page> but the player can still take damage.

Adds or removes the <page text="FL_FROZEN">Enums/FL</page> flag from the player.

<bug>Frozen bots will still be able to look around.</bug>

arguments.name: frozen
arguments.description: Whether the player should be frozen.

functions.name: GetActiveWeapon
functions.description:
Returns the player's active weapon.

If used on a <page>Global.LocalPlayer</page>() and the player is spectating another player with `OBS_MODE_IN_EYE`, the weapon returned will be of the spectated player.

returnValues.description: The weapon the player is currently has equipped.

functions.name: GetAimVector
functions.description: Returns the direction that the player is aiming.

returnValues.description: The direction vector of players aim

functions.name: GetAllowFullRotation
functions.description: Returns true if the players' model is allowed to rotate around the pitch and roll axis.

returnValues.description: Allowed

functions.name: GetAllowWeaponsInVehicle
functions.description: Returns whether the player is allowed to use his weapons in a vehicle or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the player is allowed to use his weapons in a vehicle or not.

functions.name: GetAmmo
functions.description: Returns a table of all ammo the player has.

returnValues.description:
A table with the following format
* <page>number</page> Key - AmmoID to be used with functions like <page>game.GetAmmoName</page>.
* <page>number</page> Value - Amount of ammo the player has of this kind.

functions.name: GetAmmoCount
functions.description: Gets the amount of ammo the player has.

arguments.name: ammotype
arguments.description: The ammunition type. Can be either <page>number</page> ammo ID or <page>string</page> ammo name.

returnValues.description: The amount of ammo player has in reserve.

functions.name: GetAvoidPlayers
functions.description: Gets if the player will be pushed out of nocollided players.

returnValues.description: pushed

functions.name: GetCanWalk
functions.description: Returns true if the player is able to walk using the (default) alt key.

returnValues.description: AbleToWalk

functions.name: GetCanZoom
functions.description: Determines whenever the player is allowed to use the zoom functionality.

returnValues.description: canZoom

functions.name: GetClassID
functions.description: Returns the player's class id.

returnValues.description: The player's class id.

functions.name: GetCount
functions.description: Gets total count of entities of same class.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Entity type to get count of.

arguments.name: minus
arguments.description: If specified, it will reduce the counter by this value. Works only serverside.

functions.name: GetCrouchedWalkSpeed
functions.description:
Returns the crouched walk speed multiplier.

See also <page>Player:GetWalkSpeed</page> and <page>Player:SetCrouchedWalkSpeed</page>.

returnValues.description: The crouched walk speed multiplier.

functions.name: GetCurrentCommand
functions.description:
Returns the last command which was sent by the specified player. This can only be called on the player which <page>Global.GetPredictionPlayer</page>() returns.

<note>When called clientside in singleplayer during <page>WEAPON:Think</page>, it will return nothing as the hook is not technically predicted in that instance. See the note on the page.</note>

<bug issue="3302">This will fail in <page>GM:StartCommand</page>.</bug>

returnValues.description: Last user commands

functions.name: GetCurrentViewOffset
functions.description:
Gets the **actual** view offset which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view when standing.

Do not confuse with <page>Player:GetViewOffset</page> and <page>Player:GetViewOffsetDucked</page>

returnValues.description: The actual view offset.

functions.name: GetDrivingEntity
functions.description: Gets the entity the player is currently driving.

returnValues.description: DriveEntity

functions.name: GetDrivingMode
functions.description: Returns driving mode of the player. See <page>Entity Driving</page>.

returnValues.description: The drive mode ID or 0 if player doesn't use the drive system.

functions.name: GetDuckSpeed
functions.description: Returns a player's duck speed (in seconds)

returnValues.description: duckspeed

functions.name: GetEntityInUse
functions.description: Returns the entity the player is currently using, like func_tank mounted turrets or +use prop pickups.

returnValues.description: Entity in use, or NULL entity otherwise. For +use prop pickups, this will be NULL clientside.

functions.name: GetEyeTrace
functions.description:
Returns a table with information of what the player is looking at.

The results of this function are cached every frame.

See also <page>Player:GetEyeTraceNoCursor</page>

returnValues.description: Trace information, see <page>Structures/TraceResult</page>

functions.name: GetEyeTraceNoCursor
functions.description:
Returns the trace according to the players view direction, ignoring their mouse ( Holding C and moving the mouse in Sandbox ).

The results of this function are cached every frame.

See also <page>Player:GetEyeTrace</page>

returnValues.description: Trace result. See <page>Structures/TraceResult</page>

functions.name: GetFOV
functions.description: Returns the FOV of the player.

returnValues.description: Field of view as a float

functions.name: GetFriendStatus
functions.description: Returns the steam "relationship" towards the player.

returnValues.description: Should return one of four different things depending on their status on your friends list: "friend", "blocked", "none" or "requested".

functions.name: GetHands
functions.description: Gets the hands entity of a player

returnValues.description: The hands entity if players has one

functions.name: GetHoveredWidget
functions.description: Returns the widget the player is hovering with his mouse.

returnValues.description: The hovered widget.

functions.name: GetHull
functions.description: Gets the bottom base and the top base size of the player's hull.

returnValues.description: Player's hull bottom base size
Player's hull top base size

functions.name: GetHullDuck
functions.description: Gets the bottom base and the top base size of the player's crouch hull.

returnValues.description: Player's crouch hull bottom base size
Player's crouch hull top base size

functions.name: GetInfo
functions.description:
Retrieves the value of a client-side <page>ConVar</page>. The <page>ConVar</page> must have a <page text="FCVAR_USERINFO">Enums/FCVAR</page> flag for this to work.

<warning>The returned value is truncated to 31 bytes.</warning>

arguments.name: cVarName
arguments.description: The name of the client-side <page>ConVar</page>

returnValues.description: The value of the <page>ConVar</page>

functions.name: GetInfoNum
functions.description: Retrieves the numeric value of a client-side convar, returns nil if value is not convertible to a number. The <page>ConVar</page> must have a <page text="FCVAR_USERINFO">Enums/FCVAR</page> flag for this to work.

arguments.name: cVarName
arguments.description: The name of the <page>ConVar</page> to query the value of

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: Default value if we failed to retrieve the number.

returnValues.description: The value of the <page>ConVar</page> or the default value

functions.name: GetJumpPower
functions.description: Returns the jump power of the player

returnValues.description: Jump power

functions.name: GetLadderClimbSpeed
functions.description:
Returns the player's ladder climbing speed.

See <page>Player:GetWalkSpeed</page> for normal walking speed, <page>Player:GetRunSpeed</page> for sprinting speed and <page>Player:GetSlowWalkSpeed</page> for slow walking speed.

returnValues.name: speed
returnValues.description: The ladder climbing speed.

functions.name: GetLaggedMovementValue
functions.description: Returns the timescale multiplier of the player movement.

returnValues.description: The timescale multiplier, defaults to 1.

functions.name: GetMaxSpeed
functions.description:
Returns the player's maximum movement speed.

See also <page>Player:SetMaxSpeed</page>, <page>Player:GetWalkSpeed</page> and <page>Player:GetRunSpeed</page>.

returnValues.description: The maximum movement speed the player can go at.

functions.name: GetName
functions.description:
Returns the player's name, this is an alias of <page>Player:Nick</page>.

<note>This function overrides <page>Entity:GetName</page> (in the Lua metatable, not in c++), keep it in mind when dealing with <page>ents.FindByName</page> or any engine function which requires the mapping name.</note>

returnValues.description:
The player's name.

<bug issue="3178">This is limited to 31 characters even though Steam names can have 32.</bug>

functions.name: GetNoCollideWithTeammates
functions.description: Returns whenever the player is set not to collide with their teammates.

returnValues.description: noCollideWithTeammates

functions.name: GetObserverMode
functions.description: Returns the the observer mode of the player

returnValues.description: Observe mode of that player, see <page>Enums/OBS_MODE</page>.

functions.name: GetObserverTarget
functions.description:
Returns the entity the player is currently observing.

Set using <page>Player:SpectateEntity</page>.

returnValues.description: The entity the player is currently spectating, or <page text="NULL">Global_Variables</page> if the player has no target.

functions.name: GetPData
functions.description:
Returns a **P**layer **Data** key-value pair from the SQL database. (sv.db when called on server,  cl.db when called on client)

Internally uses the <page>sql</page>.

<warning>This function internally uses <page>Player:UniqueID</page>, which can cause collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry). It's recommended that you don't use it. See the related wiki page for more information.</warning>

<note>PData is not networked from servers to clients!</note>

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Name of the PData key

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: Default value if PData key doesn't exist.

returnValues.description: The data in the SQL database or the default value given.

functions.name: GetPlayerColor
functions.description: Returns a player model's color. The part of the model that is colored is determined by the model itself, and is different for each model. The format is Vector(r,g,b), and each color should be between 0 and 1.

returnValues.description: color

functions.name: GetPlayerInfo
functions.description: Returns a table containing player information.

returnValues.description: A table containing player information.

functions.name: GetPreferredCarryAngles
functions.description:
Returns the preferred carry angles of an object, if any are set.

Calls <page>GM:GetPreferredCarryAngles</page> with the target entity and returns the carry angles.

arguments.name: carryEnt
arguments.description: Entity to retrieve the carry angles of.

returnValues.description: Carry angles or nil if the entity has no preferred carry angles.

functions.name: GetPressedWidget
functions.description:
Returns the widget entity the player is using.

Having a pressed widget stops the player from firing his weapon to allow input to be passed onto the widget.

returnValues.description: The pressed widget.

functions.name: GetPreviousWeapon
functions.description: Returns the weapon the player previously had equipped.

returnValues.description:
The previous weapon of the player.

<warning>This is not guaranteed to be a weapon entity so it should be checked with <page>Entity:IsWeapon</page> for safety.</warning>

functions.name: GetPunchAngle
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should use <page>Player:GetViewPunchAngles</page> instead.</deprecated>
Returns players screen punch effect angle.

returnValues.description: The punch angle

functions.name: GetRagdollEntity
functions.description: Returns players death ragdoll. The ragdoll is created by <page>Player:CreateRagdoll</page>.

returnValues.description:
The ragdoll.

Unlike normal clientside ragdolls (C_ClientRagdoll), this will be a C_HL2MPRagdoll on the client, and hl2mp_ragdoll on the server.

functions.name: GetRenderAngles
functions.description: Returns the render angles for the player.

returnValues.description: The render angles of the player. Only **yaw** part of the angle seems to be present.

functions.name: GetRunSpeed
functions.description:
Returns the player's sprint speed.

See also <page>Player:SetRunSpeed</page>, <page>Player:GetWalkSpeed</page> and <page>Player:GetMaxSpeed</page>.

returnValues.description: The sprint speed

functions.name: GetShootPos
functions.description:
Returns the position of a Player's view

<note>This is the same as calling <page>Entity:EyePos</page> on the player.</note>

returnValues.description: aim pos

functions.name: GetSlowWalkSpeed
functions.description:
Returns the player's slow walking speed, which is activated via `+walk` keybind.

See <page>Player:GetWalkSpeed</page> for normal walking speed, <page>Player:GetRunSpeed</page> for sprinting speed and <page>Player:GetLadderClimbSpeed</page> for ladder climb speed.

returnValues.name: speed
returnValues.description: The new slow walking speed.

functions.name: GetStepSize
functions.description: Returns the maximum height player can step onto.

returnValues.description: The maximum height player can get up onto without jumping, in hammer units.

functions.name: GetSuitPower
functions.description:
Returns the player's HEV suit power.

<bug issue="3449">This will only work for the local player when used clientside.</bug>

returnValues.description: The current suit power.

functions.name: GetTimeoutSeconds
functions.description: Returns the number of seconds that the player has been timing out for. You can check if a player is timing out with <page>Player:IsTimingOut</page>.

returnValues.description: Timeout seconds.

functions.name: GetTool
functions.description: Returns TOOL table of players current tool, or of the one specified.

arguments.name: mode
arguments.description: Classname of the tool to retrieve. ( Filename of the tool in gmod_tool/stools/ )

returnValues.description: TOOL table, or nil if the table wasn't found or the player doesn't have a tool gun.

functions.name: GetUnDuckSpeed
functions.description: Returns a player's unduck speed (in seconds)

returnValues.description: unduck speed

functions.name: GetUserGroup
functions.description: Returns the player's user group.

returnValues.description: The user group of the player. This will return "user" if player has no user group.

functions.name: GetVehicle
functions.description: Gets the vehicle the player is driving, returns NULL ENTITY if the player is not driving.

returnValues.description: vehicle

functions.name: GetViewEntity
functions.description: Returns the entity the player is using to see from (such as the player itself, the camera, or another entity).

returnValues.description: The entity the player is using to see from

functions.name: GetViewModel
functions.description:
Returns the player's view model entity by the index.
Each player has 3 view models by default, but only the first one is used.

To use the other viewmodels in your SWEP, see <page>Entity:SetWeaponModel</page>.

<note>In the Client <page text="realm">States</page>, other players' viewmodels are not available unless they are being spectated.</note>

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: optional index of the view model to return, can range from 0 to 2

returnValues.description: The view model entity

functions.name: GetViewOffset
functions.description:
Returns the view offset of the player which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view.

See also <page>Player:GetViewOffsetDucked</page>.

returnValues.description: New view offset, must be local vector to players <page>Entity:GetPos</page>

functions.name: GetViewOffsetDucked
functions.description:
Returns the view offset of the player which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view when ducked.

See also <page>Player:GetViewOffset</page>.

returnValues.description: New crouching view offset, must be local vector to players <page>Entity:GetPos</page>

functions.name: GetViewPunchAngles
functions.description: Returns players screen punch effect angle.

returnValues.description: The punch angle

functions.name: GetWalkSpeed
functions.description:
Returns the player's normal walking speed. Not sprinting, not slow walking. (+walk)

See also <page>Player:SetWalkSpeed</page>, <page>Player:GetMaxSpeed</page> and <page>Player:GetRunSpeed</page>.

returnValues.description: The normal walking speed.

functions.name: GetWeapon
functions.description: Returns the weapon for the specified class

arguments.name: className
arguments.description: Class name of weapon

returnValues.description: The weapon for the specified class.

functions.name: GetWeaponColor
functions.description: Returns a player's weapon color. The part of the model that is colored is determined by the model itself, and is different for each model. The format is Vector(r,g,b), and each color should be between 0 and 1.

returnValues.description: color

functions.name: GetWeapons
functions.description: Returns a table of the player's weapons.

returnValues.description: All the weapons the player currently has.

functions.name: Give
functions.description:
Gives the player a weapon.

<note>While this function is meant for weapons/pickupables only, it is **not** restricted to weapons. Any entity can be spawned using this function, including NPCs and SENTs.</note>

arguments.name: weaponClassName
arguments.description: Class name of weapon to give the player

arguments.name: bNoAmmo
arguments.description: Set to true to not give any ammo on weapon spawn. (Reserve ammo set by DefaultClip)

returnValues.description: The weapon given to the player, if one was given. It will return NULL if the player already has the weapon, or the weapon entity (entity with given classname) doesn't exist.

functions.name: GiveAmmo
functions.description: Gives ammo to a player

arguments.name: amount
arguments.description: Amount of ammo

arguments.name: type
arguments.description:
Type of ammo.

This can also be a number for ammo ID, useful for custom ammo types.

You can find a list of default ammo types <page text="here">Default_Ammo_Types</page>.

arguments.name: hidePopup
arguments.description: Hide display popup when giving the ammo

returnValues.description: Ammo given.

functions.name: GodDisable
functions.description: Disables god mode on the player.

functions.name: GodEnable
functions.description: Enables god mode on the player.

functions.name: HasGodMode
functions.description:
Returns whether the player has god mode or not, contolled by <page>Player:GodEnable</page> and <page>Player:GodDisable</page>.

<bug issue="2038">This is not synced between the client and server. This will cause the client to always return false even in godmode.</bug>

returnValues.description: Whether the player has god mode or not.

functions.name: HasWeapon
functions.description: Returns if the player has the specified weapon

arguments.name: className
arguments.description: Class name of the weapon

returnValues.description: True if the player has the weapon

functions.name: InVehicle
functions.description: Returns if the player is in a vehicle

returnValues.description: Whether the player is in a vehicle.

functions.name: IPAddress
functions.description: Returns the player's IP address and connection port in ip:port form

returnValues.description: The player's IP address and connection port

functions.name: IsAdmin
functions.description: Returns whether the player is an admin or not

returnValues.description: True if the player is an admin

functions.name: IsBot
functions.description: Returns if the player is an bot or not

returnValues.description: True if the player is a bot.

functions.name: IsConnected
functions.description: Returns true from the point when the player is sending client info but not fully in the game until they disconnect.

returnValues.description: isConnected

functions.name: IsDrivingEntity
functions.description: Used to find out if a player is currently 'driving' an entity (by which we mean 'right click > drive' ).

returnValues.description: A value representing whether or not the player is 'driving' an entity.

functions.name: IsFrozen
functions.description: Returns whether the players movement is currently frozen, contolled by <page>Player:Freeze</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the players movement is currently frozen or not.

functions.name: IsFullyAuthenticated
functions.description: Returns whether the player identity was confirmed by the steam network.

returnValues.description:
