Whether the player has been fully authenticated or not.

This will always be true for singleplayer and the listen server host.
This will always be false for bots.

functions.name: IsListenServerHost
functions.description: Returns if a player is the host of the current session.

returnValues.description:
True if the player is the listen server host, false otherwise.

This will always be true in single player, and false on a dedicated server.

functions.name: IsMuted
functions.description: Returns whether or not the player is muted locally.

returnValues.description: whether or not the player is muted locally.

functions.name: IsPlayingTaunt
functions.description: Returns true if the player is playing a taunt.

returnValues.description: Whether the player is playing a taunt.

functions.name: IsSpeaking
functions.description: Returns whenever the player is heard by the local player.

returnValues.description: isSpeaking

functions.name: IsSprinting
functions.description: Returns whether the player is currently sprinting or not.

returnValues.description: Is the player sprinting or not

functions.name: IsSuitEquipped
functions.description:
Returns whenever the player is equipped with the suit item.

<bug issue="3449">This will only work for the local player when used clientside.</bug>

returnValues.description: Is the suit equipped or not.

functions.name: IsSuperAdmin
functions.description: Returns whether the player is a superadmin.

returnValues.description: True if the player is a superadmin.

functions.name: IsTimingOut
functions.description: Returns true if the player is timing out (i.e. is losing connection), false otherwise.

returnValues.description: isTimingOut

functions.name: IsTyping
functions.description:
Returns whether the player is typing in their chat.

This may not work properly if the server uses a custom chatbox.

returnValues.description: Whether the player is typing in their chat or not.

functions.name: IsUserGroup
functions.description: Returns true/false if the player is in specified group or not.

arguments.name: groupname
arguments.description: Group to check the player for.

returnValues.description: isInUserGroup

functions.name: IsVoiceAudible
functions.description: Returns if the player can be heard by the local player.

returnValues.description: isAudible

functions.name: IsWorldClicking
functions.description:
Returns if the player is in the context menu.

<note>Although this is shared, it will only work properly on the CLIENT for the local player. Using this serverside or on other players will return false.</note>

returnValues.description: Is the player world clicking or not.

functions.name: KeyDown
functions.description: Gets whether a key is down. This is not networked to other players, meaning only the local client can see the keys they are pressing.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

returnValues.description: isDown

functions.name: KeyDownLast
functions.description: Gets whether a key was down one tick ago.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

returnValues.description: Is key down

functions.name: KeyPressed
functions.description: Gets whether a key was just pressed this tick

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Corresponds to an <page>Enums/IN</page>

returnValues.description: Was pressed or not

functions.name: KeyReleased
functions.description: Gets whether a key was just released this tick

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

returnValues.description: Was released or not

functions.name: Kick
functions.description:
Kicks the player from the server.
<note>This can not be run before the player has fully joined in. Use <page>game.KickID</page> for that.</note>

arguments.name: reason
arguments.description:
Reason to show for disconnection.

<warning>This will be shortened to ~512 chars, though this includes the command itself and the player index so will realistically be more around ~498. It is recommended to avoid going near the limit to avoid truncation.</warning>

functions.name: Kill
functions.description: Kills a player and calls <page>GM:PlayerDeath</page>.

functions.name: KillSilent
functions.description:
Kills a player without notifying the rest of the server.

This will call <page>GM:PlayerSilentDeath</page> instead of <page>GM:PlayerDeath</page>.

functions.name: LagCompensation
functions.description:
This allows the server to mitigate the lag of the player by moving back all the entities that can be lag compensated to the time the player attacked with his weapon.

This technique is most commonly used on things that hit other entities instantaneously, such as traces.

<note><page>Entity:FireBullets</page> calls this function internally.</note>

Lag compensation only works for players and entities that have been enabled with <page>Entity:SetLagCompensated</page>

Despite being defined shared, it can only be used server-side in a <page text="Predicted Hook">~search:%3Cpredicted%3EYes</page>.

<warning>This function NEEDS to be disabled after you're done with it or it will break the movement of the entities affected!</warning>

<bug issue="3683">Lag compensation does not support pose parameters.</bug>

arguments.name: lagCompensation
arguments.description: The state of the lag compensation, true to enable and false to disable.

functions.name: LastHitGroup
functions.description: Returns the hitgroup where the player was last hit.

returnValues.description: Hitgroup, see <page>Enums/HITGROUP</page>

functions.name: LimitHit
functions.description:
Shows "limit hit" notification in sandbox.


<note>This function is only available in Sandbox and its derivatives</note>

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Type of hit limit

functions.name: Lock
functions.description:
Stops a player from using any inputs, such as moving, turning, or attacking. Key binds are still called. Similar to <page>Player:Freeze</page> but the player takes no damage.

Adds the <page text="FL_FROZEN">Enums/FL</page> and <page text="FL_GODMODE">Enums/FL</page> flags to the player.

<bug>Frozen bots will still be able to look around.</bug>

functions.name: MotionSensorPos
functions.description: Returns the position of a Kinect bone.

arguments.name: bone
arguments.description: Bone to get the position of. Must be from 0 to 19.

returnValues.description: Position of the bone.

functions.name: Name
functions.description: Returns the players name. Identical to <page>Player:Nick</page> and <page>Player:GetName</page>.

returnValues.description:
Player's Steam name.

<bug issue="3178">This is limited to 31 characters even though Steam names can have 32.</bug>

functions.name: Nick
functions.description: Returns the player's nickname.

returnValues.description:
Player's Steam name

<bug issue="3178">This is limited to 31 characters even though Steam names can have 32.</bug>

functions.name: PacketLoss
functions.description: Returns the packet loss of the client. It is not networked so it only returns 0 when run clientside.

returnValues.description: Packets lost

functions.name: PhysgunUnfreeze
functions.description: Unfreezes the props player is looking at. This is essentially the same as pressing reload with the physics gun, including double press for unfreeze all.

returnValues.description: Number of props unfrozen.

functions.name: PickupObject
functions.description:
This makes the player hold ( same as pressing <key>E</key> on a small prop ) the provided entity.

<note>Don't get this confused with picking up items like ammo or health kits</note>

<note>This picks up the passed entity regardless of its mass or distance from the player</note>

arguments.name: entity
arguments.description: Entity to pick up.

functions.name: Ping
functions.description: Returns the player's ping to server.

returnValues.description: The player's ping.

functions.name: PlayStepSound
functions.description: Plays the correct step sound according to what the player is staying on.

arguments.name: volume
arguments.description: Volume for the sound, in range from 0 to 1

functions.name: PrintMessage
functions.description:
Displays a message either in their chat, console, or center of the screen. See also <page>Global.PrintMessage</page>.

<note>When called serverside, this uses the archaic user message system (the <page>umsg</page>) and hence is limited to 250 characters.</note>

<note>`HUD_PRINTCENTER` will not work when this is called clientside.</note>

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Which type of message should be sent to the player (<page>Enums/HUD</page>)

arguments.name: message
arguments.description: Message to be sent to the player

functions.name: RemoveAllAmmo
functions.description: Removes all ammo from a certain player

functions.name: RemoveAllItems
functions.description: Removes all weapons and ammo from the player.

functions.name: RemoveAmmo
functions.description: Removes the amount of the specified ammo from the player.

arguments.name: ammoCount
arguments.description: The amount of ammunition to remove.

arguments.name: ammoName
arguments.description: The name of the ammunition to remove from. This can also be a <page>number</page> ammoID.

functions.name: RemovePData
functions.description:
Removes a **P**layer **Data** key-value pair from the SQL database. (sv.db when called on server,  cl.db when called on client)

Internally uses the <page>sql</page>.

<warning>This function internally uses <page>Player:UniqueID</page>, which can cause collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry). It's recommended that you don't use it. See the related wiki page for more information.</warning>

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Key to remove

returnValues.description: true is succeeded, false otherwise

functions.name: RemoveSuit
functions.description: Strips the player's suit item.

functions.name: ResetHull
functions.description: Resets both normal and duck hulls to their default values.

functions.name: Say
functions.description:
Forces the player to say whatever the first argument is. Works on bots too.

<note>This function ignores the default chat message cooldown</note>

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: The text to force the player to say.

arguments.name: teamOnly
arguments.description: Whether to send this message to our own team only.

functions.name: ScreenFade
functions.description: Fades the screen

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: Fade flags defined with <page>Enums/SCREENFADE</page>.

arguments.name: clr
arguments.description: The color of the screenfade

arguments.name: fadeTime
arguments.description: Fade(in/out) effect transition time ( From no fade to full fade and vice versa )

arguments.name: fadeHold
arguments.description: Fade effect hold time

functions.name: SelectWeapon
functions.description:
Sets the active weapon of the player by its class name.

<warning>This will switch the weapon out of prediction, causing delay on the client and <page>WEAPON:Deploy</page> and <page>WEAPON:Holster</page> to be called out of prediction. Try using <page>CUserCmd:SelectWeapon</page> or <page>input.SelectWeapon</page>, instead.</warning>

<note>This will trigger the weapon switch event and associated animations. To switch weapons silently, use <page>Player:SetActiveWeapon</page>.</note>

arguments.name: className
arguments.description:
The class name of the weapon to switch to.

If the player doesn't have the specified weapon, nothing will happen. You can use <page>Player:Give</page> to give the weapon first.

functions.name: SendHint
functions.description:
Sends a hint to a player.

<note>This function is only available in Sandbox and its derivatives. Since this adds `#Hint_` to the beginning of each message, you should only use it with default hint messages, or those cached with <page>language.Add</page>. For hints with custom text, look at <page>notification.AddLegacy</page></note>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name/class/index of the hint. The text of the hint will contain this value. ( "#Hint_" .. name ) An example is `PhysgunFreeze`.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: Delay in seconds before showing the hint

functions.name: SendLua
functions.description:
Executes a simple Lua string on the player.
<note>If you need to use this function more than once consider using <page>net</page> library. Send net message and make the entire code you want to execute in <page>net.Receive</page> on client.</note>

<note>The string is limited to 254 bytes. Consider using the <page text="net library">Net_Library_Usage</page> for more advanced server-client interaction.</note>

arguments.name: script
arguments.description: The script to execute.

functions.name: SetActiveWeapon
functions.description:
Sets the player's active weapon. You should use <page>CUserCmd:SelectWeapon</page> or <page>Player:SelectWeapon</page>, instead in most cases.

<note>This function will not trigger the weapon switch event or associated equip animations. You can achieve this using <page>Player:SelectWeapon</page> with <page>Entity:GetClass</page>.</note>

<note>This will not call <page>GM:PlayerSwitchWeapon</page>.</note>

arguments.name: weapon
arguments.description: The weapon to equip.

functions.name: SetAllowFullRotation
functions.description: Set if the players' model is allowed to rotate around the pitch and roll axis.

arguments.name: Allowed
arguments.description: Allowed to rotate

functions.name: SetAllowWeaponsInVehicle
functions.description:
Allows player to use his weapons in a vehicle. You need to call this before entering a vehicle.

<bug issue="1277">Shooting in a vehicle fires two bullets.</bug>

<bug issue="3261">Weapon viewpunch does not decay while in a vehicle, leading to incorrect aim angles.</bug>

arguments.name: allow
arguments.description: Show we allow player to use his weapons in a vehicle or not.

functions.name: SetAmmo
functions.description: Sets the amount of the specified ammo for the player.

arguments.name: ammoCount
arguments.description: The amount of ammunition to set.

arguments.name: ammoType
arguments.description: The ammunition type. Can be either <page>number</page> ammo ID or <page>string</page> ammo name.

functions.name: SetArmor
functions.description: Sets the player armor to the argument.

arguments.name: Amount
arguments.description: The amount that the player armor is going to be set to.

functions.name: SetAvoidPlayers
functions.description: Pushes the player away from another player whenever it's inside the other players bounding box.

arguments.name: avoidPlayers
arguments.description: Avoid or not avoid.

functions.name: SetCanWalk
functions.description: Set if the player should be allowed to walk using the (default) alt key.

arguments.name: abletowalk
arguments.description: True allows the player to walk.

functions.name: SetCanZoom
functions.description: Sets whether the player can use the HL2 suit zoom ("+zoom" bind) or not.

arguments.name: canZoom
arguments.description: Whether to make the player able or unable to zoom.

functions.name: SetClassID
functions.description: Sets the player's class id.

arguments.name: classID
arguments.description: The class id the player is being set with.

functions.name: SetCrouchedWalkSpeed
functions.description:
Sets the crouched walk speed multiplier.

Doesn't work for values above 1.

See also <page>Player:SetWalkSpeed</page> and <page>Player:GetCrouchedWalkSpeed</page>.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: The walk speed multiplier that crouch speed should be.

functions.name: SetCurrentViewOffset
functions.description:
Sets the **actual** view offset which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view when standing.

Do not confuse with <page>Player:SetViewOffset</page> and <page>Player:SetViewOffsetDucked</page>

arguments.name: viewOffset
arguments.description: The new view offset.

functions.name: SetDeaths
functions.description: Sets a player's death count

arguments.name: deathcount
arguments.description: Number of deaths (positive or negative)

functions.name: SetDrivingEntity
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Sets the driving entity and driving mode.

Use <page>drive.PlayerStartDriving</page> instead, see <page>Entity Driving</page>.

arguments.name: drivingEntity
arguments.description: The entity the player should drive.

arguments.name: drivingMode
arguments.description: The driving mode index.

functions.name: SetDSP
functions.description: Applies the specified sound filter to the player.

arguments.name: soundFilter
arguments.description:
The index of the sound filter to apply.
Pick from the [list of DSP's](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dsp_presets).

arguments.name: fastReset
arguments.description: If set to true the sound filter will be removed faster.

functions.name: SetDuckSpeed
functions.description:
Sets how quickly a player ducks.

<bug issue="2722">This will not work for values >= 1.</bug>

arguments.name: duckSpeed
arguments.description: How quickly the player will duck.

functions.name: SetEyeAngles
functions.description: Sets the angle of the player's view (may rotate body too if angular difference is large)

arguments.name: angle
arguments.description: Angle to set the view to

functions.name: SetFOV
functions.description: Set a player's FOV (Field Of View) over a certain amount of time.

arguments.name: fov
arguments.description: the angle of perception (FOV). Set to 0 to return to default user FOV. ( Which is ranging from 75 to 90, depending on user settings )

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: the time it takes to transition to the FOV expressed in a floating point.

arguments.name: requester
arguments.description: The requester or "owner" of the zoom event.

functions.name: SetFrags
functions.description: Sets a player's frags (kills)

arguments.name: fragcount
arguments.description: Number of frags (positive or negative)

functions.name: SetHands
functions.description:
Sets the hands entity of a player.

The hands entity is an entity introduced in Garry's Mod 13 and it's used to show the player's hands attached to the viewmodel.
This is similar to the approach used in L4D and CS:GO, for more information on how to implement this system in your gamemode visit <page>Using Viewmodel Hands</page>.

arguments.name: hands
arguments.description: The hands entity to set

functions.name: SetHoveredWidget
functions.description: Sets the widget that is currently hovered by the player's mouse.

arguments.name: widget
arguments.description: The widget entity that the player is hovering.

functions.name: SetHull
functions.description:
Sets the mins and maxs of the AABB of the players collision.

<bug issue="3365">Setting both the mins and maxs to <page>Global.Vector</page>(0,0,0) will crash the game.</bug>

arguments.name: hullMins
arguments.description: The min coordinates of the hull.

arguments.name: hullMaxs
arguments.description: The max coordinates of the hull.

functions.name: SetHullDuck
functions.description: Sets the mins and maxs of the AABB of the players collision when ducked.

arguments.name: hullMins
arguments.description: The min coordinates of the hull.

arguments.name: hullMaxs
arguments.description: The max coordinates of the hull.

functions.name: SetJumpPower
functions.description: Sets the jump power, eg. the velocity the player will applied to when he jumps.

arguments.name: jumpPower
arguments.description: The new jump velocity.

functions.name: SetLadderClimbSpeed
functions.description:
Sets the player's ladder climbing speed.

See <page>Player:SetWalkSpeed</page> for normal walking speed, <page>Player:SetRunSpeed</page> for sprinting speed and <page>Player:SetSlowWalkSpeed</page> for slow walking speed.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: The ladder climbing speed.

functions.name: SetLaggedMovementValue
functions.description:
Slows down the player movement simulation by the timescale, this is used internally in the HL2 weapon stripping sequence.

It achieves such behavior by multiplying the <page>Global.FrameTime</page> by the specified timescale at the start of the movement simulation and then restoring it afterwards.

<note>This is reset to 1 on spawn</note>

<note>There is no weapon counterpart to this, you'll have to hardcode the multiplier in the weapon or call <page>Weapon:SetNextPrimaryFire</page> / <page>Weapon:SetNextSecondaryFire</page> manually from a</note>

arguments.name: timescale
arguments.description: The timescale multiplier.

functions.name: SetLastHitGroup
functions.description: Sets the hitgroup where the player was last hit.

arguments.name: hitgroup
arguments.description: The hitgroup to set as the "last hit", see <page>Enums/HITGROUP</page>

functions.name: SetMaxSpeed
functions.description:
Sets the maximum speed which the player can move at.

<note>This is called automatically by the engine. If you wish to limit player speed without setting their run/sprint speeds, see <page>CMoveData:SetMaxClientSpeed</page>.</note>

arguments.name: walkSpeed
arguments.description: The maximum speed.

functions.name: SetMuted
functions.description: Sets if the player should be muted locally.

arguments.name: mute
arguments.description: Mute or unmute.

functions.name: SetNoCollideWithTeammates
functions.description:
Sets whenever the player should not collide with their teammates.

<bug issue="2757">This only works with <page>Player:Team</page> IDs 1-4. This also has major collision issues.</bug>

arguments.name: shouldNotCollide
arguments.description: True to disable, false to enable collision.

functions.name: SetNoTarget
functions.description:
Sets the players visibility towards NPCs.

Internally this toggles the <page text="FL_NOTARGET">Enums/FL</page> flag, which you can manually test for using <page>Entity:IsFlagSet</page>

arguments.name: visibility
arguments.description: The visibility.

functions.name: SetObserverMode
functions.description: Sets the players observer mode. You must start the spectating first with <page>Player:Spectate</page>.

arguments.name: mode
arguments.description: Spectator mode using <page>Enums/OBS_MODE</page>.

functions.name: SetPData
functions.description:
Writes a **P**layer **Data** key-value pair to the SQL database. (sv.db when called on server,  cl.db when called on client)

Internally uses the <page>sql</page>.

<warning>This function internally uses <page>Player:UniqueID</page>, which can cause collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry). It's recommended that you don't use it. See the related wiki page for more information.</warning>

<note>PData is not networked from servers to clients!</note>

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Name of the PData key

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to write to the key (**must** be an SQL valid data type, such as a string or integer)

returnValues.description: Whether the operation was successful or not

functions.name: SetPlayerColor
functions.description: Sets the player model's color. The part of the model that is colored is determined by the model itself, and is different for each model.

arguments.name: Color
arguments.description: This is the color to be set. The format is Vector(r,g,b), and each color should be between 0 and 1.

functions.name: SetPressedWidget
functions.description:
Sets the widget that is currently in use by the player's mouse.

Having a pressed widget stops the player from firing his weapon to allow input to be passed onto the widget.

arguments.name: pressedWidget
arguments.description: The widget the player is currently using.

functions.name: SetRenderAngles
functions.description: Sets the render angles of a player.

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The new render angles to set

functions.name: SetRunSpeed
functions.description:
Sets the player's sprint speed.

See also <page>Player:GetRunSpeed</page>, <page>Player:SetWalkSpeed</page> and <page>Player:SetMaxSpeed</page>.

arguments.name: runSpeed
arguments.description:
The new sprint speed when sv_friction is below 10. Higher sv_friction values will result in slower speed.

Has to be 7 or above or the player won't be able to move.

functions.name: SetSlowWalkSpeed
functions.description:
Sets the player's slow walking speed, which is activated via `+walk` keybind.

See <page>Player:SetWalkSpeed</page> for normal walking speed, <page>Player:SetRunSpeed</page> for sprinting speed and <page>Player:SetLadderClimbSpeed</page> for ladder climb speed.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: The new slow walking speed.

functions.name: SetStepSize
functions.description: Sets the maximum height a player can step onto without jumping.

arguments.name: stepHeight
arguments.description: The new maximum height the player can step onto without jumping

functions.name: SetSuitPower
functions.description:
Sets the player's HEV suit power.

<bug issue="3449">This will only work for the local player when used clientside.</bug>

arguments.name: power
arguments.description: The new suit power.

functions.name: SetSuppressPickupNotices
functions.description: Sets whenever to suppress the pickup notification for the player.

arguments.name: doSuppress
arguments.description: Whenever to suppress the notice or not.

functions.name: SetTeam
functions.description: Sets the player to the chosen team.

arguments.name: Team
arguments.description: The team that the player is being set to.

functions.name: SetUnDuckSpeed
functions.description: Sets how quickly a player un-ducks

arguments.name: UnDuckSpeed
arguments.description: How quickly the player will un-duck

functions.name: SetupHands
functions.description: Sets up the players view model hands. Calls <page>GM:PlayerSetHandsModel</page> to set the model of the hands.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: If the player is spectating an entity, this should be the entity the player is spectating, so we can use its hands model instead.

functions.name: SetUserGroup
functions.description: Sets the usergroup of the player.

arguments.name: groupName
arguments.description: The user group of the player.

functions.name: SetViewEntity
functions.description: Attaches the players view to the position and angles of the specified entity.

arguments.name: viewEntity
arguments.description: The entity to attach the player view to.

functions.name: SetViewOffset
functions.description:
Sets the **desired** view offset which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view when standing.

If you want to set **actual** view offset, use <page>Player:SetCurrentViewOffset</page>

See also <page>Player:SetViewOffsetDucked</page> for **desired** view offset when crouching.

arguments.name: viewOffset
arguments.description: The new desired view offset when standing.

functions.name: SetViewOffsetDucked
functions.description:
Sets the **desired** view offset which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view when crouching.

If you want to set **actual** view offset, use <page>Player:SetCurrentViewOffset</page>

See also <page>Player:SetViewOffset</page> for **desired** view offset when standing.

arguments.name: viewOffset
arguments.description: The new desired view offset when crouching.

functions.name: SetViewPunchAngles
functions.description: Sets client's view punch. See <page>Player:ViewPunch</page>

arguments.name: punchAngle
arguments.description: The angle to set.

functions.name: SetWalkSpeed
functions.description:
Sets the player's normal walking speed. Not sprinting, not slow walking <key>+walk</key>.

There currently is no way to modify the slow walking <key>+walk</key> speed.

See also <page>Player:GetWalkSpeed</page>, <page>Player:SetCrouchedWalkSpeed</page>, <page>Player:SetMaxSpeed</page> and <page>Player:SetRunSpeed</page>.

<bug issue="2030">Using a speed of 0 can lead to prediction errors.</bug>

arguments.name: walkSpeed
arguments.description:
The new walk speed when sv_friction is below 10. Higher sv_friction values will result in slower speed.

Has to be 7 or above or the player won't be able to move.

functions.name: SetWeaponColor
functions.description: Sets the player weapon's color. The part of the model that is colored is determined by the model itself, and is different for each model.

arguments.name: Color
arguments.description: This is the color to be set. The format is Vector(r,g,b), and each color should be between 0 and 1.

functions.name: ShouldDrawLocalPlayer
functions.description: Polls the engine to request if the player should be drawn at the time the function is called.

returnValues.description: shouldDraw

functions.name: ShouldDropWeapon
functions.description:
Sets whether the player's current weapon should drop on death.

<note>This is reset on spawn to the <page text="player class">Player_Classes</page>'s **DropWeaponOnDie** field by <page>player_manager.OnPlayerSpawn</page>.</note>

arguments.name: drop
arguments.description: Whether to drop the player's current weapon or not

functions.name: ShowProfile
functions.description: Opens the player steam profile page in the steam overlay browser.

functions.name: SimulateGravGunDrop
functions.description: Signals the entity that it was dropped by the gravity gun.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: Entity that was dropped.

functions.name: SimulateGravGunPickup
functions.description: Signals the entity that it was picked up by the gravity gun. This call is only required if you want to simulate the situation of picking up objects.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity picked up

functions.name: Spectate
functions.description: Starts spectate mode for given player. This will also affect the players movetype in some cases.

arguments.name: mode
arguments.description: Spectate mode, see <page>Enums/OBS_MODE</page>.

functions.name: SpectateEntity
functions.description:
Makes the player spectate the entity

To get the applied spectated entity, use <page>Player:GetObserverTarget</page>().

<bug issue="3267">The player's position will not update while spectating, causing area portals and other map optimisations to not work properly. You can fix this by setting the player's position to the spectated entity's each tick.</bug>

arguments.name: entity
arguments.description: Entity to spectate.

functions.name: SprayDecal
functions.description: Makes a player spray their decal.

arguments.name: sprayOrigin
arguments.description: The location to spray from

arguments.name: sprayEndPos
arguments.description: The location to spray to

functions.name: SprintDisable
functions.description:
Disables the sprint on the player.

<bug issue="2390">Not working - use <page>Player:SetRunSpeed</page> or <page>CMoveData:SetMaxSpeed</page> in a <page>GM:Move</page> hook, instead.</bug>

functions.name: SprintEnable
functions.description:
Enables the sprint on the player.

<bug issue="2390">Not working - use <page>Player:SetRunSpeed</page> or <page>CMoveData:SetMaxSpeed</page> in a <page>GM:Move</page> hook, instead.</bug>

functions.name: StartSprinting
functions.description:
<deprecated>This appears to be a direct binding to internal functionality that is overridden by the engine every frame so calling these functions may not have any or expected effect.</deprecated>

Doesn't appear to do anything.

functions.name: StartWalking
functions.description:
<deprecated>This appears to be a direct binding to internal functionality that is overridden by the engine every frame so calling these functions may not have any or expected effect.</deprecated>

When used in a <page>GM:SetupMove</page> hook, this function will force the player to walk, as well as preventing the player from sprinting.

functions.name: SteamID
functions.description:
Returns the player's SteamID. In singleplayer, this will be STEAM_ID_PENDING serverside.

For Bots this will return "BOT" on the server and on the client it returns "NULL".

Use <page>Player:AccountID</page> for a shorter version of the SteamID.

returnValues.description: SteamID

functions.name: SteamID64
functions.description:
Returns the player's 64-bit SteamID aka CommunityID.

<warning>In singleplayer, this will return no value serverside.</warning>

<note>In a multirun environment, this will return no value serverside for all "copies" of a player.</note>

<note>For bots, this will return 90071996842377216 (equivalent to STEAM_0:0:0) for the first bot to join.

For each additional bot, the number increases by 1. So the next bot will be 90071996842377217 (STEAM_0:1:0) then 90071996842377218 (STEAM_0:0:1) and so on.</note>

<note>On the client it returns no value for bots.</note>

Use <page>Player:AccountID</page> for a shorter version of the SteamID.

returnValues.description: Player's 64bit SteamID aka CommunityID.

functions.name: StopSprinting
functions.description:
<deprecated>This appears to be a direct binding to internal functionality that is overridden by the engine every frame so calling these functions may not have any or expected effect.</deprecated>

When used in a <page>GM:SetupMove</page> hook, this function will prevent the player from sprinting.

When +walk is engaged, the player will still be able to sprint to half speed (normal run speed) as opposed to full sprint speed without this function.

functions.name: StopWalking
functions.description:
<deprecated>This appears to be a direct binding to internal functionality that is overridden by the engine every frame so calling these functions may not have any or expected effect.</deprecated>

When used in a <page>GM:SetupMove</page> hook, this function behaves unexpectedly by preventing the player from sprinting similar to <page>Player:StopSprinting</page>.

functions.name: StopZooming
functions.description:
Turns off the zoom mode of the player. (+zoom console command)

Basically equivalent of entering "-zoom" into player's console.

functions.name: StripAmmo
functions.description: Removes all ammo from the player.

functions.name: StripWeapon
functions.description: Removes the specified weapon class from a certain player

arguments.name: weapon
arguments.description: The weapon class to remove

functions.name: StripWeapons
functions.description: Removes all weapons from a certain player

functions.name: SuppressHint
functions.description:
Prevents a hint from showing up.


<note>This function is only available in Sandbox and its derivatives</note>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Hint name/class/index to prevent from showing up

functions.name: SwitchToDefaultWeapon
functions.description:
Attempts to switch the player weapon to the one specified in the "cl_defaultweapon" convar, if the player does not own the specified weapon nothing will happen.

If you want to switch to a specific weapon, use: <page>Player:SetActiveWeapon</page>

functions.name: Team
functions.description:
Returns the player's team ID.

Returns 0 clientside when the game is not fully loaded.

returnValues.description: The player's team's index number, as in the <page>Enums/TEAM</page> or a custom team defined in <page>team.SetUp</page>.

functions.name: TimeConnected
functions.description:
Returns the time in seconds since the player connected.
<note>Bots will always return value 0.</note>

functions.name: TraceHullAttack
functions.description:
Performs a trace hull and applies damage to the entities hit, returns the first entity hit.

<warning>Hitting the victim entity with this function in <page>ENTITY:OnTakeDamage</page> can cause infinite loops.</warning>

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The start position of the hull trace.

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: The end position of the hull trace.

arguments.name: mins
arguments.description: The minimum coordinates of the hull.

arguments.name: maxs
arguments.description: The maximum coordinates of the hull.

arguments.name: damage
arguments.description: The damage to be applied.

arguments.name: damageFlags
arguments.description: Bitflag specifying the damage type, see <page>Enums/DMG</page>.

arguments.name: damageForce
arguments.description: The force to be applied to the hit object.

arguments.name: damageAllNPCs
arguments.description: Whether to apply damage to all hit NPCs or not.

returnValues.description: The hit entity

functions.name: TranslateWeaponActivity
functions.description: Translates <page>Enums/ACT</page> according to the holdtype of players currently held weapon.

arguments.name: act
arguments.description: The initial <page>Enums/ACT</page>

returnValues.description: Translated <page>Enums/ACT</page>

functions.name: UnfreezePhysicsObjects
functions.description: Unfreezes all objects the player has frozen with their Physics Gun. Same as double pressing R while holding Physics Gun.

functions.name: UniqueID
functions.description:
<warning>**This function has collisions,** where more than one player has the same UniqueID. It is **highly** recommended to use <page>Player:AccountID</page>, <page>Player:SteamID</page> or <page>Player:SteamID64</page> instead, which are guaranteed to be unique to each player.</warning>

Returns a 32 bit integer that remains constant for a player across joins/leaves and across different servers. This can be used when a string is inappropriate - e.g. in a database primary key.

<note>In Singleplayer, this function will always return 1.</note>

returnValues.description: The player's Unique ID

functions.name: UniqueIDTable
functions.description: Returns a table that will stay allocated for the specific player between connects until the server shuts down. Note, that this table is not synchronized between client and server.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Unique table key.

returnValues.description: The table that contains any info you have put in it.

functions.name: UnLock
functions.description:
Unlocks the player movement if locked previously.
Will disable godmode for the player if locked previously.

functions.name: UnSpectate
functions.description: Stops the player from spectating another entity.

functions.name: UserID
functions.description:
Returns the player's ID.
You can use <page>Global.Player</page>() to get the player by their ID.

returnValues.description: The player's user ID

functions.name: ViewPunch
functions.description: Simulates a push on the client's screen.

arguments.name: PunchAngle
arguments.description: The angle in which to push the player's screen.

functions.name: ViewPunchReset
functions.description: Resets the player's view punch ( <page>Player:ViewPunch</page> ) effect back to normal.

arguments.name: tolerance
arguments.description: Reset all ViewPunch below this threshold.

functions.name: VoiceVolume
functions.description: Returns the players voice volume, how loud the player's voice communication currently is, as a normal number. Doesn't work on local player unless the voice_loopback convar is set to 1.

returnValues.description: The voice volume.

name: ProjectedTexture
description: A client side projected texture, created by <page>Global.ProjectedTexture</page>.

functions.name: GetAngles
functions.description: Returns the angle of the ProjectedTexture, which were previously set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetAngles</page>

returnValues.description: The angles of the ProjectedTexture.

functions.name: GetBrightness
functions.description: Returns the brightness of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetBrightness</page>

returnValues.description: The brightness of the ProjectedTexture.

functions.name: GetColor
functions.description:
Returns the color of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetColor</page>.

<bug issue="2407">The returned color will not have the color metatable.</bug>

returnValues.description: <page>Color</page>, the color of the ProjectedTexture.

functions.name: GetConstantAttenuation
functions.description: Returns the constant attenuation of the projected texture, which can also be set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetConstantAttenuation</page>.

returnValues.description: The constant attenuation

functions.name: GetEnableShadows
functions.description: Returns whether shadows are enabled for this ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetEnableShadows</page>

returnValues.description: Whether shadows are enabled.

functions.name: GetFarZ
functions.description: Returns the projection distance of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetFarZ</page>

returnValues.description: The projection distance of the ProjectedTexture.

functions.name: GetHorizontalFOV
functions.description: Returns the horizontal FOV of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetHorizontalFOV</page> or <page>ProjectedTexture:SetFOV</page>

returnValues.description: The horizontal FOV of the ProjectedTexture.

functions.name: GetLinearAttenuation
functions.description: Returns the linear attenuation of the projected texture, which can also be set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetLinearAttenuation</page>.

returnValues.description: The linear attenuation.

functions.name: GetNearZ
functions.description: Returns the NearZ value of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetNearZ</page>

returnValues.description: NearZ of the ProjectedTexture.

functions.name: GetOrthographic
functions.description: Returns the current orthographic settings of the Projected Texture. To set these values, use <page>ProjectedTexture:SetOrthographic</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether or not this projected texture is orthographic. When false, nothing else is returned.
left
top
right
bottom

functions.name: GetPos
functions.description: Returns the position of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetPos</page>

returnValues.description: The position of the ProjectedTexture.

functions.name: GetQuadraticAttenuation
functions.description: Returns the quadratic attenuation of the projected texture, which can also be set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetQuadraticAttenuation</page>.

returnValues.description: The quadratic attenuation

functions.name: GetTexture
functions.description: Returns the texture of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetTexture</page>

returnValues.description: The texture of the ProjectedTexture.

functions.name: GetTextureFrame
functions.description: Returns the texture frame of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetTextureFrame</page>

returnValues.description: The texture frame.

functions.name: GetVerticalFOV
functions.description: Returns the vertical FOV of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by <page>ProjectedTexture:SetVerticalFOV</page> or <page>ProjectedTexture:SetFOV</page>

returnValues.description: The vertical FOV of the ProjectedTexture.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description:
Returns true if the projected texture is valid (i.e. has not been removed), false otherwise.

Instead of calling this directly it's a good idea to call <page>Global.IsValid</page> in case the variable is nil.


```
IsValid( ptexture )
```


This not only checks whether the projected texture is valid - but also checks whether it's nil.

returnValues.description: Whether the projected texture is valid.

functions.name: Remove
functions.description: Removes the projected texture. After calling this, <page>ProjectedTexture:IsValid</page> will return false, and any hooks with the projected texture as the identifier will be automatically deleted.

functions.name: SetAngles
functions.description:
Sets the angles (direction) of the projected texture.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

functions.name: SetBrightness
functions.description:
Sets the brightness of the projected texture.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

arguments.name: brightness
arguments.description: The brightness to give the projected texture.

functions.name: SetColor
functions.description:
Sets the color of the projected texture.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description:
Must be a <page>Color</page>.

Unlike other projected textures, this color can only go up to 255.

functions.name: SetConstantAttenuation
functions.description:
Sets the constant attenuation of the projected texture.

See also <page>ProjectedTexture:SetLinearAttenuation</page> and <page>ProjectedTexture:SetQuadraticAttenuation</page>.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

functions.name: SetEnableShadows
functions.description:
Enable or disable shadows cast from the projected texture. as with all types of projected textures (including the player's flashlight and env_projectedtexture), there can only be 8 projected textures with shadows enabled in total.
This limit can be increased with the launch parameter: -numshadowtextures limit
where limit is the new limit. Naturally, many projected lights with shadows enabled will drastically decrease framerate. You must call ProjectedTexture:Update after using this function for it to take effect.

functions.name: SetFarZ
functions.description:
Sets the distance at which the projected texture ends.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

functions.name: SetFOV
functions.description:
Sets the angle of projection.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

arguments.name: fov
arguments.description: Must be higher than 0 and lower than 180

functions.name: SetHorizontalFOV
functions.description:
Sets the horizontal angle of projection without affecting the vertical angle.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

arguments.name: hFOV
arguments.description: The new horizontal Field Of View for the projected texture. Must be in range between 0 and 180.

functions.name: SetLinearAttenuation
functions.description:
Sets the linear attenuation of the projected texture.

See also <page>ProjectedTexture:SetConstantAttenuation</page> and <page>ProjectedTexture:SetQuadraticAttenuation</page>.

The default value of linear attenuation when the projected texture is created is 100. (others are 0, as you are not supposed to mix them)

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

functions.name: SetNearZ
functions.description:
Sets the distance at which the projected texture begins its projection.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

<note>Setting this to 0 will disable the projected texture completely! This may be useful if you want to disable a projected texture without actually removing it</note>

<note>This seems to affect the rendering of shadows - a higher Near Z value will have shadows begin to render closer to their casting object. Comparing a low Near Z value (like 1) with a normal one (12) or high one (1000) is the easiest way to understand this artifact</note>

functions.name: SetOrthographic
functions.description:
Changes the current projected texture between orthographic and perspective projection.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

arguments.name: orthographic
arguments.description: When false, all other arguments are ignored and the texture is reset to perspective projection.

arguments.name: left
arguments.description: The amount of units left from the projected texture's origin to project.

arguments.name: top
arguments.description: The amount of units upwards from the projected texture's origin to project.

arguments.name: right
arguments.description: The amount of units right from the projected texture's origin to project.

arguments.name: bottom
arguments.description: The amount of units downwards from the projected texture's origin to project.

functions.name: SetPos
functions.description:
Move the Projected Texture to the specified position.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

functions.name: SetQuadraticAttenuation
functions.description:
Sets the quadratic attenuation of the projected texture.

See also <page>ProjectedTexture:SetLinearAttenuation</page> and <page>ProjectedTexture:SetConstantAttenuation</page>.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

functions.name: SetTexture
functions.description:
Sets the texture to be projected.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

arguments.name: texture
arguments.description: The name of the texture. Can also be an <page>ITexture</page>.

functions.name: SetTextureFrame
functions.description:
For animated textures, this will choose which frame in the animation will be projected.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

arguments.name: frame
arguments.description: The frame index to use.

functions.name: SetVerticalFOV
functions.description:
Sets the vertical angle of projection without affecting the horizontal angle.

You must call <page>ProjectedTexture:Update</page> after using this function for it to take effect.

arguments.name: vFOV
arguments.description: The new vertical Field Of View for the projected texture. Must be in range between 0 and 180.

functions.name: Update
functions.description: Updates the Projected Light and applies all previously set parameters.

name: Schedule
description: The object returned by <page>ai_schedule.New</page>.

functions.name: AddTask
functions.description:
Adds a task to the schedule. See also <page>Schedule:AddTaskEx</page> if you wish to customize task start and run function names.

See also <page>ENTITY:StartSchedule</page>, <page>NPC:StartEngineTask</page>, and <page>NPC:RunEngineTask</page>.

arguments.name: taskname
arguments.description: Custom task name

arguments.name: taskdata
arguments.description: Task data to be passed into the NPC's functions

functions.name: AddTaskEx
functions.description:
Adds a task to the schedule with completely custom function names.

See also <page>Schedule:AddTask</page>.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: The full name of a function on the entity's table to be ran when the task is started.

arguments.name: run
arguments.description: The full name of a function on the entity's table to be ran when the task is continuously running.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: Task data to be passed into the NPC's functions

functions.name: EngTask
functions.description: Adds an engine task to the schedule.

arguments.name: taskname
arguments.description: Task name, see [ai_task.h](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/server/ai_task.h#L89-L502)

arguments.name: taskdata
arguments.description: Task data, can be a float.

functions.name: GetTask
functions.description: Returns the task at the given index.

arguments.name: num
arguments.description: Task index.

functions.name: Init
functions.description: <internal></internal> Initialises the Schedule. Called by <page>ai_schedule.New</page> when the Schedule is created.

arguments.name: debugName
arguments.description: The name passed from <page>ai_schedule.New</page>.

functions.name: NumTasks
functions.description: Returns the number of tasks in the schedule.

returnValues.description: The number of tasks in this schedule.

name: Stack
description:
An object returned by <page>util.Stack</page>.

Like a Lua table, a Stack is a container. It follows the principle of LIFO (last in, first out).

The Stack works like a stack of papers: the first page you put down (push) will be the last one you remove (pop). That also means that the last page you put down, will be the first to be removed.

functions.name: Pop
functions.description: Pop an item from the stack

arguments.name: amount
arguments.description: Amount of items you want to pop.

functions.name: Push
functions.description: Push an item onto the stack

arguments.name: object
arguments.description: The item you want to push

functions.name: Size
functions.description: Returns the size of the stack

returnValues.description: The size of the stack

functions.name: Top
functions.description: Get the item at the top of the stack

returnValues.description: The item at the top of the stack

name: SurfaceInfo
description:
A brush surface object returned by <page>Entity:GetBrushSurfaces</page>.

Brush surfaces are a part of what makes up the map geometry aside from displacements. Any primitive brush model, including most breakable windows, can be represented by this object.

<note>This object internally uses the SurfaceHandle_t class, which is an alias for msurface2_t*.</note>

functions.name: GetMaterial
functions.description: Returns the brush surface's material.

returnValues.description: Material of one portion of a brush model.

functions.name: GetVertices
functions.description: Returns a list of vertices the brush surface is built from.

returnValues.description: A list of <page>Vector</page> points. This will usually be 4 corners of a quadrilateral in counter-clockwise order.

functions.name: IsNoDraw
functions.description:
Checks if the brush surface is a nodraw surface, meaning it will not be drawn by the engine.

<note>This internally checks the SURFDRAW_NODRAW flag.</note>

returnValues.description: Returns true if this surface won't be drawn.

functions.name: IsSky
functions.description:
Checks if the brush surface is displaying the skybox.

<note>This internally checks the SURFDRAW_SKY flag.</note>

returnValues.description: Returns true if the surface is the sky.

functions.name: IsWater
functions.description:
Checks if the brush surface is water.

<note>This internally checks the SURFDRAW_WATER flag.</note>

returnValues.description: Returns true if the surface is water.

name: Task
description: A single AI task. Returned by <page>ai_task.New</page>.

functions.name: Init
functions.description: <internal></internal> Initialises the AI task. Called by <page>ai_task.New</page>.

functions.name: InitEngine
functions.description: Initialises the AI task as an engine task.

arguments.name: taskname
arguments.description: The name of the task.

functions.name: InitFunctionName
functions.description: Initialises the AI task as NPC method-based.

arguments.name: startname
arguments.description: The name of the NPC method to call on task start.

arguments.name: runname
arguments.description: The name of the NPC method to call on task run.

functions.name: IsEngineType
functions.description: Determines if the task is an engine task (`TYPE_ENGINE`, 1).

functions.name: IsFNameType
functions.description: Determines if the task is an NPC method-based task (`TYPE_FNAME`, 2).

functions.name: Run
functions.description: Runs the AI task.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The NPC to run the task on.

functions.name: Run_FName
functions.description: <internal></internal> Runs the AI task as an NPC method. This requires the task to be of type `TYPE_FNAME`.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The NPC to run the task on.

functions.name: Start
functions.description: Starts the AI task.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The NPC to start the task on.

functions.name: Start_FName
functions.description: <internal></internal> Starts the AI task as an NPC method.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The NPC to start the task on.

name: Tool
description:
A list of functions available inside a Sandbox Toolgun tool.

You can find the hooks  and members <page text="here">Structures/TOOL</page>.

functions.name: Allowed
functions.description:
Checks whether the tool is allowed on the server. This will always return true clientside and will not be affected by <page>SANDBOX:CanTool</page>.

This function uses **TOOL.AllowedCVar** which is a <page>ConVar</page> object pointing to  **toolmode_allow_`*toolname***` convar.

returnValues.description: Returns true if the tool is allowed.

functions.name: BuildConVarList
functions.description: Builds a list of all ConVars set via the ClientConVar variable on the <page>Structures/TOOL</page> and their default values. This is used for the preset system.

returnValues.name: convars
returnValues.description: A list of all convars and their default values.

functions.name: CheckObjects
functions.description:
<internal>This is called automatically for most toolgun actions so you shouldn't need to use it.</internal>

Checks all added objects to see if they're still valid, if not, clears the list of objects.

functions.name: ClearObjects
functions.description: Clears all objects previously set with <page>Tool:SetObject</page>.

functions.name: Create
functions.description:
<internal>This is called automatically for all tools.</internal>
Initializes the tool object

returnValues.name: tool
returnValues.description: The created tool object.

functions.name: CreateConVars
functions.description:
<internal>This is called automatically for all tools.</internal>

Creates clientside ConVars based on the ClientConVar table specified in the tool structure. Also creates the 'toolmode_allow_X' ConVar.

functions.name: GetBone
functions.description: Retrieves a physics bone number previously stored using <page>Tool:SetObject</page>.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The id of the object which was set in <page>Tool:SetObject</page>.

returnValues.description: Associated physics bone with given id.

functions.name: GetClientInfo
functions.description: Attempts to grab a clientside tool <page>ConVar</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the convar to retrieve. The function will automatically add the "mytoolfilename_" part to it.

returnValues.description: The value of the requested <page>ConVar</page>.

functions.name: GetClientNumber
functions.description: Attempts to grab a clientside tool <page>ConVar</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the convar to retrieve. The function will automatically add the "mytoolfilename_" part to it.

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: The default value to return in case the lookup fails.

returnValues.description: The value of the requested <page>ConVar</page>.

functions.name: GetEnt
functions.description: Retrieves an Entity previously stored using <page>Tool:SetObject</page>.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The id of the object which was set in <page>Tool:SetObject</page>.

returnValues.description: Associated Entity with given id.

functions.name: GetHelpText
functions.description: Returns a language key based on this tool's name and the current stage it is on.

returnValues.name: key
returnValues.description: The returned language key, for example `"#tool.weld.1"`

functions.name: GetLocalPos
functions.description:
Retrieves an local vector previously stored using <page>Tool:SetObject</page>.
See also <page>Tool:GetPos</page>.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The id of the object which was set in <page>Tool:SetObject</page>.

returnValues.description: Associated local vector with given id.

functions.name: GetMode
functions.description: Returns the name of the current tool mode.

returnValues.description: The current tool mode.

functions.name: GetNormal
functions.description: Retrieves an normal vector previously stored using <page>Tool:SetObject</page>.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The id of the object which was set in <page>Tool:SetObject</page>.

returnValues.description: Associated normal vector with given id.

functions.name: GetOperation
functions.description: Returns the current operation of the tool set by <page>Tool:SetOperation</page>.

returnValues.description: The current operation the tool is at.

functions.name: GetOwner
functions.description: Returns the owner of this tool.

returnValues.description: Player using the tool

functions.name: GetPhys
functions.description:
Retrieves an <page>PhysObj</page> previously stored using <page>Tool:SetObject</page>.
See also <page>Tool:GetEnt</page>.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The id of the object which was set in <page>Tool:SetObject</page>.

returnValues.description: Associated PhysObj with given id. If it wasn't specified, returns current <page>PhysObj</page> of associated Entity

functions.name: GetPos
functions.description: Retrieves an vector previously stored using <page>Tool:SetObject</page>. See also <page>Tool:GetLocalPos</page>.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The id of the object which was set in <page>Tool:SetObject</page>.

returnValues.description: Associated vector with given id. The vector is converted from <page>Tool:GetLocalPos</page>.

functions.name: GetServerInfo
functions.description:
Attempts to grab a serverside tool <page>ConVar</page>.
This will not do anything on client, despite the function being defined shared.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the convar to retrieve. The function will automatically add the "mytoolfilename_" part to it.

returnValues.description: The value of the requested <page>ConVar</page>.

functions.name: GetStage
functions.description: Returns the current stage of the tool set by <page>Tool:SetStage</page>.

returnValues.description: The current stage of the current operation the tool is at.

functions.name: MakeGhostEntity
functions.description:
Initializes the ghost entity with the given model. Removes any old ghost entity if called multiple times.

The ghost is a regular prop_physics entity in singleplayer games, and a clientside prop in multiplayer games.

arguments.name: model
arguments.description: The model of the new ghost entity

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: Position to initialize the ghost entity at, usually not needed since this is updated in <page>Tool:UpdateGhostEntity</page>.

arguments.name: angle
arguments.description: Angle to initialize the ghost entity at, usually not needed since this is updated in <page>Tool:UpdateGhostEntity</page>.

functions.name: NumObjects
functions.description:
Returns the amount of stored objects ( <page>Entity</page>s ) the tool has.
<validate>Are TOOLs limited to 4 entities?</validate>

returnValues.description: The amount of stored objects, or <page>Tool:GetStage</page> clientide.

functions.name: ReleaseGhostEntity
functions.description: Removes any ghost entity created for this tool.

functions.name: SetObject
functions.description:
Stores an <page>Entity</page> for later use in the tool.

The stored values can be retrieved by <page>Tool:GetEnt</page>, <page>Tool:GetPos</page>, <page>Tool:GetLocalPos</page>, <page>Tool:GetPhys</page>, <page>Tool:GetBone</page> and <page>Tool:GetNormal</page>

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The id of the object to store.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to store.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description:
The position to store.
this position is in **global space** and is internally converted to **local space** relative to the object, so when you retrieve it later it will be corrected to the object's new position

arguments.name: phys
arguments.description: The physics object to store.

arguments.name: bone
arguments.description: The hit bone to store.

arguments.name: normal
arguments.description: The hit normal to store.

functions.name: SetOperation
functions.description:
Sets the current operation of the tool. Does nothing clientside. See also <page>Tool:SetStage</page>.

Operations and stages work as follows:
* Operation 1
* * Stage 1
* * Stage 2
* * Stage 3
* Operation 2
* * Stage 1
* * Stage 2
* * Stage ...

arguments.name: operation
arguments.description: The new operation ID to set.

functions.name: SetStage
functions.description:
Sets the current stage of the tool. Does nothing clientside.

See also <page>Tool:SetOperation</page>.

arguments.name: stage
arguments.description: The new stage to set.

functions.name: StartGhostEntity
functions.description: Initializes the ghost entity based on the supplied entity.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to copy ghost parameters off

functions.name: UpdateData
functions.description:
<internal>Called on deploy automatically</internal>

Sets the tool's stage to how many stored objects the tool has.

functions.name: UpdateGhostEntity
functions.description:
Updates the position and orientation of the ghost entity based on where the toolgun owner is looking along with data from object with id 1 set by <page>Tool:SetObject</page>.

This should be called in the tool's <page>TOOL:Think</page> hook.

This command is only used for tools that move props, such as easy weld, axis and motor. If you want to update a ghost like the thruster tool does it for example, check its [source code](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/gamemodes/sandbox/entities/weapons/gmod_tool/stools/thruster.lua#L179).

name: Vector
description:
List of all possible functions to manipulate vectors.

Created by <page>Global.Vector</page>.

Type   | Name           | Description
------ | -------------- | ------------------------------
<page>number</page> | `x` or `1` | The X component of the vector.
<page>number</page> | `y` or `2` | The Y component of the vector.
<page>number</page> | `z` or `3` | The Z component of the vector.

Metamethod | Second Operand | Description
---------- | -------------- | -----------
`__add` | <page>Vector</page> | Returns new <page>Vector</page> with the result of addition.
`__div` | <page>number</page> | Returns new <page>Vector</page> with the result of division.
`__eq` | <page>any</page> | Compares 2 operands, if they both are <page>Vector</page>, compares each individual component.
`__index` | <page>number</page> or <page>string</page> | Gets the component of the <page>Vector</page>. Returns a <page>number</page>.
`__mul` | <page>number</page> or <page>Vector</page>| Returns new <page>Vector</page> with the result of multiplication.
`__newindex` | <page>number</page> or <page>string</page> | Sets the component of the <page>Vector</page>. Accepts <page>number</page> and <page>string</page>.
`__sub` | <page>Vector</page> | Returns new <page>Vector</page> with the result of subtraction.
`__tostring` | | Returns `x y z`.
`__unm` | | Returns new <page>Vector</page> with the result of negation.

functions.name: Add
functions.description: Adds the values of the argument vector to the orignal vector. This functions the same as vector1 + vector2 without creating a new vector object, skipping object construction and garbage collection.

arguments.name: vector
arguments.description: The vector to add.

functions.name: Angle
functions.description: Returns an angle representing the normal of the vector.

returnValues.description: The angle/direction of the vector.

functions.name: AngleEx
functions.description: Returns the angle of the vector, but instead of assuming that up is <page>Global.Vector</page>( 0, 0, 1 ) (Like <page>Vector:Angle</page> does) you can specify which direction is 'up' for the angle.

arguments.name: up
arguments.description: The up direction vector

returnValues.description: The angle

functions.name: Cross
functions.description:
Calculates the cross product of this vector and the passed one.

The cross product of two vectors is a 3-dimensional vector with a direction perpendicular (at right angles) to both of them (according to the right-hand rule), and magnitude equal to the area of parallelogram they span. This is defined as the product of the magnitudes, the sine of the angle between them, and unit (normal) vector `n` defined by the right-hand rule:
:**a**  **b** = |**a**| |**b**| sin() **n**
where **a** and **b** are vectors, and **n** is a unit vector (magnitude of 1) perpendicular to both.

arguments.name: otherVector
arguments.description: Vector to calculate the cross product with.

returnValues.description: The cross product of the two vectors.

functions.name: Distance
functions.description:
Returns the euclidean distance between the vector and the other vector.

<warning>This is a relatively expensive process since it uses the square root. It is recommended that you use <page>Vector:DistToSqr</page> whenever possible.</warning>

arguments.name: otherVector
arguments.description: The vector to get the distance to.

returnValues.description: Distance between the vectors.

functions.name: DistToSqr
functions.description: Returns the squared distance of 2 vectors, this is faster than <page>Vector:Distance</page> as calculating the square root is an expensive process.

arguments.name: otherVec
arguments.description: The vector to calculate the distance to.

returnValues.description: Squared distance to the vector

functions.name: Div
functions.description: Divide the vector by the given number, that means x, y and z are divided by that value. This will change the value of the original vector, see example 2 for division without changing the value.

arguments.name: divisor
arguments.description: The value to divide the vector with.

functions.name: Dot
functions.description:
Returns the [dot product](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dot_product#Geometric_definition) of this vector and the passed one. The dot product of two vectors is the product of their magnitudes (lengths), and the cosine of the angle between them:

**a b** = |**a**| |**b**| cos()

where **a** and **b** are vectors.

See Vector:Length for obtaining magnitudes. A dot product returns just the cosine of the angle if both vectors are normalized, and zero if the vectors are at right angles to each other.

arguments.name: otherVector
arguments.description: The vector to calculate the dot product with

returnValues.description: The dot product between the two vectors

functions.name: DotProduct
functions.description: <deprecated>This is an alias of <page>Vector:Dot</page>. Use that instead.</deprecated>Returns the dot product of the two vectors.

arguments.name: Vector
arguments.description: The other vector.

returnValues.description: Dot Product

functions.name: GetNormal
functions.description:
<deprecated>Use <page>Vector:GetNormalized</page> instead.</deprecated>

Returns a normalized version of the vector. This is a alias of <page>Vector:GetNormalized</page>.

returnValues.description: Normalized version of the vector.

functions.name: GetNormalized
functions.description:
Returns a normalized version of the vector. Normalized means vector with same direction but with length of 1.

This does not affect the vector you call it on; to do this, use <page>Vector:Normalize</page>.

returnValues.description: Normalized version of the vector.

functions.name: IsEqualTol
functions.description: Returns if the vector is equal to another vector with the given tolerance.

arguments.name: compare
arguments.description: The vector to compare to.

arguments.name: tolerance
arguments.description: The tolerance range.

returnValues.description: Are the vectors equal or not.

functions.name: IsZero
functions.description: Checks whenever all fields of the vector are 0.

returnValues.description: Do all fields of the vector equal 0 or not

functions.name: Length
functions.description: Returns the Euclidean length of the vector: x + y + z

returnValues.description: Length of the vector.

functions.name: Length2D
functions.description: Returns the length of the vector in two dimensions, without the Z axis.

returnValues.description: Length of the vector in two dimensions, (x + y)

functions.name: Length2DSqr
functions.description:
Returns the squared length of the vectors x and y value, x + y.

This is faster than <page>Vector:Length2D</page> as calculating the square root is an expensive process.

returnValues.description: Squared length of the vector in two dimensions

functions.name: LengthSqr
functions.description:
Returns the squared length of the vector, x + y + z.

This is faster than <page>Vector:Length</page> as calculating the square root is an expensive process.

returnValues.description: Squared length of the vector

functions.name: Mul
functions.description: Scales the vector by the given number, that means x, y and z are multiplied by that value.

arguments.name: multiplier
arguments.description: The value to scale the vector with.

functions.name: Normalize
functions.description: Normalizes the given vector. This changes the vector you call it on, if you want to return a normalized copy without affecting the original, use <page>Vector:GetNormalized</page>.

functions.name: Rotate
functions.description:
Rotates a vector by the given angle.
Doesn't return anything, but rather changes the original vector.

arguments.name: rotation
arguments.description: The angle to rotate the vector by.

functions.name: Set
functions.description: Copies the values from the second vector to the first vector.

arguments.name: vector
arguments.description: The vector to copy from.

functions.name: SetUnpacked
functions.description: Sets the x, y, and z of the vector.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The x component

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The y component

arguments.name: z
arguments.description: The z component

functions.name: Sub
functions.description: Substracts the values of the second vector from the orignal vector, this function can be used to avoid garbage collection.

arguments.name: vector
arguments.description: The other vector.

functions.name: ToColor
functions.description:
Translates the Vector (values ranging from 0 to 1) into a Color. This will also range the values from 0 - 1 to 0 - 255. x * 255 -> r
y * 255 -> g
z * 255 -> b This is the opposite of Color:ToVector

returnValues.description: The created <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: ToScreen
functions.description:
Returns where on the screen the specified position vector would appear. A related function is <page>gui.ScreenToVector</page>, which converts a 2D coordinate to a 3D direction.

<note>Should be called from a 3D rendering environment or after <page>cam.Start3D</page> or it may not work correctly.</note>

<bug issue="462">Errors in a render hook can make this value incorrect until the player restarts their game.</bug>

<bug issue="1404"><page>cam.Start3D</page> or 3D context <page>cam.Start</page> with non-default parameters incorrectly sets the reference FOV for this function, causing incorrect return values. This can be fixed by creating and ending a default 3D context (<page>cam.Start3D</page> with no arguments).</bug>

returnValues.description: The created <page>Structures/ToScreenData</page>.

functions.name: ToTable
functions.description: Returns the vector as a table with three elements.

returnValues.description: The table with elements 1 = x, 2 = y, 3 = z.

functions.name: Unpack
functions.description: Returns the x, y, and z of the vector.

returnValues.description: x or Vector[1].
y or Vector[2].
z or Vector[3].

functions.name: WithinAABox
functions.description: Returns whenever the given vector is in a box created by the 2 other vectors.

arguments.name: boxStart
arguments.description: The first vector.

arguments.name: boxEnd
arguments.description: The second vector.

returnValues.description: Is the vector in the box or not

functions.name: Zero
functions.description: Sets x, y and z to 0.

name: Vehicle
description: This is a list of all methods only available for vehicles. It is also possible to call [Entity](http://wiki.garrysmod.com/index.php?title=Category:Entity) functions on vehicles.

functions.name: BoostTimeLeft
functions.description: Returns the remaining boosting time left.

returnValues.description: The remaining boosting time left

functions.name: CheckExitPoint
functions.description: Tries to find an Exit Point for leaving vehicle, if one is unobstructed in the direction given.

arguments.name: yaw
arguments.description: Yaw/roll from vehicle angle to check for exit

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: Distance from origin to drop player

returnValues.description: Returns the vector for exit position or nil if cannot exit that way.

functions.name: EnableEngine
functions.description: Sets whether the engine is enabled or disabled, i.e. can be started or not.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Enable or disable the engine

functions.name: GetAmmo
functions.description: Returns information about the ammo of the vehicle

returnValues.description: Ammo type of the vehicle ammo
Clip size
Count

functions.name: GetCameraDistance
functions.description: Returns third person camera distance.

returnValues.description: Camera distance

functions.name: GetDriver
functions.description: Gets the driver of the vehicle, returns NULL if no driver is present.

returnValues.description: The driver of the vehicle

functions.name: GetHLSpeed
functions.description: Returns the current speed of the vehicle in Half-Life Hammer Units (in/s). Same as <page>Entity:GetVelocity</page> + <page>Vector:Length</page>.

returnValues.description: The speed of the vehicle

functions.name: GetMaxSpeed
functions.description: Returns the max speed of the vehicle in MPH.

returnValues.description: The max speed of the vehicle in MPH

functions.name: GetOperatingParams
functions.description: Returns some info about the vehicle.

returnValues.description: The operating params. See <page>Structures/OperatingParams</page>.

functions.name: GetPassenger
functions.description: Gets the passenger of the vehicle, returns NULL if no drivers is present.

arguments.name: passenger
arguments.description: The index of the passenger

returnValues.description: The passenger

functions.name: GetPassengerSeatPoint
functions.description: Returns the seat position and angle of a given passenger seat.

arguments.name: role
arguments.description: The passenger role. ( 1 is the driver )

returnValues.description: The seat position
The seat angle

functions.name: GetRPM
functions.description: Returns the current RPM of the vehicle. This value is fake and doesn't actually affect the vehicle movement.

returnValues.description: The RPM.

functions.name: GetSpeed
functions.description: Returns the current speed of the vehicle in MPH.

returnValues.description: The speed of the vehicle in MPH

functions.name: GetSteering
functions.description: Returns the current steering of the vehicle.

returnValues.description: The current steering of the vehicle.

functions.name: GetSteeringDegrees
functions.description: Returns the maximum steering degree of the vehicle

returnValues.description: The maximum steering degree of the vehicle

functions.name: GetThirdPersonMode
functions.description: Returns if vehicle has thirdperson mode enabled or not.

returnValues.description: Returns true if third person mode enabled, false otherwise

functions.name: GetThrottle
functions.description: Returns the current throttle of the vehicle.

returnValues.description: The current throttle of the vehicle

functions.name: GetVehicleClass
functions.description: Returns the vehicle class name. This is only useful for Sandbox spawned vehicles or any vehicle that properly sets the vehicle class with <page>Vehicle:SetVehicleClass</page>.

returnValues.description: The class name of the vehicle.

functions.name: GetVehicleParams
functions.description: Returns the vehicle parameters of given vehicle.
