returnValues.description: The vehicle parameters. See <page>Structures/VehicleParams</page>

functions.name: GetVehicleViewPosition
functions.description: Returns the view position and forward angle of a given passenger seat.

arguments.name: role
arguments.description: The passenger role. 0 is the driver. This parameter seems to be ignored by the game engine and is therefore optional.

returnValues.description: The view position, will be 0, 0, 0 on failure
The view angles, will be 0, 0, 0 on failure
The field of view, will be 0 on failure

functions.name: GetWheel
functions.description: Returns the <page>PhysObj</page> of given wheel.

arguments.name: wheel
arguments.description: The wheel to retrieve

returnValues.description: The wheel

functions.name: GetWheelBaseHeight
functions.description: Returns the base wheel height.

arguments.name: wheel
arguments.description: The wheel to get the base wheel height of.

returnValues.description: The base wheel height.

functions.name: GetWheelContactPoint
functions.description: Returns the wheel contact point.

arguments.name: wheel
arguments.description: The wheel to check

returnValues.description: The contact position
The Surface Properties ID of hit surface.
Whether the wheel is on ground or not

functions.name: GetWheelCount
functions.description: Returns the wheel count of the vehicle

returnValues.description: The amount of wheels

functions.name: GetWheelTotalHeight
functions.description: Returns the total wheel height.

arguments.name: wheel
arguments.description: The wheel to get the base wheel height of.

returnValues.description: The total wheel height.

functions.name: HasBoost
functions.description: Returns whether this vehicle has boost at all.

returnValues.description: Whether this vehicle has boost at all.

functions.name: HasBrakePedal
functions.description: Returns whether this vehicle has a brake pedal. See <page>Vehicle:SetHasBrakePedal</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether this vehicle has a brake pedal or not.

functions.name: IsBoosting
functions.description: Returns whether this vehicle is currently boosting or not.

returnValues.description: Whether this vehicle is currently boosting or not.

functions.name: IsEngineEnabled
functions.description: Returns whether the engine is enabled or not, i.e. whether it can be started.

returnValues.description: Whether the engine is enabled

functions.name: IsEngineStarted
functions.description: Returns whether the engine is started or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the engine is started or not.

returnValues.description: Is the vehicle a valid vehicle or not

functions.name: IsVehicleBodyInWater
functions.description: Returns whether this vehicle's engine is underwater or not. ( Internally the attachment point "engine" or "vehicle_engine" is checked )

returnValues.description: Whether this vehicle's engine is underwater or not.

functions.name: ReleaseHandbrake
functions.description:
Releases the vehicle's handbrake (Jeep) so it can roll without any passengers.

This will be overwritten if the vehicle has a driver. Same as <page>Vehicle:SetHandbrake</page>( false )

functions.name: SetBoost
functions.description: Sets the boost. It is possible that this function does not work while the vehicle has a valid driver in it.

arguments.name: boost
arguments.description: The new boost value

functions.name: SetCameraDistance
functions.description: Sets the third person camera distance of the vehicle.

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: Camera distance to set to

functions.name: SetHandbrake
functions.description:
Turns on or off the Jeep handbrake so it can roll without a driver inside.

Does nothing while the vehicle has a driver in it.

arguments.name: handbrake
arguments.description: true to turn on, false to turn off.

functions.name: SetHasBrakePedal
functions.description: Sets whether this vehicle has a brake pedal.

arguments.name: brakePedal
arguments.description: Whether this vehicle has a brake pedal

functions.name: SetMaxReverseThrottle
functions.description: Sets maximum reverse throttle

arguments.name: maxRevThrottle
arguments.description: The new maximum throttle. This number must be negative.

functions.name: SetMaxThrottle
functions.description: Sets maximum forward throttle

arguments.name: maxThrottle
arguments.description: The new maximum throttle.

functions.name: SetSpringLength
functions.description: Sets spring length of given wheel

arguments.name: wheel
arguments.description: The wheel to change spring length of

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: The new spring length

functions.name: SetSteering
functions.description:
Sets the steering of the vehicle.
<validate>The correct range, 0 to 1 or -1 to 1</validate>

arguments.name: front
arguments.description: Angle of the front wheels (-1 to 1)

arguments.name: rear
arguments.description: Angle of the rear wheels (-1 to 1)

functions.name: SetSteering
functions.description:
Sets the steering of the vehicle.
<validate>The correct range, 0 to 1 or -1 to 1</validate>

arguments.name: front
arguments.description: Angle of the front wheels (-1 to 1)

arguments.name: rear
arguments.description: Angle of the rear wheels (-1 to 1)

functions.name: SetSteeringDegrees
functions.description: Sets the maximum steering degrees of the vehicle

arguments.name: steeringDegrees
arguments.description: The new maximum steering degree

functions.name: SetThirdPersonMode
functions.description: Sets the third person mode state.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Enable or disable the third person mode for this vehicle

functions.name: SetThrottle
functions.description: Sets the throttle of the vehicle. It is possible that this function does not work with a valid driver in it.

arguments.name: throttle
arguments.description: The new throttle.

functions.name: SetVehicleClass
functions.description: <internal></internal>Sets the vehicle class name.

arguments.name: class
arguments.description: The vehicle class name to set

functions.name: SetVehicleEntryAnim
functions.description: Sets whether the entry or exit camera animation should be played or not.

arguments.name: bOn
arguments.description: Whether the entry or exit camera animation should be played or not.

functions.name: SetVehicleParams
functions.description:
Sets the vehicle parameters for given vehicle.

<note>Not all variables from the <page>Structures/VehicleParams</page> can be set.</note>

<bug issue="2625">Because this method uses miles per hour but <page>Vehicle:GetVehicleParams</page> returns Hammer units per second, this method incorrectly modifies the vehicle engine's "boostMaxSpeed", "maxRevSpeed" and "maxSpeed" even when not explicitly set in a call to this method.

**Workaround**: In order to retain the original values for these fields, call <page>Vehicle:GetVehicleParams</page> yourself, convert the mentioned fields from Hammer units per second to miles per hour (1 MPH  17.6 HU/s in this case) and add them to the table passed into the call to this setter. Avoid doing this repeatedly to avoid floating point inaccuracies over time (store the ready-calculated value for next time if possible).</bug>

arguments.name: params
arguments.description: The new new vehicle parameters. See <page>Structures/VehicleParams</page>

functions.name: SetWheelFriction
functions.description: Sets friction of given wheel.  This function may be broken.

arguments.name: wheel
arguments.description: The wheel to change the friction of

arguments.name: friction
arguments.description: The new friction to set

functions.name: StartEngine
functions.description: Starts or stops the engine.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: True to start, false to stop.

name: VMatrix
description:
List of all possible functions to manipulate matrices.

This object can be created by <page>Global.Matrix</page>.

Metamethod | Second Operand | Description
---------- | -------------- | -----------
`__add` | <page>VMatrix</page> | Returns new <page>VMatrix</page> with the result of addition.
`__eq` | <page>any</page> | Compares 2 operands, if they both are <page>VMatrix</page>, compares each individual component.
`__mul` | <page>VMatrix</page> or <page>Vector</page> | Returns new <page>VMatrix</page> with the result of multiplication.
`__sub` | <page>VMatrix</page> | Returns new <page>VMatrix</page> with the result of subtraction.
`__tostring` |  | Returns a <page>string</page> in format `[%f,\t%f,\t%f,\t%f]\n[%f,\t%f,\t%f,\t%f]\n[%f,\t%f,\t%f,\t%f]\n[%f,\t%f,\t%f,\t%f]`.

functions.name: GetAngles
functions.description: Returns the absolute rotation of the matrix.

returnValues.description: Absolute rotation of the matrix

functions.name: GetField
functions.description: Returns a specific field in the matrix.

arguments.name: row
arguments.description: Row of the field whose value is to be retrieved, from 1 to 4

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: Column of the field whose value is to be retrieved, from 1 to 4

returnValues.description: The value of the specified field

functions.name: GetForward
functions.description:
Gets the forward direction of the matrix.

ie. The first column of the matrix, excluding the w coordinate.

returnValues.description: The forward direction of the matrix.

functions.name: GetInverse
functions.description:
Returns an inverted matrix without modifying the original matrix.

Inverting the matrix will fail if its [determinant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Determinant) is 0 or close to 0. (ie. its "scale" in any direction is 0.)

See also <page>VMatrix:GetInverseTR</page>.

returnValues.description: The inverted matrix if possible, nil otherwise

functions.name: GetInverseTR
functions.description:
Returns an inverted matrix without modifying the original matrix. This function will not fail, but only works correctly on matrices that contain only translation and/or rotation.

Using this function on a matrix with modified scale may return an incorrect inverted matrix.

To get the inverse of a matrix that contains other modifications, see <page>VMatrix:GetInverse</page>.

returnValues.description: The inverted matrix.

functions.name: GetRight
functions.description:
Gets the right direction of the matrix.

ie. The second column of the matrix, negated, excluding the w coordinate.

returnValues.description: The right direction of the matrix.

functions.name: GetScale
functions.description: Returns the absolute scale of the matrix.

returnValues.description: Absolute scale of the matrix

functions.name: GetTranslation
functions.description: Returns the absolute translation of the matrix.

returnValues.description: Absolute translation of the matrix

functions.name: GetUp
functions.description:
Gets the up direction of the matrix.

ie. The third column of the matrix, excluding the w coordinate.

returnValues.description: The up direction of the matrix.

functions.name: Identity
functions.description: Initializes the matrix as Identity matrix.

functions.name: Invert
functions.description:
Inverts the matrix.

Inverting the matrix will fail if its [determinant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Determinant) is 0 or close to 0. (ie. its "scale" in any direction is 0.)

If the matrix cannot be inverted, it does not get modified.

See also <page>VMatrix:InvertTR</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the matrix was inverted or not

functions.name: InvertTR
functions.description:
Inverts the matrix. This function will not fail, but only works correctly on matrices that contain only translation and/or rotation.

Using this function on a matrix with modified scale may return an incorrect inverted matrix.

To invert a matrix that contains other modifications, see <page>VMatrix:Invert</page>.

functions.name: IsIdentity
functions.description: Returns whether the matrix is equal to Identity matrix or not.

returnValues.description: Is the matrix an Identity matrix or not

functions.name: IsRotationMatrix
functions.description:
Returns whether the matrix is a rotation matrix or not.

Technically it checks if the forward, right and up vectors are orthogonal and normalized.

returnValues.description: Is the matrix a rotation matrix or not

functions.name: IsZero
functions.description: Checks whenever all fields of the matrix are 0, aka if this is a [null matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero_matrix).

returnValues.description: If the matrix is a null matrix.

functions.name: Rotate
functions.description:
Rotates the matrix by the given angle.

Postmultiplies the matrix by a rotation matrix (A = AR).

arguments.name: rotation
arguments.description: Rotation.

functions.name: Scale
functions.description:
Scales the matrix by the given vector.

Postmultiplies the matrix by a scaling matrix (A = AS).

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: Vector to scale with matrix with.

functions.name: ScaleTranslation
functions.description: Scales the absolute translation with the given value.

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: Value to scale the translation with.

functions.name: Set
functions.description: Copies values from the given matrix object.

arguments.name: src
arguments.description: The matrix to copy values from.

functions.name: SetAngles
functions.description: Sets the absolute rotation of the matrix.

arguments.name: angle
arguments.description: New angles.

functions.name: SetField
functions.description: Sets a specific field in the matrix.

arguments.name: row
arguments.description: Row of the field to be set, from 1 to 4

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: Column of the field to be set, from 1 to 4

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to set in that field

functions.name: SetForward
functions.description:
Sets the forward direction of the matrix.

ie. The first column of the matrix, excluding the w coordinate.

arguments.name: forward
arguments.description: The forward direction of the matrix.

functions.name: SetRight
functions.description:
Sets the right direction of the matrix.

ie. The second column of the matrix, negated, excluding the w coordinate.

arguments.name: forward
arguments.description: The right direction of the matrix.

functions.name: SetScale
functions.description: Modifies the scale of the matrix while preserving the rotation and translation.

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: The scale to set.

functions.name: SetTranslation
functions.description: Sets the absolute translation of the matrix.

arguments.name: translation
arguments.description: New translation.

functions.name: SetUnpacked
functions.description: Sets each component of the matrix.

functions.name: SetUp
functions.description:
Sets the up direction of the matrix.

ie. The third column of the matrix, excluding the w coordinate.

arguments.name: forward
arguments.description: The up direction of the matrix.

functions.name: ToTable
functions.description: Converts the matrix to a 4x4 table. See <page>Global.Matrix</page> function.

returnValues.description: The 4x4 table.

functions.name: Translate
functions.description:
Translates the matrix by the given vector aka. adds the vector to the translation.

Postmultiplies the matrix by a translation matrix (A = AT).

arguments.name: translation
arguments.description: Vector to translate the matrix by.

functions.name: Unpack
functions.description: Returns each component of the matrix, expanding rows before columns.

returnValues.description: <page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(1, 1)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(1, 2)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(1, 3)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(1, 4)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(2, 1)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(2, 2)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(2, 3)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(2, 4)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(3, 1)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(3, 2)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(3, 3)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(3, 4)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(4, 1)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(4, 2)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(4, 3)
<page>VMatrix:GetField</page>(4, 4)

functions.name: Zero
functions.description:
Sets all components of the matrix to 0, also known as a [null matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero_matrix).

This function is more efficient than setting each element manually.

name: Weapon
description:
This is a list of all methods only available for weapons. It is also possible to call <page>Entity</page> functions on weapons.

<note>A list of available methods has been expanded in your navigation bar.</note>

functions.name: AllowsAutoSwitchFrom
functions.description: Returns whether the weapon allows to being switched from when a better ( <page>Weapon:GetWeight</page> ) weapon is being picked up.

returnValues.description: Whether the weapon allows to being switched from.

functions.name: AllowsAutoSwitchTo
functions.description: Returns whether the weapon allows to being switched to when a better ( <page>Weapon:GetWeight</page> ) weapon is being picked up.

returnValues.description: Whether the weapon allows to being switched to.

functions.name: CallOnClient
functions.description:
Calls a SWEP function on client.

<warning>This uses the <page>usermessage</page> internally, because of that, the combined length of the arguments of this function may not exceed 254 bytes/characters or the function will cease to function!</warning>

arguments.name: functionName
arguments.description: Name of function to call. If you want to call SWEP:MyFunc() on client, you type in "MyFunc"

arguments.name: arguments
arguments.description:
Arguments for the function, separated by spaces.
<note>Only the second argument is passed as argument and must be a string</note>

functions.name: Clip1
functions.description: Returns how much primary ammo is in the magazine.

returnValues.description: The amount of primary ammo in the magazine.

functions.name: Clip2
functions.description: Returns how much secondary ammo is in magazine.

returnValues.description: The amount of secondary ammo in the magazine.

functions.name: DefaultReload
functions.description:
Forces the weapon to reload while playing given animation.
<note>
This will stop the <page>Weapon:Think</page> function from getting called while the weapon is reloading!
</note>

arguments.name: act
arguments.description: Sequence to use as reload animation. Uses the <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

returnValues.description: Did reloading actually take place

functions.name: GetActivity
functions.description:
Returns the sequence enumeration number that the weapon is playing.

<bug issue="2543">This can return inconsistent results between the server and client.</bug>

returnValues.description: Current activity, see <page>Enums/ACT</page>. Returns 0 if the weapon doesn't have active sequence.

functions.name: GetHoldType
functions.description: Returns the hold type of the weapon.

returnValues.description: The hold type of the weapon. You can find a list of default hold types <page text="here">Hold_Types</page>.

functions.name: GetMaxClip1
functions.description: Returns maximum primary clip size

returnValues.description: Maximum primary clip size

functions.name: GetMaxClip2
functions.description: Returns maximum secondary clip size

returnValues.description: Maximum secondary clip size

functions.name: GetNextPrimaryFire
functions.description: Gets the next time the weapon can primary fire. ( Can call <page>WEAPON:PrimaryAttack</page> )

returnValues.description: The time, relative to <page>Global.CurTime</page>

functions.name: GetNextSecondaryFire
functions.description: Gets the next time the weapon can secondary fire. ( Can call <page>WEAPON:SecondaryAttack</page> )

returnValues.description: The time, relative to <page>Global.CurTime</page>

functions.name: GetPrimaryAmmoType
functions.description: Gets the primary ammo type of the given weapon.

returnValues.description: The ammo type ID, or -1 if not found.

functions.name: GetPrintName
functions.description:
Returns the non-internal name of the weapon, that should be for displaying.

<note>If that returns an untranslated message (#HL2_XX), use <page>language.GetPhrase</page> to see the "nice" name.</note>
<note>If SWEP.PrintName is not set in the Weapon or the Weapon Base then "<MISSING SWEP PRINT NAME>" will be returned.</note>

returnValues.description: The "nice" name of the weapon.

functions.name: GetSecondaryAmmoType
functions.description: Gets the ammo type of the given weapons secondary fire.

returnValues.description: The secondary ammo type ID, or -1 if not found.

functions.name: GetSlot
functions.description: Returns the slot of the weapon (slot numbers start from 0)

returnValues.description: The slot of the weapon

functions.name: GetSlotPos
functions.description: Returns slot position of the weapon

returnValues.description: The slot position of the weapon

functions.name: GetWeaponViewModel
functions.description: Returns the view model of the weapon.

returnValues.description: The view model of the weapon.

functions.name: GetWeaponWorldModel
functions.description: Returns the world model of the weapon.

returnValues.description: The world model of the weapon.

functions.name: GetWeight
functions.description: Returns the "weight" of the weapon, which is used when deciding which <page>Weapon</page> is better by the engine.

returnValues.description: The weapon "weight".

functions.name: HasAmmo
functions.description:
Returns whether the weapon has ammo left or not. It will return false when there's no ammo left in the magazine **and** when there's no reserve ammo left.

<note>This will return true for weapons like crowbar, gravity gun, etc.</note>

returnValues.description: Whether the weapon has ammo or not.

functions.name: IsCarriedByLocalPlayer
functions.description: Returns whenever the weapon is carried by the local player.

returnValues.description: Is the weapon is carried by the local player or not

functions.name: IsScripted
functions.description: Checks if the weapon is a SWEP or a built-in weapon.

returnValues.description: Returns true if weapon is scripted ( SWEP ), false if not ( A built-in HL2 weapon )

functions.name: IsWeaponVisible
functions.description: Returns whether the weapon is visible. The term visibility is not exactly what gets checked here, first it checks if the owner is a player, then checks if the active view model has EF_NODRAW flag NOT set.

returnValues.description: Is visible or not

functions.name: LastShootTime
functions.description: Returns the time since this weapon last fired a bullet with <page>Entity:FireBullets</page> in seconds. It is not networked.

returnValues.description: The time in seconds when the last bullet was fired.

functions.name: SendWeaponAnim
functions.description: Forces weapon to play activity/animation.

arguments.name: act
arguments.description: Activity to play. See the <page>Enums/ACT</page> (specifically ACT_VM_).

functions.name: SetClip1
functions.description: Lets you change the number of bullets in the given weapons primary clip.

arguments.name: ammo
arguments.description: The amount of bullets the clip should contain

functions.name: SetClip2
functions.description: Lets you change the number of bullets in the given weapons secondary clip.

arguments.name: ammo
arguments.description: The amount of bullets the clip should contain

functions.name: SetHoldType
functions.description:
Sets the hold type of the weapon. This function also calls <page>WEAPON:SetWeaponHoldType</page> and properly networks it to all clients.

<note>This only works on scripted weapons.</note>

<bug>Using this function on weapons held by bots will not network holdtype changes to clients if the world model is set to an empty string (SWEP.WorldModel = "").</bug>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the hold type. You can find all default hold types <page text="here">Hold_Types</page>

functions.name: SetLastShootTime
functions.description: Sets the time since this weapon last fired in seconds. Used in conjunction with <page>Weapon:LastShootTime</page>

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: The time in seconds when the last time the weapon was fired.

functions.name: SetNextPrimaryFire
functions.description:
Sets when the weapon can fire again. Time should be based on <page>Global.CurTime</page>.

<bug issue="3786">This will fire extra bullets if the time is set to less than <page>Global.CurTime</page>.</bug>

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: Time when player should be able to use primary fire again

functions.name: SetNextSecondaryFire
functions.description: Sets when the weapon can alt-fire again. Time should be based on <page>Global.CurTime</page>.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: Time when player should be able to use secondary fire again
